campaign.story:
TrueBlack Forge is a husband/wife duo hand-polishing solid brass and iron coins from the fictional land of Dalmere for your tabletop games and RPGs!

While most fantasy coins fall into either the category of cheaper zinc-cast coins or expensive artisan-made collectible coins, we wanted to combine the best of both worlds: A beautiful, affordable RPG coin that also stands alone as shiny pieces of fantastical art!


These coins aren't cheaper zinc-cast coins that are plated, but solid metal blanks that are die-struck, just like the old fashioned way. We believe the most realistic-looking coins are ones that are made from the same materials and processes as real coins. 
Each set comes complete with a black burlap sack, and includes:
10x Silver Bullheads
   Solid iron, 23mm (larger than a nickel)
  20x Silver Sails
   Solid iron, 26mm (larger than a quarter)
  15x Golden Bastions
   Solid brass, 26mm (larger than a quarter)
  10x Golden Thrones
   Solid brass, 30mm (US half-dollar size)
  8x Teruzine Gems
   Glass crystal
   3x in 18mm, 5x in 14mm
  Every set of coins also comes with beautiful glass gems!
Each coin was designed and illustrated for a more realistic, grounded take on traditional fantasy coinage, focusing on symbols of the people, their beliefs and values, and their history.
The vessel for this history comes from the fictional kingdom of Dalmere, with mottos and inscriptions written in old english.

Check out the backstory of each coin's design below!
These Silver Sail coins are made from pure iron.
Heads up: Iron can rust in areas of high humidity! 

Dalmere is fueled by the “Silver Sail,” its most commonly used coin. Used as an intermediary piece, the Sail is valued at 10 silver “Bullheads” and 1/10 of a golden “Bastion”, and is traded in innumerable quantities across the kingdom daily. Used to hire laborers, buy everyday equipment, and stock up on bulk foodstuffs, this coin is truly the backbone of a civilization. Its obverse is stamped with its namesake, a sailing ship known as a “cog” or “roundship”, the hulking carriers that brought Dalmere wealth and prosperity over hundreds of years, with surrounding type roughly translated to “150 years (of) endless prosperity growing from/into the ocean”

   The coin’s reverse displays a scale for weighing and measuring goods and precious metals, a symbol of the coin’s daily and everlong task of facilitating trade across the kingdom, and is stamped with the words “Stability/Constancy, Growth”

 These Golden Bastion coins are made from pure brass. 

While the Silver Sail is the most commonly used coin in Dalmere, it is the “Bastion” that reigns as the golden standard. The gold coin sets the rate at which other coins are measured, and is the basis for one “gold piece.”
The obverse is stamped with the visage of Queen Ada Dalmere, wearing the blindfold synonymous with her person. Ada, born blind in an orphanage and childhood friend to King Petrus Dalmere, has stood as the embodiment of charity, kindness, and warmth for the people of Dalmere, her face encircled with the words “Strength is forgiveness” and “mercy”.
The commoner’s admiration for the queen has grown such that she is likened to the patron goddess of the lost and sick, Enala, whose symbol is the chalice stamped upon the reverse of the golden Bastion. There, Enala’s chalice stands above the seat of Dalmere’s power, Castle Gernsback, encircled with the words “Strong days, Bright days”.
 These Golden Throne coins are made from pure brass. 

The golden “Throne” is Dalmere’s highest minted denomination, valued at 10 golden Bastions. Always decreed to feature the head of the reigning king, the current Throne has been stamped with the visage of King Petrus Dalmere for the past 15 years, following the death of his father, King Reinnard Dalmere near the conclusion of the Sweeping Wars. A time of unrivaled expansion in exchange for an equally unrivaled cost of life, Petrus vowed to never again repeat such an age of bloody turmoil, and Dalmere has flourished in relative peace and economic growth since. His image is flanked by words translating to “pledged faith” and “brave deed”, with abbreviations for “always serving” atop his crown.
The reverse is emblazoned with the sigil of the kingdom, the Undutta-Elk and a shield featuring a hammer. Fabled to be the war mount of choice of the first founding fathers of the kingdom, the Undutta-Elk, now extinct and a beast of legend, was famed to be the strongest and most resilient of all animals, both kind and fiercely protective. Before the reign of King Petrus, the royal sigil featured only the elk and hammer. The six-sided shield was added relatively recently upon the king’s request, his symbol to signify the end of hostilities and an internal strengthening of the kingdom.

 These Silver Bullhead coins are made from pure iron. 
Heads up: Iron can rust in areas of high humidity!

The Silver Sail’s smaller brother is the silver “Bullhead,” the lowest denomination of Dalmere. It is most commonly used for trading the smallest of goods, meals, and favors, and is also usually the first coin a Dalmerian citizen is likely to own, particularly as a child entering the workforce.
Founded by a people that value hard work and perseverance, the humble and strong bull was elected its namesake, bearing the weight of labor and earning the vast majority of the working people’s livelihoods. This obverse also translates to “Strength, perseverance”.
The reverse is an homage to the working classes responsible for the sturdy foundation of the land: an axe for the woodsman, a hammer for the smith, and a bushel of wheat for the farmer. This side features the unusually inspiring mantra translating to “Great things start small.”
  These scintillating Teruzine gems are made from solid glass. 

“Teruzine,” discovered and primarily mined by the northern towns of Dalmere, is the most precious mineral export of the kingdom. Mount Lockett, the only known region of the continent harboring the stone, is settled at its base by the mining outposts of Carrading, Goldslode, and Lockett-Town, collectively known as the “Teru-town Three.”
Not particularly hard or resilient as compared to other precious stones, Teruzine finds little utilitarian purpose. Its warm yellow coloring and highly refractive facets earn it great acclaim by jewelers and collectors, though the vast majority of its great fame and value are instead earned by its more curious property: scent.
Teruzine, when heated at high temperature, can be ground and refined through the use of various acids and alcohols to produce an intensely warm, musky, and sweet perfume. It reportedly conjures feelings of comfort and memories of long-lost love and nostalgia. Colloquially known as "honeystone" for this reason, its perfumes are exported and sold across the known world. In high enough quantities and frequent enough exposure, the resulting substance can form a psychological addiction, though one that only the rich are in danger of affording.

updates.update_content:
Hello all, we are shipping starting tomorrow! It may take an extra day or two to get everything out, but the plan is to have all the May pledges done by the end of the week.

I just need your addresses filled out in your pledges and surveys, especially if you pledged for the May tiers. Get those responses in so I can ship out your loot on time!

updates.update_userinfo: Fill out those surveys! Shipping soon!
updates.update_content:
Hello friends, I've sent out surveys yesterday. With Kickstarter having initiated transfer of funds to my bank, we're getting ready to ship!

Be sure to fill out those surveys over the weekend. The plan is to start shipping around the middle of next week!

My UK friends: Her Majesty's Revenue and Customs has denied my application for a VAT account. Short story, I'll begin refunding your UK pledges tomorrow.

Long story: The reason given was that additional requested information wasn't sent, though I sent plenty of additional information within a 48 hour period after the request was received. What's odd is they requested the information to be sent via email; no online form or portal or site, just regular ol' email. It's my suspicion that they never received my emails. There's a petitioning process (also available via email) that could take an additional 1-3 months, but truthfully the UK government has shown that it's not very open to cooperating much with international shippers, so I'll be cutting my losses here. I'm sorry guys all!

Hey there! Just wanted to let everyone know that after the conclusion of the Kickstarter, Kickstarter usually takes about 2 weeks to collect all pledges and process the credit cards. After that, funds are sent to my bank account. 

At that point I'll start to ship out your rewards! Just wanted to give everyone a heads up just so you all know what we're waiting for. Thank you all for your patience!

Just one day left!
Last week I got my printer started on the tags that'll go with each sack of coins. They're just paper tags that you'll rip off the bags (with a choking hazard warning on the back), but still I feel it makes the project feel a lot more official. I got a proof photo from them today!

updates.update_userinfo: Planning for SUCCESSSS! Also, UK order reminders
updates.update_content:
Hey my dudes! We're just about halfway done and looking great. Thank you all for your awesome support, I'm super proud of these coins and very excited to have you all see them as well!

As a heads up, if you are in the UK, you need to add the UK VAT add-on. This is calculated on the $55 per pouch price, so at 20% UK VAT, it is about $11 per pouch. If you backed for more than one pouch, just add additional UK VAT add-ons until you reach the corresponding number of pouches.

We're off to a great start! 

Please feel free to ask me any and all questions because I'm super psyched about this and I love talking about it. There may be some production details I want to keep a trade secret, but if in doubt, ask anyway!

campaign.story:
Prepare for adventure in this huge open-world gamebook series. Legendary Kingdoms is a gamebook campaign, where you lead a party of adventurers in a world that adapts to your actions. Venture into ancient ruins, pick a side and lead an army into battle, sail the high seas on your own warship, defeat tyrants or restore them to power. Along the way your party will increase in skill, wealth and renown, allowing them to take on more challenging adventures. Reach the heights of power and you may uncover a dreadful threat to the world itself and go on a mission that spans all six gamebooks in the series.
So is this a Solo Gamebook or an RPG?
The Legendary Kingdoms series has been designed to be played solo, as a choose your own adventure gamebook. However, as you lead a party of four adventurers on an epic journey in a truly sandbox world, we have had playthroughs where one person has acted as the GM (Narrator) and four friends have taken on a character each.
It works just as well being played online as it does around a table.
Playtesters and backers have commented on how good this book is for someone who would love to have a go at being a GM, but are daunted by the task. With simple combat rules and the turns already written out, where better to have your first go at being a GM, than in Legendary Kingdoms.
Follow the link below and download a free sample and give it a go.
We are raising funds to produce the second book in the series, Book Two: Crown and Tower. Book One is already in print, and you can buy it here, or get it as part of a pledge bundle when you order Book Two. You can also play a fully illustrated free sample of book one here to experience a little of the gamebook adventure.

In total, Spidermind Games is planning to produce six titles in the legendary Kingdoms series. With your help we can bring book two, 'Crown & Tower' to life and begin work on the next in the series. It is our plan to release one title a year, completing the collection in 2025.
You can explore the world of Legendary Kingdoms in any order you choose. Each book is dedicated to a particular geographic area, but you can travel between books at will by walking or sailing off the edge of the map. Each book features dozens of quests and locations with an approximate 12+ hours of content in each.
Features of Legendary Kingdoms
A world that adapts to your choices. The book ‘remembers’ the friends you make and enemies you defeat. Slain kings will stay dead, and as you grow in fame people’s reactions to you will also change.
A changing world. Depending on your choices, new avenues of adventure, or new trouble, could await you in locations you have previously explored.
A detailed world. From the lawless deserts of the Valley of Bones, to the feudal hierarchies of the Kingdom of Royce. Embrace the wild freedoms of the buccaneering Splintered Isles, or face morbid darkness in the forges of Drakehallow.  Be the first to map the unexplored Savage Lands, or dethrone a corrupt king in the ludicrously wealthy Duchy of Pendrilor. Multi-book spanning quests allow you to further your ambitions in distant courts, and make friends in foreign nations that might help you when you visit their homeland.
Party based adventures. You are not alone, but can combine the skills of up to four different characters in your party.
The game can be played solo or in a group.  It also works online with one player acting as the reader!  A good lockdown game.
Characters that are grounded in the Legendary Kingdoms world. Each party member has ties to a different book in the series, and each has unresolved issues in their homeland. Characters can seek redemption, seize power, exact revenge or fall in love with other party members.
Fast paced but tactical personal combat.
Raise an army and fight mass combat battles with thousands of soldiers on each side. Conquered one realm? Transfer troops from one book to another if you can capture city-ports with access to ships.
Sail the world on your own ship. Gather an armada and defeat powerful rulers with your own fleet of warships. Or peacefully trade goods between rich ports.
Powerful magic unlocks secrets galore! Think you’ve completely explored an area? Discover the Shadow Door spell and find hidden paths in old dungeons. Learn how to Teleport and access areas impossible to find without magic. Bypass a foe’s defences by using Teleport Circle to appear inside their fortress, allowing you to rob them blind.
Forge magic items with magical weaves. Raise armies with gold bullion. Raid vaults to find treasures that provide great wealth and power.
A globe-spanning mega plot. Concealed within the books are hints of a deadly and growing danger. When you hit the heights of power you might be able to unravel a conspiracy that threatens the very world itself.
 What are the reviewers saying...
Becca Scott from Good Time Society tells you everything you need to know about Crown & Tower.
Doug from 2+Tough takes us into the Arena at the beginning of his adventure.
 Joe, Hannah and Alex over at Roll for Review take a look at Crown & Tower and Joe is impressed...
Todd from ClassicRolePlayer did a review and playthrough of book 1 a few weeks back.
Each book in the Legendary Kingdom series covers a different geographic area on the world map. These region books each have a more detailed, zoomed-in version of the map. Every location on the map can be reached, either on foot, by sea or by magical transportation (if you possess such a power). You can go back and forth between books at will – just walk or sail off the edge of the map.
Book 1: The Valley of Bones takes place in a desert wilderness where tyrant kings oppress the teeming masses in a land strewn with ancient artefacts and ruins. But their grip on power is fragile … and the citizenry are ripe for revolution. It is a land of blood and sand, where civilisation is rare and terrible beasts roam freely.
Book 2: Crown and Tower takes place in the high-medieval realm of Longport Bay, torn apart by the struggle for power between two noble families. Baron Baldwin Dayne lies dying, and his children must grasp the mantle of power, or see their family destroyed forever. Ancient ruins await plunder and exploration, and savage armies hang on the borders, waiting for the county to weaken itself with its incessant warring. Glittering steel, the flash of long forgotten magics, and terrible monsters all wait to be found as you build your strength for the final confrontation.
Book 3: Pirates of the Splintered Isles is set in a tropical paradise, where competition for spice has the great powers of the world vying for domination.
Book 4: The Gilded Throne covers the duchy of Pendrilor, seat of the corrupt king of Royce. Wealth drips from its ports, but it is blind to an encroaching threat which could see it wiped from the globe!
Book 5: The Savage Lands is set in an untamed wilderness, unmapped by civilised realms. A terrible secret lurks in its forgotten grottos and sky-touching mountains.
Book 6: Drakehallow is a gas-powered hell of furnaces and sorcery. The population cram into over-packed, crumbling cities for fear of encountering the monstrous creations of their depraved industry. 
More Art
We are commissioning 20 more pieces of art for the book including a more detailed pictorial journey through the city of Longport Bay.
 ‘The Sonderleign Drops’
A brand new stand alone adventure.
“There is something I desire, but it is located in a place my conventional agents will not go. Deep in the woods to the northwest are the Sonderleign Drops, the ruins of a fantastic underground city. Many have attempted to excavate and explore it in the past, but even the largest expeditions have failed.”
This adventure is on top of a book, already with more that 900 references and will test your team but the rewards are well worth it.”
Yet More Art
Travelling the County of Longport Bay this art expansion creates more images of the rich and diverse land you are exploring.

‘Missing, Presumed Dead’
A second brand new adventure takes your team on a mission to find an important officer of the crown who has gone missing. This particular man is a clerk at the seigneurial office. Its role is to determine which nobles own which piece of land, which family members are permitted to inherit titles, and what legal privileges the ownership of certain noble ranks grant in tax and trade law. It is pretty dry stuff, but the decisions of the seigneurial office can ruin lesser families or provoke war between greater ones.
Where is he and why did he suddenly disappear?
Production Upgrade
Collectors Edition:-
It was suggested that we have dust covers for the collectors editions, so that these premium copies of the Legendary Kingdoms series can enjoy the same amazing cover art that the softbacks do. We loved the suggestion and so as soon as this stretch is hit we will include dust covers on all current and future current and future volumes of the LK Collectors Edition.
Softback Edition:-
Having spoken to the printers the book will now with thicker more sturdy paper but at no extra cost. This upgrade will extend the life of the book and give the pages a smoother feel and a crisper print.
‘Maw of Abraxas’
You are wandering the bleak Mawlands, an area of scrubland just north of the Salvar Rise, a chain of mountains that shields the county of Longport Bay from the Savage Lands to the south.
The area gets its name from the terrifying cave network known as the Maw of Abraxas, which plunges into the mountain foothills. It has a terrifying reputation as a place of death, although rumours persist of great treasures hidden away in its secret vaults.
Tempted?
Even More Art
Getting to know the characters more with extra art covering even more of the key moments in your adventures.
Bookmark Ribbon and a Character Sheet Upgrade
Another great suggestion from our backers is the very useful page holder ribbon and it would be our pleasure to be able to include this in every Collectors Edition copy.
We have also taken a look at the free character sheet everyone can download as a pdf and decided it need the same art upgrade as the maps. We will show off the new and improved version here on the updates when it has been complete.
A Brand New Adventure, played live on our Facebook Group.
Play Legendary Kingdoms with players across the world on Facebook!  If this target is reached, Legendary Kingdoms author Oliver Hulme will create a unique adventure that will update on Facebook every week.  Players worldwide will help in designing party members, and will jointly decide what actions to take that week via Facebook polls.
Create your own characters or choose from six adventurers with their own deep backstory in the world, each of whom have personalised quests and interactions with the plot. Your characters can gain special powers, fall in love, seek revenge, become lords and ladies and encounter friends, family and enemies from their youths. Each of the six starting characters were brought up in a different part of the world, and all have their own special quests to resolve in their homeland.
(or Nitty-gritty)
Legendary Kingdoms uses a success-based dice system for skill checks and combat. Each party-member has a skill value in each of the five main skills of the game (Fighting, Stealth, Lore, Survival and Charisma). Each skill point allows you to roll a single die. Sar Jessica Dayne, for instance, has a Fighting skill of 5, which means she can roll 5 dice whenever she makes any Fighting skill checks. Your party will either make skill-checks individually, if they are separated, or as a team if more than one person can help with a check.
Your skills can improve through experience or by finding special items. Find a steel longsword (Fighting +2) and you can improve your Fighting skill by 2, for instance. As you play, you will have to decide if you want your party-members to specialise in certain skills, or have them generally improve all their skills. Both ideas have merit. Specialisation is powerful when you are working as a team … but if your party has an argument or someone wanders off on their own, you might prefer it if everyone was equipped to handle everything. Just like real life, you won’t always be able to count on your friends being around all the time!
The game keeps track of events through the use of codes. Save an old man and his family from the city guards and you might gain the code A15. Every so often, the book will ask you if you have a code. Having the code A15 will stop you from constantly encountering old men being hassled by the city guards every time you walk down the street!
The best way to see how the game works is by playing it. You can download the Kickstarter sample here.
Free PDF Quickstart
If you have ever played Fighting Fantasy or Choose Your Own Adventure books, you have the basic idea of what a gamebook looks like. In terms of how it plays, it is quite similar structurally to Fabled Lands by Dave Morris & Jamie Thomson. That book series also featured a number of connected books that you could wander between at will. Long term, Legendary Kingdoms feels quite similar to Sorcery by Steve Jackson, in that it has a grand quest, sorcery is rare and powerful, and there is a final goal to achieve. There is also just a whiff of Way of the Tiger by Mark Smith and Jamie Thomson, mainly through Akihiro and his quest for enlightenment.
Legendary Kingdoms itself is a zero to hero narrative. You begin as penniless slaves, and end the game becoming great generals who make or break the future of the world based on your actions. The main difference with games like Sorcery or Destiny Quest is that you decide the order you want to do it. There are many ways into the main super-plot of the books, and different parties will experience different routes in. Forgive us for being cryptic … but we don’t want to ruin the plot!
That said, each book is also very self-contained. There are several dozen independent quests, one ‘book quest’ which involves the epic clash of armies, one character quest, where the history and goals of one of the pre-generated characters is explored in depth, and a number of minor party-member events. These minor events allow your party members to fall in love, become enemies, save each other’s lives, or just give each other time to shine.

This crowdfunding campaign aims to raise the funds to produce book 2 of the Legendary Kingdoms gamebook series.
The campaign will run for 30 days and as soon as the campaign closes we will begin production of Crown & Tower. By backing this project you are agreeing to have your card charged with the amount you pledge at the project end, which is Thursday 15th April.
Following the end of the campaign, usually a few weeks later, we will send you a post campaign survey where you will confirm your pledge level (and get a chance to upgrade if you wish), give us your address details and settle the postage. If you have ordered both books in the softcover form, you will be given the option of splitting the postage and being sent book 1 straight away and then book 2 when production is complete (estimated to be September).
This process will have you making two payments, the first for the pledge, a charging process handled by Kickstarter which will happen on or around 15th April, and then the second for postage and any upgrades, which is handled by the company sending you the survey. For this campaign we will be using a company called Backer Kit.
So how do I make a pledge?
At the top of the campaign page you will see the green “Back this project” button. Alternatively, you can scroll down to select a reward tier.
After selecting the tier you wish to pledge for, check the amount being pledged and select 'continue' to proceed.
You will then be taken through to the payments page where you’ll be prompted to enter your payment details. To complete your pledge, click the green “Pledge" button and you’ll be all set!
You should receive a confirmation email to confirm that you are now a backer of the project. As long as we are successfully funded, your card will be charged when the campaign ends.

Marketed & Promoted by  
This project is promoted by Green Inbox, the tech marketing company behind many successful Kickstarters. We use heavy technology to help creators maximize their projects and ROAS.
More than $50,000,000 has been raised with Sprint's support
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Spidermind Games has run several successful Kickstarter campaigns, building a product list based on quality and a community based on communication. 

This project has real potential to be massive. That being said, the bigger the project, the more links there are in the chain. With every additional link, there could be additional problems waiting to ambush the smooth planning of this project.

Whilst we hope no problems will occur, IF something was to happen, we can assure you that we will do all we can to mitigate any delay. Some difficulties, however much we might want to help, will be outside of our control. Industrial action, acts of God, fire and flood, ash clouds from volcanoes, global pandemics as well as plague and pestilence are just some of the issues and problems that might occur that we have no control over.

We have, however, already added in ‘stretch’ room, additional time for each section of the project to be completed and will keep the delivery dates and other deadlines updated on the KS page as well as through our social media channels. We will work hard to ensure all your queries are answered in a timely fashion.

I think what Cahaan is getting at is whether backwards-flowing consequences were implemented. It's easy to write forwards-flowing interaction, where things happen in book 1, you record codes, and then those codes can have consequences in later books. But it takes a great deal of planning to write backwards-flowing interaction, where things that happen in later books have an effect in earlier books. In other words, are there codes that are currently impossible to acquire but already have their consequences written in the earlier books, and the way to acquire them has yet to be written? How much of that pre-planning was done?
At this point, it does seem like most of the interactions between books will be "forward-flowing." Of course, I could be missing some clever tricks by the authors.

There's nothing preventing them from having content, say, in book 5 that occurs in the areas of book 1. Yes, the cool factor of hitting previously unreachable content in a book when one down the line references it would be lost, but the theory is still viable.

updates.update_content:
Hello everyone!
We are happy that we took the time to make the additions to the book. The original plan was to print the book as it stood at the time of the Kickstarter. However, the response was great and it allowed some extra colorizations to the book by artist Richard Luschek.

The additions have been made and the book has now been sent off to the printers. We are sure you will be happy with the results. We expect the book should arrive in less than two months assuming it does not get held up in customs.

Backers:
Thank you all for supporting Kaldor: the first Hârn Hardback.
We have processed your pledge and posted the PDF files associated with your pledge level to your Columbia Games Account.  If you did not have an existing account, we created one for you, using your Kickstarter email address and the temporary password "kaldor".   
We hope to deliver the book on time this June but are going to take a moment to improve the artwork in Kaldor before printing.   For example, Richard Luschek painted a new piece for the first page of Kaldor.

Shout-out to the greatest artist Hârn has ever seen.
_______
Richard Luschek has been the Hârn art director and main talent for 20+ years.
He writes here (his blog) about cover and color artwork among other topics.

Most of us have seen or heard of the long-running TV Show, The Family Feud.
Many of us made a mental connection between feuding and feudalism when we FIRST heard that ISM.
While it certainly is true that Hârnic politics and the European middle-ages involved a lot of family feuding, the root of the word feudal is quite different.

Feudalism is the most common government system used on Hârn.  You can read all about Feudalism in HârnWorld.

Tenants in Chief are lords who hold land directly from the king in exchange for military service.   Lesser lords hold land from other liege lords (and sometimes from the king).  Peasants (villeins/serfs) are bound to their lord's land and provide labor and a share of their produce,  in exchange for military protection.

Cities of Tashal review by Ardwulf!
As many of you know, Ardwulf knows a thing or two about Hârn! Join with him as he tells you all about the City of Tashal!

updates.update_content:
Kethira is the name of the planet that Hârn is on.
In the Kethira module, details such as the planet's year (revolution) and day (rotation) are given for all the planets in the system along with other technical details. The year on Kethira is 360 days, and the day is 24 hours. These are earthlike on purpose - a deliberate design decision so that assumptions can be made when playing.

Fantasy RPG Worldbuilding just got better!
Gamemasters love Hârn because it goes far beyond tried and true methods for worldbuilding.  HârnManor is one of example of Columbia Games dedication to detail.  It is now availble as a PDF add-on for this Kickstarter!

Hârnmanor provides rules to generate useful, realistic Hârnic villages, populated with a variety of serfs, freeholders, and craftsmen. It also provides rules to populate the lord's household and to operate realistic medieval manors.

campaign.story:
Dwarrowdeep Exploration by Stefan Poag
For generations the dwarves of the Northern Reaches lived secure in their great mountain fortress, Gundgathol. They built a vast city and mined the earth for its wealth. The dwarves, led by House Stoneborn and taught by their god Thaneduhr, forged artifacts and weapons of unparalleled craftsmanship. Under the mountains they grew and flourished. The dwarves befriended the first humans to settle the region and trade allowed both races to prosper.
In time, Gundgathol came under siege - not from above, but from below. The duergar, or gray dwarves, in a coordinated attack, infiltrated the city from deep subterranean tunnels. Jealous of the mountain dwarves' wealth, the duergar and their dark allies pushed House Stoneborn out of their ancestral home. The remaining dwarves retreated to the human settlement of Hamelet and vowed their revenge. In the centuries that followed, the dwarves sent warbands into the mountains, but only a handful returned. Those who did told tales of great sorrow. The majesty and grandeur of the city, the cradle of dwarven civilization, was now a bleak, half-drowned dungeon overrun with evil monsters. Today, only the dwarves refer to their sacred homeland as Gundgathol. The people of the Northern Reaches simply call it --- Dwarrowdeep.
Some say there is more to this story than meets the eye. Some say House Stoneborn keeps a dark secret known only to the dwarves...
Are you brave (or foolish) enough to explore the long dark of Dwarrowdeep? 
This Kickstarter campaign is designed to support the creation of a new megadungeon adventure for the Old School Renaissance and the Fifth Edition of the World's Most Popular Role-Playing Game. Dwarrowdeep represents the fourth in a massive six-part megadungeon adventure series never before undertaken in the history of fantasy role-playing games.
The OSR Labyrinth Lord edition can be played with any TSR rule-set from the 70s/80s/90s, or inspired by them, such as Original Edition, B/X, First or Second Edition, OSRIC, Old School Essentials, or Swords and Wizardry without conversion. The adventure is designed to support low-to-high level play within a medieval fantasy campaign lasting months and years.
I estimate the final draft to be between 260-290 pages and approximately 500-600 encounter areas. If you are familiar with Barrowmaze Complete, that project was 259 pages in a two-column format (cover to cover). The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia my follow-up project, was 293 pages. Like my other megadungeons, Dwarrowdeep will provide PDF poster maps in both black and Old School blue.
Dwarrowdeep begins with a gazetteer that outlines the region in which the adventure takes place. This includes a cultural history of the dwarves as well as detailing the town of Hamelet - the base of operations for the campaign. The dungeon proper will be levelled in a traditional style, albeit with twists and surprises. You can expect new spells and magic items, special monsters, pregenerated characters, new races, and rival adventuring parties. Dwarrowdeep merges my own unique vision (one that has never been realized in a dwarven-themed adventure) with inspiration drawn from J.R.R. Tolkien and classic adventures like Shrine of the Kuo-Toa and The Night Below.
Remember prices are in Canadian Dollars so all those in the United States and abroad should take note of currency conversion savings. If you are unfamiliar, the conversion for 2021 to date is $1.00 USD = 1.22 CAD (citation: bankofcanada.ca).
Therefore a $70 CAD pledge = approximately $55 USD.
Here are some past layout samples from Barrowmaze Complete with the cover by ex-TSR artist Erol Otus. The cover and page samples represent the style you can expect in Dwarrowdeep:
Sample format from Barrowmaze Complete
Old school adventures should celebrate the origins of the hobby while also charting a path forward. The classic fantasy gaming experience isn't supposed to be about long exhausting combats but rather an equal mix of exploration, combat, and role-play. These values are very important to me and find expression in my approach to design and commitment to premium artwork.
Just like Barrowmaze, Forbidden Caverns, and HighFell, Dwarrowdeep will place an emphasis on outstanding old school art. I have worked with former TSR artists Erol Otus, Jim Holloway, Russ Nicholson, and Tim Truman. I will get the band back together including the talents of Cory Hamel, Dave Needham, Kennon James, Stefan Poag, Peter Pagano, Stephen Thompson, and others. Similar to past projects for Labyrinth Lord, every creature in the monster section will have its own illustration (Forbidden Caverns, for example, had over 100 monsters). 
In terms of mapping, those of you with a close eye will notice my adventures are slowly filling in an old school wilderness game map that serves as the basis of my Northern Reaches homegame (we affectionately call it...Greghawk). Dwarrowdeep continues this tradition as a tip-of-the-cap to Gygax's original campaign.
Kennon James and Dave Needham have created some fantastic preliminary illustrations to give you an idea of the aesthetic we have in mind for a few of the monsters.
Duergar Dwarf by Kennon James
Cyclopsman by Kennon James
The Town of Hamelet by Dave Needham
All hardcover books, except Dwarrowdeep, will ship (and pdf codes emailed) after Kickstarter funds have cleared. Dwarrowdeep will ship upon completion no later than August 2022. I normally provide updates monthly or every other other month, subject to developments.
Like my other projects Dwarrowdeep will be detailed, provide depth of engagement, have old school charm, cool coffee-table appeal, and be super fun for your gaming group. I have an excellent reputation across the interwebs for value-added projects. If you are familiar with my past projects, you already know what to expect.
As part of this kickstarter project, and to celebrate the 10th anniversary of my first session of Barrowmaze in my home campaign, I’ve created a new monochrome cover for Barrowmaze Complete. The book will have a foreword by Grognardia author James Maliszewski that will contextualize Barrowmaze within the history of the OSR. Artist Stefan Poag illustrated both the front and back cover, including homages to characters we established as iconics within the pages of previous iterations:
Barrowmaze Complete 10th Anniversary Special Edition
HighFell: The Drifting Dungeon
The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia
The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia 5E
My name is Dr. Greg Gillespie. I am a Professor of Popular Culture in Ontario, Canada and winner of the 2018 Three Castles Award for Role-Playing Game Design. I teach a senior undergraduate course entitled The History and Culture of Role-Playing Games. I am also the author/designer of three popular Old School megadungeons called Barrowmaze Complete, The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia, and HighFell: The Drifting Dungeon. All three of these massive adventures are available in Fifth Edition. You can read widely about Barrowmaze and my other dungeons across the internet, youtube, and other social media.

There are always potential challenges to any large project. However, I have an established track record of successful campaigns that have either shipped early or exactly on schedule. I have afforded myself a manageable writing and play-testing schedule with a shipping date of August 2022.

campaign.story:
The Many Crypts of Lady Ingrade (Zine Quest)
Lady Ingrade cared for her land and the people who tended to it. But there was always darkness about her. She would provide comfort to a grieving mother one moment and then in the next, demand a farmer be given lashes for having too many rocks on his field.
As she grew older her perceptions of the world darkened to paranoia. Lady Ingrade obsessed about the adventurers that rode across the countryside unhindered. Grave robbers, all of them. That's when the crypt construction began.
Lady Ingrade feared a filthy group of adventurers would violate her in death. She compulsively built crypts to lure in tomb raiders and dispatch them with deadly traps and creatures.
Upon her death, the wealth she accumulated was not found. Presumed to be dispersed throughout her many crypts or hidden within her true, final resting place. No one is sure what's within the crypts. Those that enter, do not return.

Which Ruleset?
Old School Essentials. 

What's Inside the Zine?
This is a series of adventures focused on Lady Ingrade's crypts. Some are linked and some are stand alone, 'found' locations. A referee can easily insert these adventures in their campaign or be used as one-shot adventures. I'm guessing the page count will be a minimal of 24 pages, but more in the 32 to 36 page range. 

Shipping & Fulfillment
PDFS will be fulfilled by coupons through DriveThruRPG.
Print copies will ship USPS. This year I plan to print using Mixam. As much fun as I had last printing all the zines at home, I thought I would share the fun this year. 

The Team
Jason Sholtis created the art for The Many Crypts of Lady Ingrade. Jason was also the first artist I ever worked with back in 2011, when he drew the cover for the first issue of The Manor. His art never fails to impress.

campaign.story:
In the Shadow of Tower Silveraxe is a classic old-school fantasy sandbox adventure module.
There could be several reasons to seek adventure in the Gemthrone Wilderness. It is a region that is often the subject of speculation on cold nights in the glow of a tavern hearth. Some may talk of the treasures that have laid untouched for centuries in dark dungeons, just waiting to be pilfered—which is then, almost without fail, followed by another who interjects with the dangers of such notions, were the legends even to be believed.
There are, however, those who do believe such tales—wizened adventurers who know there is always some truth to even the most unbelievable stories. One just has to know what rumors to listen for...
A chaotic leader of a group of outlaws and mercenaries, Duard Silveraxe, has braved the Labyrinthine forest and taken control of the ancient ruined Tower of Shadow from the elves. Duard seeks power here—legends say that the elves of the tower keep a dark power hidden there—immortality and weird magical abilities granted to the one who performs the rituals to unlock them. 
For centuries, the elves of this region have been custodians of the Tower of Shadow. Their charge has been to keep its ancient magic hidden from those who might use it in the name of chaos—the ability to harness the powers of the Shadow Plane. To become shadow itself.
Since the assault, the denizens of the surrounding forest, including the more monstrous creatures—trolls and giant spiders— have fled from the vicinity of the tower and into the nearby mountains, causing problems for settlers of the region—including the residents of the peaceful dwarven town of Karn Buldahr. The town council has sought aid from any willing adventurers to help deal with the attacks.

Bugbear Attack!
In the Shadow of Tower Silveraxe is a 52 page (not including cover) adventure module zine designed for use with the Old School Essentials or Basic/Expert classic fantasy rules. It's old-school in both flavor and design mindset—weird and fantastic pulp adventure. Not all encounters are balanced and survival is not a guarantee. 
The zine contains a detailed map of the Gemthrone wilderness, seven dungeons, and four settlements including the dwarven town of Karn Buldahr— which can serve well as a starting location for lower level adventurers. Each settlement has its own list of rumors, hooks, and NPCs.
It is designed as a module. Use it as a standalone campaign, graft it onto your existing campaign wherever you find mountainous wilderness, or drop in any of the dungeons as a one-shot. 
Also, the layout is designed with clarity and usability in mind. Dungeon maps are easy to read and their corresponding room descriptions and relevant monster stats are placed so that they are all on the same spread—less page flipping, less time prepping!
tldr:
52 interior pages 
Topographic wilderness overland map
7 dungeon locations
4 settlement locations with hooks and NPCs
Setting and local faction lore
Additional rules for more simple and dynamic weather
Below are a few examples of what's inside.
Cover mockup
Mock up of a 2-page spread of one of the dungeons in the module.
The Dwarven town of Karn Buldahr.
The contour overland map for the Gemthrone Wilderness region.
Closeup view of a section of the overland map
The map is done in the style of a topographic wilderness hiking map, complete with elevation, contours, vegetation density, relief shading, water features, and trail mileage noted to the 1/10 of a mile! All this detail is so the referee can accurately describe the surroundings, precise travel times, and adjudicate exploration should the players decide to take a different route. In addition, a 6-mile hex grid overlay will help if they want to go off trail or if you prefer running a hex-crawl  style games. 
Crab Spider Attack! Art featured in the zine.

All of the art, cartography, and layout design are done by me. The only art left to complete is the interior art which will come as either smaller filler art and a couple (maybe more) larger full page pieces in black and white. The art will be thematic to the content of the zine and invoke older-era RPG-ness in my style. I usually work traditionally with pen (and brush) and ink—except for the cover art, which I digitally painted. 
 My Instagram 



I have set July as the expected delivery date, but I expect to have it out sooner than that. The bulk of the production work is complete and all that is left is interior art, playtesting, editing, and revisions.

campaign.story:
Steven Rhodes is a graphic artist and illustrator best known for his offbeat reimagining of children’s activity books from the 70s and 80s. The Let’s Dig for Treasure, Let’s Summon Demons, and Don’t Talk to Strangers games will immerse you into these hilariously dark retro worlds. Featuring clever and beautiful fan-favorite artwork, each game is a wild romp through the parallel Rhodes universe. The games are quick to learn and are created for 2-6 players, ages 14 and up.
Dynomite Games is an old-school sub-brand of Cryptozoic Entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of licensed and original IPs, Cryptozoic’s catalog covers a broad spectrum of tabletop games and collectibles including Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards and the DC Deckbuilding games.

We've made simple, streamlined game engines (with very little set-up time) so that anyone can dive right in--but we've seasoned the games with enough hidden depth and unique design space to satisfy all of you hardcore gamers too!
Check out a brief overview of each of these games:
It's the funky-freshest Push-Your-Luck experience out there, for the whole family! Just shuffle up the deck and divide it into 3 "Dig Stacks" and you're ready to start digging for treasure!
1. On your turn, choose and "dig up" a card from any of the Dig Stacks...look for cards worth a lot of points, or cards that trigger a powerful effect, such as stealing a card from another player!  
2. You can stop digging at any time, or keep digging up cards for as long as you want...the more cards you dig up before you "stop," the more you stand to gain--but be careful--if you dig up a 2nd Worms Card, or even a SINGLE skeleton card, your turn will end immediately and you'll lose *EVERYTHING* you dug up so far (this turn)! 
3. Once an entire Dig Stack is empty, the game is over and players add up the total point values on their cards!  Be sure to look and see if you scored any "bonus point" effects (you did make sure to dig up some Milk to go with your Cookies, right?). 
4. You've got all kinds of zany stuff to find while digging: Loyal Dogs (protect you from a Skeleton!), Sewer Lines (worth negative points--give it to your least favorite opponent!), heck, you might even transcend death with The Crown of the Lich Lord, or turn those pesky worms into big points with Skwirmz the Worm God! 





What are little Johnny, Suzy, and Fido supposed to do when the suburban droll has them down? I know, Let's Summon Demons!  Whether you're building sadistic synergies with the "rotten" kids or sharing the love with the "sweet" kids, only the savviest (and luckiest!) player--the best Demon Summoner--will walk away a winner!
1. Shuffle up the Demon Deck and the Block Deck, and deal everyone a Starting Candle and a hand of 3 Demons. Your goal is to summon all 3 of those little devils before your opponents beat you to it... 
2. At all times, a rotating assortment of five cards will be available for purchase (the low, low price of 3 soul tokens) to all players--this is called THE BLOCK and it has Boys, Girls, and Animals of every style and strategy! Look for cards that combo together! 
3. On each players' turn, they'll roll the dice--if any player's cards they've acquired "match" the total rolled then that card activates--often resulting in the acquisition of more soul tokens! More soul tokens means more cards from THE BLOCK, means even more soul tokens--but to what end?
4. Well, you can sacr--er--discard 3 of your cards to SUMMON A DEMON! The most powerful cards of all! Once any player has summoned all 3 of their Demons --and has a balance of 10 souls on top of that--they are declared the ultimate Demon Summoner and the game is over! With all of the variety offered between the 20 unique demons and the diverse BLOCK DECK, there is plenty of content to explore and master!





School's out but otherworldly STRANGERS are here!  Mom & Dad haven't caught on yet so you're on your own, kiddo. Play your cards as efficiently as you can, helping to navigate your Kids one at a time from SCHOOL to a SCORING space--in order to score as many points as you can before the neighborhood is completely overrun with STRANGERS!
1. At the start of the game, each player will draw a hand of 3 cards and place one of their kids in the SCHOOL space. Your goal is to get that kid into a valuable scoring space, at which point you'll place a new kid in the SCHOOL space and repeat the process. Some spaces are worth more points at the end of the game, and some confer a unique bonus (for example, your hand size increases by 1 for each Kid you have in the Library). 
2. Remember, you want to score a good space, but you'll have to Walk, Run, Skateboard, School Bus, and even City Bus to get there! Each turn you'll play one card and draw a new card to replace it!  
3. But watch out!  When any player draws a STRANGER card, they can abduct any kid on a "STRANGER SPACE!" Furthermore, now that a STRANGER is lurking in that space, it is impassable for all future movement...so you may just have to re-route your plans on the fly! SAUCER cards can abduct *any* kid--even one that has already scored--but your opponent will have to get lucky when they flip the SAUCER COIN or you'll escape abduction!


Like what you see? Giggling with glee? Store each game together when you back all three! We personally guarantee that this sleek and convenient slipcase looks a lot better on your bookshelf than a haphazard stack of boxes!





We expect the game to start shipping in June 2021. It is English-only and we're shipping worldwide in partnership with Quartermaster Logistics. This game is "friendly" in terms of shipping (i.e., we cover customs/import taxes) to the US, Canada, EU, Australia, and New Zealand. Shipping rates are based on actual costs to ship your rewards (depending on your country) and will be charged as part of your pledge.
Please note: Due to COVID-19, most shippers have added surcharges to their rates. The amount we charge for shipping reflects the latest rates. In some regions, the cost of shipping may exceed the cost of the tier you’re pledging for; unfortunately, this cannot be avoided. In most cases, pledging for two or three games (“Double Trouble” and "Slipcase Exclusive" Tiers) costs almost the same in terms of shipping as pledging for one game.



This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 1,100+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $460M raised between them.

campaign.story:
Run Down #24:  We want to thank everyone for joining in the Roads to Adventure Kickstarter. This campaign did far more than we ever expected and we owe it all to you. So from us to you, a kindly Thank You! Lots of work to do, but we've already plunged in!
Join the Road to Adventure with the Castles & Crusades Players Handbook, the Adventurers Spellbook, the Players Archive! 
With Iron Heel, the World Grinds Away
Plunge into worlds of fantastic adventure where dragons lie and the undead stalk the shades of your mind's imaginings, where creatures of legend plunder wealth through the horror of their passage. Monsters grim and foul taunt with the ecstasy of gold and glory. Upon the heels of these foes stalk heroes of great might; those who take up sword and shield, who harness eldritch might, those who traverse the narrow corridors in search of sport, and those who serve a purpose greater than all the others: Heroes, Freebooters, Mercenaries, and Adventurers. 

BEFORE WE CONTINUE: Back in March, after Covid hit, we released the digital PDF of the C&C Players Handbook, 7th printing, offering it to everyone stuck at home for free. If you want to check it out. You can download it here and see what all the fuss is about.
You have to be asking yourself if we are on the 8th printing, what's new?  As many of the older C&Cers know we pledged to keep the game the same, no new editions, way back with the release of the 1st printing. We've done that. The Players Handbook, 8th printing stays the same, EXCEPT, we are overhauling the layout and including a new cover and all-new interior art! The cover below is by Jason Walton. As you can see, it's going to be something else! 

A Game That is Yours to Command
                                                 Castles & Crusades is a fantasy role-playing game with countless possibilities. The C&C Players Handbook allows you to take up the sword and shield, the staff or bow; to arm yourself as you desire and wander upon planes of your own imagination to reap the harvest of adventure. 
Designed for use with multiple players, Castles & Crusades puts you in charge of the adventure path. Included within are all the rules of play, how to get started in your very own role-playing game, how to run the game and play in it. 
Its easy to learn attribute-based rules system allows players to choose among 13 archetypal character classes and 7 races to create their characters. Spells, equipment, fast-paced combat rules, and all essential information needed to play a game of Castles & Crusades are in this book. 
The Players Handbook, 8th printing. This will be a 196 page hardcover, full-color book. It will retail for $39.99.
In the last 16-17 years, Castles & Crusades has grown immensely. We have dozens of sourcebooks to expand your play, two world settings, several mini settings, and adventures piled up everywhere. With that some of our material has become a bit scattered. If we fund here we'll bring the Adventurers Spellbook to life. This book will include:
All the spells from the PHB
All the spells from the Adventurers Backpack
All the spells from Elemental Spells
All the spells from the Players Guide to Aihrde
Spells from Amazing Adventures Companion
All the manifold piles of spells that pop up in other source material and adventures
A complete run of Rune Magic Runes, all 8 Codices
Chromatic Mage from Hallowed Oracle
The Adventurers Spellbook will be a resource for the ages! This will be a 176 page (est.) softcover, black and white book. It will retail for $24.99.
That's two of three books offered up in this Kickstarter, now on to the Players Archive!
The Players Archive is a fast and ready resource for all players. In it you'll find all the classes from the Players Handbook, Adventurers Backpack, Hallowed Oracle, some from Amazing Adventures and the Players Guide to Aihrde in one place. Plus it includes all the options for multi-classing and class and a half from the Players Handbook and the Adventurers Backpack! It's a quick reference tool designed to make your game run a little faster. The Players Archive is a softcover book of roughly 70+ pages and will retail for $19.99.
Join the fray and help bring Castles & Crusades into the next decade!

Already have the Players Handbook but want to show your support? We have a merchandising level that includes a canvas poster printed by the amazing folks at Noble Dwarf of the Roads to Adventure Painting by Jason Walton, a Castles & Crusades tee shirt, and the Dragonlock Ultimate GM Screen of Doom from Fat Dragon Games and from Axe N Shield 30' Spell Direction Templates (see here) with the C&C logo etched on them (see below)! Spell templates are a durable plastic that takes the guessing out of spell casting. Four Spe The canvas is a BPA free American made canvas with a 100yr archival rating against discoloring and is water-resistant. This canvas poster is roughly 18 x 13 inches and comes in a tube.

If we meet our goal, we'll add all manner of rewards to your pledge! Help us over the top!
$8,000: Roads To Adventure! FUNDED! You've helped fund the next generation of C&C! The 8th printing of the Players Handbook is unlocked as is the Adventurers Spellbook and the Players Archive.
$13,000: WorldAnvil! Unlocked! We'll include a 3-month subscription to the World Anvil World of Aihrde homepage at the highest tier, the Deities of Aihrde. You'll be able to access the world, its many maps, and mountains of gaming material!
$15,000: ASB Expansion Unlocked! We are going to include 26 spellbooks in the Adventurers Spellbook. Each of these will come with a specific name, such as Fodious's Magical Codex. These will come complete with listings of spells and can be used as both magic items and character spellbooks. 
$17,000: Old School Character Sheets! Unlocked! If we hit this level, we'll include one character sheet booklet printed on the classic yellow-brown paper from days of yore! These will be the original C&C character sheets designed by Darlene. You'll feel as if you've stumbled into the past!
$19,000: ASB Expansion! Unlocked! We are going to include 26 MORE spellbooks in the Adventurers Spellbook. Each of these will come with a specific name, such as Fodious's Magical Codex. These will come complete with listings of spells and can be used as both magic items and character spellbooks. That will give us a solid 52 spellbooks so later, maybe we can do something with cards...
$25,000: ASB Hardcover! Unlocked! If we hit 25K we'll print the Adventurers Spellbook in hardcover. We'll bind it in our normal Smythe Sewn binding so that it retains the high quality of all TLG books.
$27,000: Random Encounters! Unlocked! Davis Chenault, co-author of the C&C Players Handbook, will will create two random encounters. Each of these will be short encounters for the CK to plunge into their game. They will be available in digital format to all backers and loaded up on World Anvil!
$29,000: Two more Random Encounters! Unlocked!  These will join the previous and supply you enough adventure to get any game rolling!
$30,000: The Hallowed Oracle Players Guide: Unlocked! All backers receive a digital copy of The Hallowed Oracle Players Guide! Plunge into the world of the Abyss Walker and receive the complete Chromatic Mage and their color magic (designed by Jason Vey of Amazing Adventures fame). Mountains of gaming content for your C&C game. Available to all levels.
$35,000: The Efreet Tribute Cover! Unlocked!Jason Walton created the wonderful cover art you see above. If you aren’t aware, it is his tribute to the original AD&D Players Handbook cover. If we hit this goal we’ll do a second tribute cover, this time with a tip of the hat to the original AD&D Efreet cover. We’ll ask him to use the same characters for the story of  it all. This will be available as digital wall paper for all backers, and as a 12 x 18 inch poster at the $85.00 level and above. It will also be added to the ADD ON list to be printed as a canvas if you want it that way.
$37,500: The Wizard’s Spell Card Deck: Unlocked! Playing cards designed with all the 0-2nd level spells from the Players Handbook printed on them. Each card will have a single spell on it and all will come in a nice tuck box. These spell card decks go to anyone who pledges $130 or more. They are in the add on lists as well, discounted from their eventual MSRP!
$40,000: The Cleric’s Spell CardDeck: Unlocked! Playing cards designed with all the 0-3rd level spells from the Players Handbook printed on them. Each card will have a single spell on it and all will come in a nice tuck box. These spell card decks go to anyone who pledges $130 or more. They are in the add on lists as well, discounted from their eventual MSRP!
$45,000: Danger at the Hill Giant Stedding: James M. Ward dives into the past and pays tribute to one of the most famous early fantasy RPG adventures, G1. A digital copy of this adventure for all those who pledge $30 and above, a print copy for those who pledge $85+!
$50,000: Players Archive Hardcover: If you and your cohorts bring this KS to 50K we'll make the Players Archive into a full hardcover book, it will enjoy the smythe sewn binding that all our hardcovers do! Available to anyone who pledges for the print copy of the Players Archive.
Shipping cost and payment will be assessed after the Kickstarter is completed.  This will either be via Kickstarter or BackerKit.  Every attempt is made to keep the shipping costs down, both in the US and internationally.
Stay on the Road with us!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Creating color books is always a challenge. The print cost is noticeably higher as is creating and coloring the art. Creating a project that is both beautiful and useful but retains an affordable price tag, is always tough.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Our books have a long shelf life. They are professionally bound using smyth sewn techniques which give them high durability despite continued use.
Reusability and recyclability
Paper scrap from the manufacturing process is recycled, meaning that creating the book leaves almost no waste. The book too can be recycled if needed.
Sustainable materials
The book will be made of paper. Many of the stretch rewards are digital. All shipping material is bio-degradable, including our packing peanuts (they are made of starch and dissolve in water).
Environmentally friendly factories
The book will be produced in the United States with paper and paper products manufactured locally, reducing the amount of trans-oceanic fuel costs for both shipment of raw materials and the finished product. All the paper and scrap is bio-degradable or recyclable.
Sustainable Distribution
We use only card boxes, paper and packing peanuts made of corn starch, all of which are biodegradable. The packing peanuts in particular, as they dissolve in water, leaving no waste whatsoever.

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Roads to Adventure Kickstarter Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens!
     The Castles & Crusades Players Handbook is in layout but I've halted it while Peter Bradley wraps up the Castle Keepers Guide.  Once that is done (late next week), we'll begin wrapping up the PHB.  
     We've made one massive change to the book. We are porting over the high level class abilities from the CKG to the PHB. It will probably increase the book by a full signature. This material in no way changes the game, the way it plays or the material you need to play. These are no rule changes, they are simply powers for classes after 13th level.  It just seems to be the better placement.

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Roads to Adventure KS Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,
A quick update on the Roads to Adventure Kickstarter and the books within:

Players Handbook: I've about decided on the layout of the book. There will not be massive changes, but the classes will have a bit of an update. Each class ability will be distilled into a table and placed at the top of the class entry. That is for quick reference and reminders of abilities. The explanatory text will remain of course, but will be at the end of the entry. The assassin is going into an appendix. We are going to attempt to get each class entry on its own page. The book itself is being read over for edits, so we'll put her together as soon as that is done.

campaign.story:
In 2009, I released a platinum selling supplement that explained the details of the setting I used for my fantasy campaign for nearly forty years. Along with providing details, the supplement contains rules for adapting the material to the Swords & Wizardry RPG and other classic editions of the original roleplaying game. 
Since then, I have continued to run campaigns and now have enough material and rules to release a new series of supplements. The supplements together will function as their own system, useful as a tool for running many different types of fantasy campaigns. They will also function as individual supplements to the Swords & Wizardry RPG and other RPGs based on the classic editions. 
This reflects the reality that most fantasy campaigns based on the classic editions are a kitbash of different elements that the referee finds useful. So rather than try to compete with the large number of excellent RPGs targeting the classic editions, I decided to format my take in a way that supports kitbashing. While I hope people will enjoy the system I created as a whole, I expect most will pick out just the parts they are interested in, whether it is classes, monsters, or magic items. 
However, there needs to be something that ties these different elements together. A supplement that explains and illustrates how these rules work together as a complete system. To this end, I wrote The Basic Rules For The Majestic Fantasy RPG. It covers the traditional four classes of burglar, cleric, fighter, and magic user from levels 1 to 5 along with details on spells, equipment, and combat rules. It also supports the referee by including a list of monsters, NPCs, and magic items for a fantasy campaign. It ends with two sections of referee advice on how I use the elements of the classic editions to construct the rules and to make new rulings to cover the fantastic and unexpected things that players will attempt as their characters. Then it explains how to use the included material to bring the world outside the dungeon to life. 
Table of Contents Preview 
Majestic Fantasy RPG Basic rules cover.
Note: The art has not been finalized.
This is one part of this Kickstarter. The other part is a series of printed (or PDF) aids that I use to allow people to quickly generate characters using these rules. This aid is in the form of printed cards or tiles. There is an initial card that you hand the player that outlines how the character generation process works. From there, the players pick a class, a background, and buy equipment using the individual cards as a reference to fill out their character sheet. I have refined this over the past decade while running convention and game store sessions and found that it will allow a player to completely generate a character within 15 to 20 minutes. 
The print + pdf level will include a print option for these cards. However given DriveThruRPG's print prices it is not a cost effective option compared to just buying cardstock and printing what you need at home from the PDF. See the print cost section further down.  The print option will contain 5 copies of the common card and 3 copies of the cards for each class. There is a total of 20 cards.
magic user card front
This Kickstarter will be offering a set of these cards for the Basic Rules Of The Majestic Fantasy RPG. There will be five copies of each type of card to cover an entire table of players. Finally, all levels of this Kickstarter will also include a complimentary coupon for a printed copy of my Blackmarsh setting which is compatible with these rules.  
The Majestic Fantasy Realms
This Kickstarter also marks the beginning of expanded support for the Majestic Fantasy Realms, the setting that is behind Blackmarsh, Points of Light, and Points of Light II: The Sunrise Sea. Both of PoL books are published by Goodman Games. 
Prior to acquiring the license that led to my Majestic Wilderlands supplement, I was creating a version of my setting without the Judges Guild IP. This work made it into both Points of Light books as well as Blackmarsh. Since the license is ending, I am resuming work on this material and am planning to release more books detailing the inhabitants and realms that I have created. Additional setting details will also be found in the supplements I will be making for the Majestic Fantasy RPG to illustrate the rules. Look for the first standalone Majestic Fantasy Realm product, The Wild North, in a few months.
To follow what I do on my other projects along with tips and commentary on the RPG hobby please head over to the Bat in the Attic blog.
Open Content
All materials except for the art and trademarks will be released as open content under the Open Game License in the form of art-free editable documents. This includes the quick character generation cards.  
INFORMATION ON PRINT COUPONS
The printed version of the rules and cards will be released using Print on Demand at DriveThruRPG. Everyone selecting a print reward will receive a coupon that they can redeem for their own print copy. The cost of this coupon will be equal to the base price that DriveThruRPG charges plus 50 cents. The extra 50 cents are so that your purchase will register as a sale for DriveThruRPG rankings. The pledge price for the print reward level has been adjusted downward accordingly.
The estimated print costs from DriveThruRPG are
The Basic Rules for the Majestic Fantasy RPG - $3.75 to $4.50.
The Quick Character Generation Cards - $9 to $11. 
For shipping I tested a few addresses and found the following estimates
The Basic Rules for the Majestic Fantasy RPG - $4.50 to $5.50 US, Canada, & Europe.
The Quick Character Generation Cards - $5.75 to $6 US, $13 to $16 Canada & Europe.
In addition be advised that shipping cards is separate from shipping books. This means that you will be making two orders with two shipping charges. This is due to the fact that DriveThruRPG prints the cards in-house while the books are provided through Lightning Source outside of the company.  And please read the below.
IMPORTANT NOTE: The cards from DriveThruRPG are printed on 8" by 10" card stock  with a low-gloss UV Coating. While sturdy, it is not as cost effective as printing at home on card stock bought locally especially if you live in Canada or Europe.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have released nearly a dozen products over a decade using the same distribution model of PDF and Print on Demand coupons. To date, I have been able to fund art and editing out of the month-to-month revenue that Bat in the Attic Games has been able to generate. But now, the projects I envision have a more substantial word count and require more upfront investment, particularly in editing. To cover these costs, I am turning to Kickstarter. 

The writing is done on both portions of this project: the quick character generation cards and the basic rules. The rough draft of both these will be available during and after the Kickstarter. 

This mitigates but doesn't eliminate the risks that either the cover artist, editor, or I doing the layout will not be able to see the job through. However, since this is just a step beyond the other projects I have successfully published, the risk should be minimal.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Hundreds of items, dozens of spells, rules for potion-brewing, an innovative research-system for alchemy, tables to resolve mistakes in the laboratory, alchemy-related adventure hooks, and much, much more!
Bubbling alembics and fiery ovens release the fumes of sweet and noxious gases into the stone-walled laboratory, where mists gather and curl among the rafters. Shelves groan with the weight of clay jars, glass containers, parchment scrolls, boxes of rare minerals, and ancient books forbidden to own. This is the mysterious domain of the alchemist, and now the secrets of this venerable craft are opened before you for use in your 5th edition D&D game. A Pathfinder 1.0 version will be made as a print on demand softcover option (upgrades to hardcover at 250 sold). No leather editions will be made of the Pathfinder Tome of Alchemy.
Players and game masters both can use the mysteries of alchemy to expand options for adventuring and adventure design. This masterful work by Courtney Campbell explores all aspects of the venerable craft of alchemy and weaves it into the structure of the world's most popular fantasy role-playing game!
Not only does this Kickstarter offer the Tome of Alchemy itself, but backers also have the option to purchase the Deck of Mysterious Creations, a card-based system for tracking and developing alchemical experiments. The cards are system-neutral.
What's in the Book?
The Basics of Alchemy: Alchemists use specialized systems of code inherited from their mentors. Their methodology, like that of spellcasters, is  individualized, didactic, empirical, and arbitrary.
Materials and Essences: Tome of Alchemy describes the raw materials of item creation, from basic minerals to specialized equipment for the laboratory.
Alchemical Items: Even the still-mundane work of master alchemists can be of great use in the right hands, and highly destructive when they fall into the hands of problematic individuals (such as the average character!). A variety of incenses, ointments, pastes, powders, solvents, and tinctures are included for you to build a richly detailed world. Grenades are included so the characters can blow it up.
Magic Items: The highest use of alchemy (and the most profitable) is to provide the basics and the methodology for creating many different kinds of magical items. This section is the largest in the book, describing hundreds of formulae for the enhancement and creation of armor, weapons, miscellaneous magic items, and ... of course ... potions.
Spells: The relationship between alchemy and true magic is complex and deadly. Tome of Alchemy explains various ways in which alchemy and spell-casting may be combined to heighten the effects of traditional magic.
Tome of Alchemy offers resources for every gaming need:
Hundreds of new magic and mundane items with recipes to craft them
Rules for brewing potions
Dozens of new spells
A system for harvesting alchemical reagents for use in new alchemical recipes (or to be sold by the party's rogue on the black market)
A detailed alchemical research-system
A salvaging system for recovering reagents. After all, you don't want to have to hunt down a second lich just to get the dust you were supposed to collect.
Appendices detailing alchemical mishaps, providing a list of adventure hooks, and containing other useful information for alchemists.
The Deck of Mysterious Creations is a system-neutral deck of cards that can be used to combine ingredients, essences, and reagents according to certain rules, and determine the result. The Deck is integrated with the Tome of Alchemy, but does not require the Tome for use (nor does the Tome require the deck).
There are 2 types of ingredient cards and 3 types of essence cards (representing levels of the essence's crafting power). Various ingredients the characters might collect during the game can be tracked using the cards, and when the time comes for experimentation, the cards allow the results of their alchemical research to be determined.


The Deck of Mysterious Creations contains the following:
Reagent cards allow an interactive gaming procedure for tracking reagents throughout play.
Each reagent card has unique artwork depicting a magical ingredient.
Cards are provided to brew recipes in the Tome of Alchemy!
The Tome of Alchemy 5e  ($55 hardcover book and PDF, $200 leather book and PDF)
Pathfinder Print on Demand Tome of Alchemy Softcover* ($56 softcover book and PDF)
International Print on Demand Tome of Alchemy Softcover ($57 softcover book and PDF)
