All Frog God Games and Necromancer Games hardcovers are stitched into 16-page packets, the packets are sewn together, and then all the packets are sewn to a cloth backing, creating a book block that is glued to its cover. This is what we mean when we say "library binding."  That being said, after a myriad of book-binding issues both recently and dating back to 2nd Edition, there is nothing we hate to see more than someone investing in an expensive game book and having it fall apart on them after only a short period of regular use.  After all, you guys spend a lot of money on your books! Second, if a  hardcover book ever falls apart (we have tested this with baseball bats and very rough use, by the way), we will replace it at no cost assuming we still have one in stock. Yes, that means if you call me in ten years, and your book binding has failed you (failed us really) through regular use (please no bulldozer roll overs), just email us and if the book is still in stock, we will mail you a new copy for free. Nothing I can do for you if they are all sold out though (but email us anyway and we will hook you up in some way).
You will be receiving a kickstarter survey to finalize your address and contact information. We will email the instructions to groups of eligible backers with instructions on how to access PDF pledge rewards. 
Initial digital fulfillment is a three-step process that is completed using your Frog God Games web store account. If you do not have an account you will need to create on the Frog God Games website to get your digital rewards  The Kickstarter PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by backers (as they are paid for after the Kickstarter) at the Frog God Games web store using one or more coupon codes we provide. Codes will be sent via email to backers at the email address provided in the Kickstarter survey. This process gets you your correct reward, ensures your future access to your reward files, and allows us to track project fulfillment. 
If you are missing something from your account, and see all over Facebook that everyone else has it, please email Mike at mike@froggodgames.com, and he will set things right for you. Be patient for a few days after it is first released though, as we do release these in batches to prevent crashing our server.
When our website fulfillment page for this project is ready, you will receive an email. This is a separate communication than the Kickstarter survey. In that email you will receive the link to the site where you will be asked to verify your shipping information, your pledge rewards, and checkout through their system. Your Kickstarter pledge amount does not include shipping. It is during checkout that your shipping cost is calculated and charged.
Important News to Non-US Customers postage rates for the non-POD version of this book may be extremely high due to the rates charged by the US Postal system for international shipping. Other shippers such as FedEx are even more expensive. Please keep this in mind. Estimates are that current high postage rates may increase 150-300% because of complications from the Pandemic. 
Important note on Tariffs. Yep — we just got smacked with 7.5% tariffs on all hardcover books. We talked internally, and decided we would only raise prices by 5%, and would absorb the other 5% (e.g. $55 instead of $60). If these get resolved or erased, we will lower prices once again.
Shipping Damage or other Related Issues
No matter what we do, the post office seems to have a desire to drop, kick, throw, or even drive over some packages with trucks (yes, it has happened). In the unlikely event that you are one of the lucky folks that have this happen to you, we will of course send you a new book. All you need to do is send photos of the damage in an email to Mike at mike@froggodgames.com. He will set you up with a new book. Please do not send multiple emails to multiple sources as it confuses the process and may cause delay. That being said, we have a 100% delivery promise on our books. You are the reason we are able to make cool products, and your satisfaction matters to us.
Refunds: If for some reason you need a refund post-Kickstarter, we are happy to oblige, less a 13% charge that we pay to Kickstarter and Paypal.

Wrapping up the fulfillment! 

We have fulfilled digital rewards and shipping rewards to those who have completed the process. Be sure to check your messages on Kickstarter and/or your email inbox/spam/promotional folders. If you have not received your items, please contact us at help@froggodgames.com with your backer information.

When you open up your Deck of Mysterious Creations, you will see (in addition to metals and gems cards) a large number of monster cards. This is not a mistake! On the monster cards, the relevant information is the list of words under the heading "Vital Essences," toward the bottom of the card. This is the data which is relevant to alchemy, but we decided in the case of the monster cards that, since we had the available room, we would also add in the stats for the monsters so those cards could serve a dual purpose as a quick reference tool for the DM. That's not their main purpose, though -- the main purpose of the monster cards is to track the presence of the "vital essences." The vital essences are described in the Alchemy book, and they are key to most categories of alchemical items. The presence of the monster stats is only for an added convenience.

campaign.story:
Full rules for Dice Miner's solo mode are also available for download, or you can watch producer Jeff Tidball walk you through a solo mode play-though:
"The drafting is quite fun!… The Beer dice symbols allow you to really set up the mountain." —Will Keeler, Roll for Crit
"As the turns go on, you amass more and more dice… What you’re thinking about and what your strategy might be for the long game is really going to progress as things go on." —Jonathan Estis, Roll for Crit 
“The ‘mountain’ dice tray is awesome!” —John G., Playtester
“Right up my alley. And I love dice!” —Ben M., Playtester
In the Dice Miner Kickstarter, everyone’s working together to earn Gems that unlock stretch goals. Backers vote on which goals to work toward next. 
Due to the overwhelming response to the Dice Miner campaign, every stretch goal we planned to offer — and some that we didn't plan — has been unlocked. There is always the temptation, when a campaign is exceeding expectations, to pile on more and more stretch goals. We've reached the limit of what we think we can responsibly deliver, so we're drawing a happy line under what's been unlocked and get to work delivering on our promises.
Thank you, backers!
The Dice Miner backer pack is a collection of components and extras delivered only to Kickstarter backers. The exact contents of the backer pack depend on which stretch goals are unlocked, as decided by you, the backers. 
When bonus tunnel dice are unlocked, the ones you get in your backer pack will depend on which version of the game you're getting. Standard backers will get Standard Edition bonus dice, Deluxe backers will get Deluxe Edition bonus dice. 
Bonus Goals
"Adventuring Party" Play Mode: If six new heroes are unlocked, the "Adventuring Party" play mode will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. In this mode, each player gets three heroes per game, and uses a different one in each round. This bonus goal has been unlocked!
Liquid Courage Dice Game: If five tunnel dice are unlocked, a brand new dice game called Liquid Courage will also be automatically unlocked, and provided to all backers as a digital download. Created by our friends Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann at Steve Jackson Games, we'll let Sam tell you more below. This bonus goal has been unlocked! 
My co-designer, Randy Scheunemann, and I set out to create a variety of dice games that offer interesting choices and give players some control over how the game plays out. Yes, even the randomness of dice games can include meaningful choices!
We spent months working with this goal in mind, we designed a ton of different games, and then we ultimately narrowed it all down to 26 that we feel are the best of the bunch. Those games are all featured in our book, Random Fun Generator — A Collection of Dice Games, which will be offered in an upcoming Kickstarter campaign from Steve Jackson Games.
One of those games, Liquid Courage, was designed specifically for Atlas Games, with the awesome custom dice from Dice Miner in mind, and we hope you enjoy it! 
— Sam Mitschke / Chief Creative Officer / Steve Jackson Games 
We'll alert Dice Miner backers about the Random Fun Generator Kickstarter when it goes  live, but you can also monitor dice.sjgames.com, where the book will feature prominently when it launches. We're extremely happy to feature Liquid Courage as a stretch goal for Dice Miner backers.
Liquid Courage is best played with six tunnel dice per player, but we're unlocking it with the fifth backer pack tunnel die because backers can still play it easily by using the 27 tunnel dice form their copies of Dice Miner. If more tunnel die are added to the backer pack after the fifth one, so much the better.

updates.update_userinfo: Shipping Update: We Have the Games!
updates.update_content:
We Have the Games!
A truck containing the Dice Miner shipment arrived at our warehouse in Duluth, Minnesota this morning. We have photographic proof!

Ever Smart Making Good Time
Our tracking data suggests that the ship carrying our container of Dice Miner, the Ever Smart, is likely to arrive in Tacoma this afternoon. This is great news!
Keep in mind that there are often unexpected delays at port. We know that there will be some delays while the shipment is transloaded onto a truck for freighting to Minnesota. And of course, the trucking will also take time. But at this point, the number of left-field delays that might befall us continues to narrow the more legs of the journey we complete.
Pledge Manager Deadline

We Finally Kicked That Football
We got word from our freight forwarder that our May 8 sail date came true, and our container of Dice Miner is now en route from Shanghai.
Hooray!
What’s Next?

Not On the Water Yet
Our April 21 sailing didn’t succeed, but the strategies we discussed in our last update — meeting with our freight forwarder and expanding our list of possible entry ports — seem to be helping.
Routing the shipment to Tacoma seems like our best bet, so that’s the port we’re focusing on. Tacoma doesn’t have weeks worth of freighters backed up on the water waiting to unload, like Los Angeles does. Tacoma have pretty bad rail yard congestion at the moment, so it’s not without issues. But still.

April 4 Was a Bust
We learned last week that our booked sailing on April 4 failed. The next potential sail date we’ve received from our freight forwarder is April 21. This is terribly disappointing.
We're trying two new tactics, at this point, to increase the odds of successfully getting our games out of Shanghai:
We Are All Charlie Brown

No Steps Forward, One Step Back
As we reported in our last backer update, the Dice Miner shipment missed its first sailing date. Since then, our games have missed two additional sailing dates, the first on January 24, the second on February 7.
On top of that, we learned that contrary to our report in the last update, the Dice Miner shipment has not yet even been picked up from the factory. This makes some sense in retrospect. Since the factory is in relatively close proximity to the Shanghai port, if it’s known that a freighter booking has fallen apart, picking the games up from the factory only incurs the liability of additional storage fees until one of our bookings finally comes true, and does not even increase the chances of successfully making later bookings.

Shipping Update
The full shipment of Dice Miner games left the factory within a day or two of the December 22 departure date we estimated in our last update.
Our container is now (still) waiting at the port of Shanghai for its sail date. Why? Our freight forwarder advised us last week that our original booking was a “blank sailing.” This turns out to be a logistics term of art that describes a ship that plain didn’t show up where it was scheduled to be. If you’re interested in reading more, . (Universal Cargo is not our freight forwarder, but had the best explanation of a blank sailing on the first page of search results.)

Production Update
It has been a while since our last update, and although there is not very much that’s new or interesting to report, we’d like to keep you up to date.
Testing samples were produced and shipped to our contract lab on more or less the timeline we expected in our last update. The testing process alerted us to a few minor issues, but we were able to deal with them relatively easily, and without delaying the production process. (The process was not delayed because the testing process ran in parallel with the balance of bulk dice production, per our report in the last update.)

Rundown #19: By the Wonderful Wizard's Beard!! The Stretch Reward  Adtherpe's Greater Book of Material Ecology, Herbology and Alchemy and the FREE PDF is a go! Thank you all for Joining the Fray! It is appreciated more than you'll ever know!
Adtherpe was a wizard of some renown! He fought in the Winter Dark Wars and ended his days upon the Wheel of Pins in Aufstrag. But before his tragic binding he was a scholar of some great repute and he penned two volumes of works whose worth far exceeded most of his kind, either before him or since. Adtherpe’s Guide to Herbologyand Alchemy and Adtherpe’s Material Ecology.
CURIOUS What's in it? Well here's the Index of the Existing CKG:  CKG INDEX! 
Chat with us on DISCORD: This is one of the first Kickstarters we've had since we launched our Discord Server.  We've started a channel for this Kickstarter called #ckg-kickstarter-chat which we hope you will join.  Trolls and mods are on hand to help answer questions, discuss the CKG, and to hang out.  You can join with this link:  https://discord.gg/jy6us48 
 ALSO: Steve will be on Twitch Stream tomorrow (Tuesday, April 7) at 4pm Central with his weekly Troll Talk AMA; and will be discussing the CKG KS among anything else you would like to ask! https://www.twitch.tv/trolllordgames/
Here below is the full canvas of the covers (from left to right) Monsters & Treasure, Castle Keepers Guide, Players Handbook and Adventurers Backpack! We are working toward making these into one large screen
Each chapter of the Castle Keeper’s Guide explores new avenues to solve old problems, supplies frameworks for the CK and player, and adds optional rules for all modes of play. Many of these rules add a whole new layer, or several layers, of structure to a game whose true value lies in its rules light approach to role playing problems. In order to mitigate the potential for rule-clusters to overburden situational circumstances within a game properly governed from the hip by the CK, the Castle Keepers Guide takes an unusual approach. Where applicable, the CKG presents several different types of rules to expand the game. These options are very generally broken down into three categories: role playing, rules light, and rules heavy. 
The Castle Keepers Guide is one of the most detailed reference books for game masters on the market today. It includes a plethora of material to help game masters run games, develop worlds, create NPCs, organize monsters, tips on how to run games, extra combat rules, army battle rules, and so very much more. Though designed for Castles & Crusades, much of the information in this book can be applied to ANY RPG. From the discussion on Biomes to the size of towns and cities; from cave types to critical hit tables; from types of ships and wagons to aerial combat maneuvers; from how much land to award a Knight, to what kind of order a druid has. The CKG is filled with mountains upon mountains of material.
The Table of Contents says it all:
Expanding Characters
Magic
Expanding Equipment
Non-Player Characters
The World
The City
Dungeons
Air and Water Adventure
Equipment Wastage
Land as Treasure
Going to War
Monster Ecology
Expanding the Genre
Advancing the Game
The Siege Engine
Treasure
Iron and Sulfur: Combat
Skill Packages
Character Death and Fates  
 WHAT’S NEW
The Castle Keepers Guide is chock full of mountains of useful material, more than you imagine. But we want to make it even better. Whole sections of the book could use illustrations to better help the game master and the player understand what it they are seeing and doing and how best to do it. From types of ships and wagons to types of barrels and traps; from fortresses to towns from caves to dungeons. It's all in the CKG, now it's time to illustrate it. A sample of the Intended illustrations include the following:
Carrying Items
Wagons
Ships
Biomes
Setting Age
Towns and cities
Fortresses
Types of Houses
Caves
Sample Dungeon map with all room types
Aerial Maneuvers
Catapults
Armor Types   
To make this happen we'll turn to a host of veteran illustrators and artists: Peter Bradley, Jason Walton, Zoe DeVos, Alyssa Faden and others!
 WHAT ELSE IS NEW
We are going to expand the classes presented in the Adventurers Backpack.
The Index will be overhauled and expanded.
Many charts will be revised to include new information such as costs!
What is the World of Aihrde on World Anvil?  
The World of Aihrde is our world of choice, created and developed by our CEO Stephen Chenault.  It’s an amazingly detailed and vibrant world, full of history, timelines, lands, peoples, fiction, kingdoms, and more, including many, many, many maps. There is a Players Guide to Aihrde, a Monsters & Treasure, the Codex of Aihrde, tons of adventures, multiple short stories and collections all set in Aihrde.  In short, we believe it to be one of the most comprehensive and fleshed out RPG world on the market today.  
World Anvil is a website that can bring that world to life.  The creators of World Anvil, Dimitris and Janet, have ingeniously put together a site where we can bring all of our world from our books to the screen.  Imagine all of the world at your fingertips… want to research an area and find an adventure to play?  It’s in there.  Want to read about the All Father and Aufstrag and how the world was created?  It’s in there.  Images, maps, a searchable database that can bring up any image, article, history you want.  And we are still growing.  Every day more articles are being put up.  Over 700 right now and growing.    
With your pledge, you will gain access to this world and all that it entails.  There are many different tiers that will be available, but you are getting a tier submission as part of your pledge.  And for now, at least for a short time, we are leaving the World of Aihrde on World Anvil open for you to get a look at what you will be getting.  Please check it out here and if you would do us a favor and follow us on there as well, we’d sure appreciate it.  Here’s the link:  https://www.worldanvil.com/w/world-of-aihrde-trolllordgames
OTHER GAME SYSTEMS
In the CKG you’ll discover the source of the success of Castles & Crusades, a game that has been on the market since 2004! The simplicity of the Siege Engine allows any game master to adjust the game to their style. The CKG only enhances that. Many of the sections in the book are system neutral, though some you may have to adjust to your game of choice!   
At the $99 pledge level you reap not only the Castle Keepers Guide but two resource books that will help you at the table and enhance play. 
CKG Chart Folio: This perfect bound and digital book includes all the charts and tables from the CKG in one small book. It includes player content like divine attributes and beauty as well as the game master's charts such as critical hit and human habitation sizes. It will also include all informational tables and charts like those on wagons and ships.
C&C Master Index: This perfect bound and digital book will also be available in an online platform. It will include an index for all three of the core Castles & Crusades books. This is a massive undertaking but we hope to have a definitive resource for you table. We'll make the online version, as well as the digital version, searchable by word for quick and easy reference. The index will tell you what book and what you need for anything and most everything. The online version will be updated. What about other books? See the stretch rewards below!  
Running a game can be so very much more. With your help, we can make this Kickstarter so much more for your table and your players.  
$10,000: FUNDED! Funding Goal! If we hit this goal, the Castle Keepers Guide illustrated is a go!
$14,000: World Anvil: Unlocked! Anyone who backs the Kickstarter at $50 pledge level and above receives an extra free month on their subscription to the World Anvil.
$16,000: Expanding Master Index: Unlocked! We will include the Adventurers Backpack in the Master Index! All levels who receive the Master Index will receive this stretch reward.
$18,000: Consumables Charts! Unlocked! We'll include a bundle of time and consumable charts to help you track both time and rations consumed! These will be easy to use on card stock.
$20,000: Expanding Master Index: Unlocked! We will include the Tome of the Unclean in the Master Index! All levels who receive the Master Index will receive this stretch reward. 
$21,000: Layered PDF:Unlocked! We are going to create the digital PDF of the Castle Keepers Guide with layers. This will allow you to turn on and off layers and puts you in the driver seat to determine how it looks on your screen. 
$23,000 Expanding Master Index: Unlocked! We are going to include all the material in the Castle Keepers Guide to the Haunted Highlands in the Master Index. This will allow you easily find the wealth of information in Casey Christofferson's wonderful game masters tool.
$25,000 Alternate Cover: Unlocked! Just like the Players Handbook, we are going to bring in Jason Walton to do an alternate cover for the Castle Keepers Guide! We will give you the option of which version you want when we ship it! (or if you want both, just add an extra copy to your pledge through add ons).
$27,000  Adtherpe's Guide to Herbalism and Alchemy: Unlocked!! A handbook on the locating, harvesting, and applications of various flora, fauna and minerals. Whether used to create simple enhancements and/or healing potions, salves and poultices or used to manufacture even more complex items such as poisons, acids, oils or incendiaries in various forms such as powders, ointments, liquids, gases etc., you will find it all to be useful knowledge. A digital copy available for the $49 level and above. A print and digital copy made available to the $99 level and above! 
$30,000 Adtherpe's Material Ecology: Unlocked! A study of the anatomy of various aberrations, animals, beasts, constructs, dragons, elementals, fey, giants, humanoids, monstrous and otherwise, magical beasts, oozes, plants, undead and vermin and the practical applications derived from harvesting thereof. We will roll this into the Herbology book above, making one large book tentatively called Adtherpe's Greater Book of Material Ecology, Herbology and Alchemy. A digital copy available for the $49 level and above. A print and digital copy made available to the $99 level and above!
$31,157: Free PDF: Unlocked! Everyone at the $99 level and above can chose a free PDF of their choice. Price of PDF has to be under $10.00!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Large books such as this one are hard to print and bind and we have to choose our printers with care. One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves. We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Our books have a long shelf life. They are professionally bound using smyth sewn techniques which give them high durability despite continued use.
Reusability and recyclability
Paper scrap from the manufacturing process is recycled, meaning that creating the book leaves almost no waste. The book too can be recycled if needed.
Sustainable materials
The book will be made of paper. Many of the stretch rewards are digital. All shipping material is bio-degradable, including our packing peanuts (they are made of starch and dissolve in water).
Environmentally friendly factories
The book will be produced in the United States with paper and paper products manufactured locally, reducing the amount of trans-oceanic fuel costs for both shipment of raw materials and the finished product. All the paper and scrap is bio-degradable or recyclable.
Sustainable Distribution
We use only card boxes, paper and packing peanuts made of corn starch, all of which are biodegradable. The packing peanuts in particular, as they dissolve in water, leaving no waste whatsoever.

updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,

Just a quick update. As you know, The Castle Keepers Guide is at the printers but now the proofs are ready for its final approval (this takes about 2 hours) and then its just a matter of turnaround time. I should have all the proofs done this weekend or on Monday at the latest. 

Keep in mind that we print everything in the United States and should not suffer any delays due to whatever is going on over yonder ways, however, they have cautioned me that due to continued problems from the last year's mess, that they have a slightly slower turn around schedule. Usually it is 3 weeks, it is now 4 or so. So it might be the last week of June or the first week of July before we see them.

We are at the end here folks!  We went through all the corrections on the Castle Keepers Guide you posted and you caught a bunch of it. The tables are all repaired, and headers sorted and a few things besides. Also, I added the long-standing to the list of ships and slipped its picture in there. We'll muse over it for about a week and then send this mountain to the printers! Trollzah!

campaign.story:
After more than ten years of requests, we're finally producing a boxed set for the Swords & Wizardry rules, the original ancestor of 5e. It's a fast-playing, wild ride into the world of the fantastic, with the same depth of play as its later-edition brethren. A fantasy role-playing game with a distinct feel to it, different from later editions of the game ... and now it comes in a box!
What is Swords & Wizardry?
Swords & Wizardry is more than a re-statement of the original rules that gave rise to 5e. It is fast-playing, easy to start, and easy to learn by anyone. Swords and Wizardry is  a snapshot of the rules as they existed in 1978 right before "first edition" was released. The fifth edition game currently played, watched and beloved by millions is great fun, but the structure of the rules has changed over the course of editions, and there's a unique feel to the earlier versions of the game which you may not have encountered before.
The rules in Swords & Wizardry are based on the original 1974 game, plus all of the supplements released from 1974 to 1978, articles in the Strategic Review and the Dragon magazine from that period, plus tips for house rules choices. The rules are organized in a more modern fashion than the original books, and are more accessible to those who started gaming after the 1970s. 
Distinct, Different Style of Play
These original rules are considerably different than the 5e version you may be familiar with. Here’s a quick run-down of how the “feel” of the game can be very different:
Character generation is very fast, and contains less detail (and fewer choices to make) about specific skills or tailored options.
Combat moves along quickly, and tactics are based on what the player describes doing rather than on anything listed on a character sheet.
In general, the “lighter” approach of these rules leads to certain effects on game play:
Since combat occupies less time, there is often more focus on exploration and puzzle-solving than there is in later editions of the game. You don’t have to “reserve” time for long combats.
Since there are no established rules for noticing things, figuring out how mechanisms work, or interpreting language, there is more scope for presenting “puzzles” as tests of skill for the players. Player problem-solving is more direct in earlier editions of the game.
Role-playing is just as robust as in later editions of the game; it emerges from the players and the way a particular gaming group operates.
Swords & Wizardry is about “rulings" not "rules,” and a lot of players describe a test for whether it’s working well: when the Referee describes a situation and the players don’t immediately look down at their character sheets for their options, that’s when they're in the "Original D&D Zone."

Swords and Wizardry Box Set Contents
Swords & Wizardry Box Set
Four Softcover Rule-books 
Player Book
Spells & Magic
Monsters
Referee's Book
Also includes
Extra height is reserved for dice,minis, adventures or ... expansions?
But wait, there's more! We are also offering a Collector's Box Set limited to 500 boxes.
Swords & Wizardry Collector's Edition Box Set (Limited Quantities Available)
 All boxed sets will be shrink-wrapped and packaged expertly by our manufacturing partner.
Note: The content of both box sets are identical. The boxes themselves are the same size but the collector box has a more retro image stickered outside, while the regular box has a full-color image printed on the box itself. The collector box is not a "deluxe" set; it is a variant box with a limited production run. It is not real wood - it is cardboard like the regular box.

Swords & Wizardry Digital Pack
Swords & Wizardry Digital Box Set

Swords & Wizardry Extras Pack
We will NOT be using a pledge manager (like BackerKit) for this project. Therefore, there will not be add-ons available immediately after the project closes. Items unlocked MAY be available for purchase at the Frog God Games Web Store. They are only guaranteed to those who choose a reward tier that includes a box set. They can be added by anyone who purchased a box set at time of shipping payment (see shipping section below).
Swords & Wizardry Box Set Extras

Deluxe Referee Screen- We will create a four-panel deluxe GM Screen. The lay flat dimensions are expected to be 35.5" x 5.5" and will fold to 8.5" x 5.5" for storage. It will be the highest quality we can make it, since we already have the art and it's incredible.
The wonderful illustration for the Referee's Screen by Michael Syrigos
Swords & Wizardry Supplement 1- MOAR Monsters. This monster book will be about 48 digest-sized pages, filled with monsters from Monstrosities and a few new ones. Monstrosities is too big to re-print, so we're going to work the monsters into these supplements for those who didn't get a copy of Monstrosities way back when.
Baron's Gambit- An all new adventure module for Swords & Wizardry by Matt Finch.
Making it Better with Stretch Goals
 If project goals are exceeded everyone wins, thanks to the law of Kickstarter economics: more $$$$ = better stuff and more stuff for everyone.
 All stretch goals after the dice and character sheet pad are digital deliveries, not physical products.

A few notes on the stretch goals:
 The digital spell cards include the name of the spell and the spell description, one card per spell. These are great for when players need an easy reference handout when casting a spell, or a way to keep track of remaining spells. Our spell-card stretch goals are broken up by class: Druid, Magic-User, and Cleric. Each deck of cards contains spells used for that class.
Digital spell books contain the spells used for each independent class: for example, the druid spell book contains only the druid spells. This way the player doesn’t have to search through the whole spell list to find the ones they can use. One version of the spell books will be organized in letter-size format and another version will be in digest-sized format for those who wish to construct their own booklets to match the size of the box.
The Future Crowdfunding isn’t truly a stretch goal, but it means we’ve hit a level where it makes sense to run an Indiegogo for the character reference cards in physical form. It doesn’t actually add anything to the delivery for backers, but we’ll let everyone know when it starts.
The 4 Useful Sheets are physical pages added to the Extras Pack, not into the boxed set. We haven’t narrowed down yet which tables are the best candidates for inclusion here, because we’re hoping to get all the way to the 16 page booklet.
The Ready Reference booklet is a physical booklet added to the Extras Pack. It will contain various tables and resources that a Referee might want to look up quickly.
 Note: Stretch goals are only added to pledge rewards that include a Swords & Wizardry Box Set or backers of the Swords & Wizardry Digital Pack. One Exception: the last stretch goals (Useful Sheets and Ready Reference Tables) apply to the Extras Pack, not to the Boxed Sets.
Find out more in the Swords and Wizardry Communities
For the duration of the Swords & Wizardry Box Set project we will be having discussions, special videos, and other social media activities. These will take place on Discord, YouTube, and Facebook.
Discord
Discord is an all-in-one voice and text chat for gamers that’s free, secure, and works on both your desktop and phone.
How do I get to the Frog God Games Discord? Follow these Steps:
 Step 1.) Go here https://discordapp.com/download 
 Step 2.) Click which is best for you: Windows, Mac, Android, IOS, or Linux and download it.
 Step 3.) Once Discord has finished downloading, click the “+” button surrounded by a dotted circle on the left hand side
 Step 4.) Click the “Join a Server” button and copy and paste this into it https://discord.gg/QwEDcxE 
YouTube
Our YouTube channel has videos quick introductions to Swords & Wizardry. as well as detailed descriptions of some of the many facets of its "rulings, not rules" play-style. More videos are planned as the project progresses.
 Step 1). Click on the image above to watch a short video about Swords & Wizardry.
 Step 2.) If you want comment on this or future videos just click on the red 'subscribe' button below the video in your browser or YouTube App.
Facebook
Click here to visit our Facebook page. If you have not done so already click 'Like' to keep up with Kickstarter and other related content.
Shipping and Post-Project Changes
Shipping is NOT included in the pledge and is NOT collected on KICKSTARTER. It will be charged right before the rewards are shipped on our web page. 
Some changes from our previous Kickstarter projects
1. We will NOT be using a pledge manager (like Backerkit) for this project. All pledges are locked when the project ends, we will not have a method to change your pledge reward after the project closes.
2. We will not be charging shipping until your rewards are packed. This leaves out guesswork and allows for maximum flexibility in selecting the carrier and packaging material for your reward.
3. This project’s rewards will all be shipped priority mail (or equivalent) to domestic and international backers.
Note to international backers
We continue to see cost increases and damage increases on overseas shipping. We cannot do anything about this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We actually have considered not even selling books and games overseas due to the complaints about postage. That being said, we have a number of long term customers that we want to be able to get our stuff. But this postage stuff is not for the faint of heart. We cannot give an honest shipping quote until we charge shipping because we just do not know the costs for future deliveries in every country.
Refunds and replacements
We will happily ship your game anywhere you indicate on your Kickstarter survey provided that regular service is available from the USA (e.g., to nations subject to trade embargoes or to other planets). If your rewards are damaged or missing after shipment we will replace the damaged or missing items.  However, we will NOT process refunds for unshipped items.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Frog God Games has been in business since 2010, and has fulfilled numerous (26!) Kickstarter projects. As with any crowdfunding program, the time-lapse between payment and delivery of a final product is subject to various risks, including the failure of a supplier, damage in shipment, disruptions within a company, and changes in the prices of materials and shipping. Experience gained over a number of projects makes us confident that we have contingency plans for the ordinary, foreseeable issues that might arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Nothing is more immersive than pulling a literal arcane tome, book of shadows, or grimoire straight from your game and onto your gaming table. In this Kickstarter you’ll create your own customized pocket-sized highly prized Spellbook to encase your dice and miniatures. You’ll personalize the art, material components, and design to manifest your imagination. Living materials together with millions of combinations means your Spellbook Mini will be your own showpiece unlike any other.
As with their predecessors, Spellbook Minis are crafted in luxurious foil-stamped leather, individualized signature art, and a spectacular array of hand-finished natural wood options. Except smaller. They've got a felt or leather lined lid that forms a rolling tray, removable foam to keep your contents safe, and rare-earth magnets to lock down the pocket-package for gaming on the go.
A book of adventures adventuring within an adventuring book
With multiple configurable interior designs to choose from, these tiny tasteful testaments to talented tradesmanship are travel-tamed teeny trunks teeming with the tools to transport your tentorial tidbits tangibly to the tabletop. Read on to learn the details of how you can customize yours, including Kickstarter exclusives and special editions made possible by the folks at Penny Arcade, Infinite Black, and Abbot’s Hollow. Get your eldritch adventures started right and build your personalized tome today!
Zoop zoop zoop!
He's probably just sleeping >.>
When writing your adventurer's Spellbook, make sure each leaf represents who you are and how you game. If you want full control over building your Spellbook Mini, pledge for the Classic Spellbook Mini reward. Scroll down to "building and customization" to learn about the options available, or if scrolling is too fraught use our pledge builder tool to digitally preview every modifiable aspect of your new tome.
It all makes sense if you are bad at noticing things
Astral Elder Sign Spellbook Minis, shown in emerald and crimson leather with gold foil
Elderwood and Infinite Black have teamed up to add the occult horror of the Cthulhu mythos  to your games with Infinite Black’s Elder Dice and special-edition Spellbook Minis. Infinite Black is helmed by David LaRocca and Heath Robinson, experts in Lovecraftian madness and game narrative. They’ve masterfully created a monstrous family of gaming gear to perfectly enhance your fantasy and horror roleplaying experience, and now you can enjoy those dreadful dividends in natural hardwood, real leather, and bespoke foil-pressed art.
Choose one of six special-edition Spellbook Minis that uniquely blends Elderwood and Infinite Black’s craftsmanship and artistic style. Bring some primordial havoc to your game with these tomes of the elder gods.
Mark of the Necronomicon Spellbook Mini, shown in crimson leather and pewter foil
Yellow Sign Spellbook Mini, shown in emerald leather and gold foil
Elder Sign Spellbook Mini, shown in emerald leather and gold foil
Brand of Cthulhu Spellbook Mini, shown in lapis leather and gold foil
Sigil of the Dreamlands Spellbook Mini, shown in crimson leather and gold foil
As a special Kickstarter exclusive we've included limited Doom Edition printings, versions of each Infinite Black Spellbook Mini forged in black leather with red foil pressed art. No matter which Spellbook Mini you land on, you can choose to complete the look by adding on a set of Elder Dice, themed arrays of nine polyhedral dice (1d4, 3d6, 1d8, 1d10, 1d100, 1d12, 1d20) with unique eldritch art replacing the highest value.
Use the tables below or visit our automated pledgebuilder to check out all the possible combinations and Kickstarter exclusives!
An example of the Doom Edition Infinite Black Spellbook Mini, featuring onyx leather and maroon foil
Felt cute, might eat later
One shipment of Spellbook Minis lingered too long at Abbot’s Hollow Studios, and we’re pleased to dispo- *offer* those transfigured Mini Monster Spellbooks to anyone who desires a brisk and invigorating dose of peril. Mini Monsters are lovingly brought to life by the Necromancer Cieszynski, who has stitched together Elderwood’s classic hardwood and luxurious designs with old fashioned Necro-how to create dice-and-miniature chomping abominations. Game dangerously; risk your most precious gaming goods with any of the four Mini Monster designs, Grin, Scowl, Cyclops Grin or Cyclops Scowl. Point your browser at Igor, our cuthtom pledge builder cuthtodian if you require virtual assistance with choosing the right Monster for you.
These official Penny Arcade field guides (issued at nominal cost to all new employees of Acquisitions Inc.) contain tips and tricks to make it to the end of day 1 with most essential organs still intact. Learn to thrive from the best in the business. Each pocketbook contains ten Corporate-Issue random number generators (in seven denominations with four random variance cubes), and a reference guide entitled "How To Labor Post Mortem." Choose between the Intern Survival Guide and the Employee Manual. If you want a little more detail on what your book could look like, visit the pledge assistant portal to start digitally previewing your new adventuring life right away! 
Survival on the left, employee decorum and expectations on the right
While the Classic Spellbook Mini reward offers by far the most freedom to craft your ideal book, the Special Editions include a host of adjustable features of their own. Read on to learn about all the ways in which you can create your optimized build. 
It's... right behind me, isn't it?
Cover Art
With Classic Mini Spellbook rewards, you can choose from our wide array of Signature and Premium art for your cover. For this campaign you'll be able to select your border and icon art foil colors in gold, silver, bronze, pewter, black, ocean, maroon, forest, holographic, or red holographic.
Live in a summoning circle, visit fancy vistas!
Leather Selection
Available in the Classic Mini Spellbook reward and select Special Edition rewards, pick from one of our three vole-skin soft leathers to adorn your 'Book. Stay tuned for even more options if we reach our stretch goals!

Wood options
Available to all tiers, you'll choose what wood will make up the sanded-smooth hand-finished core of your Spellbook Mini. Choose from domestic and exotic hardwoods like classic Cherry, dark Walnut, regal Purpleheart, and midnight Wenge. Follow our stretch goals for added wood options as the campaign continues!

Interior Design
Spellbook Minis come in four configurations; the sleek and slim Open and Decader, and the virtuous and mighty Hero and Extended. Open and Extended come with removable foam inserts to help cradle your gear, while Hero and Decader include precision carved geography to keep your gaming kit spellbound. All four include the option to level up the lining to leather, adding luster to the lid's built-in miniature rolling tray. Be aware that only Hero and Extended are tall enough to fit 28mm miniature bases.
Check out the pledge guide below to figure out exactly what you should pledge for each reward. If you're unsure, you can preview and confirm your pledges at our custom pledge building page, which navigates and simulates each Spellbook Mini right before your eyes. 


Cool books don't look at raging rapids
Elderwood Academy is managed by a fine crew of gnome trainers and goblin tamers, working out of an abandoned and slightly haunted mine. We've been creating wooden fun-iture for your D&D table for 5 years and we're excited to add Spellbook Minis to our stable. As always, if you want to reach out and speak to someone, or you much desire one of our artisinal gnome selfies, reach out to info@elderwoodacademy.com and your requestions will be supplied.

updates.update_content:
As Joey Tempest would say, "doo-doo doo-doo, doo-doo doot doot doot" which I assume translates from Swedish to mean "this is the final update, my friends!" We're very close to wrapping up sending out the last clutch of the Kickstarter Mini Spellbooks, and through all of your help we can now offer them on an ongoing basis :D
So! Thank you all so much for bringing Mini Spellbooks to life! In some cases, literally. These last months have been such a blast getting to know all of you and getting to bring your individual visions of a perfect miniaturized book o' spells to life. All despite or possibly in part because the world also armageddon'd while we were at it.

Ayo fellow citizens! The cellophane tape over our protective enclosures is slowly being peeled off and we're getting back into the swing of things. We're (incrementally, safely) returning to cranking our levers and ... pedal powering our... blazers through the next weeks! As is expected, we've had some crafting delays across the board with all the quarantining and such; thank you for being patient with us!

updates.update_userinfo: The End of the World Affects Us Too
updates.update_content:
It turns out that when the world is on fire making stuff out of wood is dicey. With the hydra of COVID-19 breathing down everyone's necks, we first and foremost want to wish you all a safe and (hopefully) tolerable quarantine, and remind you that the phrase "social distancing" can be used (screamed) proactively at people you don't like.
We're not immune to the effects of world-ending pandemics either, so shipping and orders for Spellbook Minis will be on hold through April 14th. If you're the owner of one of the ~200 or so incomplete surveys, now is an excellent time to fill yours in please! There's time now! There's finally time!

Grandiose Greetings! I can’t think of a better greeting gathering gaudy alliteration groupings…
Onward!

updates.update_userinfo: Happy Holidays! Shipping update, and our new spider overlords
updates.update_content:
HAPPY HOLIDAYS, FRIENDS! Spellbook Minis and their product when viewed in a mirror, Mini Spellbooks, are racing out the workshop faster than a photon at a greasy pig rally. It’s hard to see them go. Literally. Because our eyesight is average and photons are tiny.
Early Bird and Holiday tiers are on schedule to wrap up and leave their webby nest within the next few days, while 2020 tiers will start shipping in January. If you haven’t submitted your survey, please get it done by December 20! Jane will appreciate the heads up, and it’ll help us send you things sooner. Win-win!

updates.update_userinfo: Surveys Are Out! First deadline November 8th!
updates.update_content:
Greetings fellow kids, do you know where we can buy some… miniaturized leather-and-wooden Spellbooks? Surveys are finally bug-free and ready to clickin’. Surveys *should* all be in whichever email inbox you attach to Kickstarter - if you do not see an email from Pledgemanager check your spam folder, and if it’s not there please reach out to us at info@elderwoodacademy.com
If you are in a December delivery pledge tier, orders must be in by November 8th! That gives us sufficient time to build your lovely customized order well in time for the holidays.

Ayyyyy gang! Today was to be Survey Day, the day we use our optical leveling kits and prisms to document local geography.
Sorry, wait, today was to be the other kind of Survey, where you send us your Spellbook Mini builds, but they're still in final stages of testing and it looks like those will be ready very early next week. As soon as they’re racing at your inboxes we’ll post another update!
In the meantime, we’re turning the wheels and spinning the … wheels of crafting as fast as ever. We’ve pre-built loads and loads of Spellbook Mini limbs, skins, and organs. As soon as surveys are completed we’ll be able to smoothly sew together your order Frankenstein’s-monster style.

updates.update_userinfo: Campaign accomplished! Thank you all so much!
updates.update_content:
Brace yourselves, we’re coming in for a hug! Thank you all so so much for an amazing campaign! Together you’ve helped make tiny leatherbound gaming books a tiny reality. Throughout the campaign you’ve unlocked stretch goals that are going to make the next parts even more fun! And possibly very complex!
With the campaign officially completed, we’re slamming both feet on the gas of production (ick). Check out Crafting HQ already hard at work

Splendid morning and salutations, Kickstarteers! We’ve finally crossed that magical threshold where there are enough of us to start a royal guard. We were thinking 17th century French themed, ‘cause muskets are cool and the DM said they were allowed.

campaign.story:
The Grand Duchy of Reme awaits!
Starting in 2002 Necromancer Games began populating its Lost Lands campaign setting one adventure at a time. The Grand Duchy of Reme is the region home to classic adventures released by Necromancer Games for D20/3.x and Frog God Games for Pathfinder, Swords & Wizardry and Fifth Edition. 
More than 10 adventures have brought life to the Grand Duchy of Reme. The Lost Lands Campaign Sourcebook funded in January is expected to be over 700 pages and all of them are full of information. By necessity each region was described broadly, but there are still a wealth of history, politics and other details to be explored, experience and expanded in the Grand Duchy of Reme. 
The Grand Duchy of Reme is a system neutral hardcover volume designed to be useful for campaigns independent of system preference. Specific details that affect the characters in the Lost Lands there are System Encounter Books. These companion volumes are softcover (or PDF), that contain reference stats for use with the Region book along with detailed encounter tables for the region.
Additionally, 3 classic adventures previously unavailable for Pathfinder, Swords & Wizardry, and Fifth Edition are back. These are offered as either softcover add-ons in backerkit or as free stretch goals in PDF (see reward sidebar).
Mock-up of Grand Duchy of Reme. Final release will differ slightly
The city of Reme itself is ancient, with world-spanning trade — the eternal citadel of the Loreclans, where the ashes of legendary barbarian kings reside. This land lies near the slow collapse of the nearby Empire of Foere, and the rise of Bard’s Gate to the East. The Rhemish watch these events with cold eyes rather than concern, for they live in vast regions that devour invaders. Their land is eternal; their people can be forced back to the plains, but in the plains they can abide for as long as need be. They are — as a people — the ultimate hunters. The fall of Foere is like the fall of an antelope upon the plains; the rise of Bard’s Gate is little more than the stepping-up of jackals before the body. The Grand Duchy of Reme simply waits and watches — for Reme is the dwelling-place of the world’s wolves.
Reme is a unique fantasy civilization whose structure is determined by the one overriding fact of its geography — the country is a vast, grassland plain. The realm is dominated by the culture of the ancient Loreclans: the urbanized and settled ones, and the nomadic clans of the interior. The Loreclans owe a certain fealty to the Dukes of Reme, who are the final arbiters of the ancient law of the plains, but between the Loreclans and the Dukes there are also the mysterious Pashtars: arbiters, judges, and mediators who roam the plains where their service takes them.
The city of Reme, of course, is one of the wonders of the world of the Lost Lands, home of powerful spell-casters and perhaps the greatest mercantile and war fleets of the Crescent Sea. It is also, however, steeped in the culture of the vast plains of the interior. It is a place where assumptions are dangerous, for it is no standard fantasy environment — it is a culture that will be entirely new and foreign to your players, a place to truly explore as well as adventure.
***NPCs & Loreclan stretch goal(s) PDF rewards will be fulfilled as a single PDF volume as they are unlocked***

We have selected several items associated with the setting as add-ons for our customers this time. This includes three adventures set in the Grand Duchy itself, as well as premium items and adventure aids for the region!
Note - Why Pathfinder 1.0? Because many of our long time fans and customers have asked for it. Several of you have invested thousands of dollars in Lost Lands books for Pathfinder 1.0, so we are trying to support it as long as we can. To this end we have made the Pathfinder availability an early stretch goal to maintain profitability in case of lower than expected print runs.
Deluxe Leather Edition of the Lost Lands: Grand Duchy of Reme — A deluxe version of the book, library bound in genuine leather, $200. Your choice of Swords and Wizardry or 5th Edition.
System Encounter Book ($14 PDF, $24 Softcover plus PDF)
Convenient Reference Guide to Reme. These books come in two varieties, one for 5th Edition and one for Swords & Wizardry (and for Pathfinder 1.0 if unlocked). They contain reference stats for use with the Region book for easy use at the gaming table and to convert the system-neutral book into your rules-system of choice, as well as detailed encounter tables for the region. Keep your reference stats and general description open at the same time in separate books. The stats contained in the Convenient Reference Guide are not included in the main book itself. 
Necromancer Games Adventures for Fifth Edition, Swords & Wizardry and Pathfinder 1.0!
These 3 classic adventures had been unavailable for Pathfinder, Swords & Wizardry, and Fifth Edition. These are offered here as softcover add-ons in backerkit and as free PDF stretch goals (see reward sidebar).These will have new covers, full color art, and are upfdtaed  and expanded.
Necromancer Classics located in Reme return for Fifth Edition, Swords & Wizardry and Pathfinder 1.
The Tower of Jhedophar ($7 PDF, $17 Softcover plus PDF in same version as print)
 Once an academy of arcane learning, the tower of Jhedophar now stands as a testament to the greed of two powerful foes. The tower is guarded by a massive labyrinth filled with deadly traps, vicious adversaries and unlikely allies. Who among the brave may wrest the Mandrake Staff from Jhedophar’s bony grasp? Remember heroes, dragons and liches do not let loose their treasures lightly!
Jhedophar is about to take your party through his welcoming tower. Art by Adrian Landeros.
Will the adventurers take the dragon's deal and attempt to slay Jhedophar in his fortress of evil or take the Lich’s deal and rid his tower of the pesky squatter Exeterus once and for all? Designed for characters of 13th-15th level, the Tower of Jhedophar offers just the right mix of fast-paced action and clever role play. 
The Grey Citadel $14 PDF, $24 Softcover plus PDF in same version as print)
Adventure in Dun Eamon: Demons roam the streets of the city of Dun Eamon, criminals rule the night and an important local power figure has gone missing. Can your heroes unravel the clues that lead through every social element of the city, into the hearts of its inhabitants and far below its streets in search of answers? Or are some mysteries better left unsolved?
Uncover An Artifact: The Grey Citadel is a mini-campaign of urban detective work and dungeon exploration designed for four or more characters of 5th level. Set in a rain-soaked, rough-and-tumble frontier city, The Grey Citadel offers numerous colorful NPCs, a richly unique location, new monsters and magic items, plus enough plot twists to provide hours of role-playing and door-kicking adventure where your wits must be as sharp as your swords!
The Siege of Durgam’s Folly ($7 PDF, $17 Softcover plus PDF in same version as print)
Travel to a Distant Outpost: Durgam's Folly sits at the edge of the kingdom, an embattled outpost against the evil creatures of the wild. You travel with a caravan to that distant fortress, transporting mysterious cargo. But as you approach your destination, something is amiss. A local hamlet is in ruins. Strange creatures patrol the land. Has the famed fortress finally been overthrown?
New cover for the Siege of Durgam's Folly. Art by Joshua Stewart.
Battle an Unexpected Foe: The Siege of Durgam's Folly includes maps of the fortress of Durgam's Folly and the chambers beneath. It details a strange new set of monsters that will plague your campaign for years to come. Can your learn the dark secrets of the remote fortress? And in the end, will your party discover who or what is truly behind the siege of Durgam's Folly? A fantasy adventure for 4 to 6 characters of 5th to 8th level.
Tapestry Map — A 71 inch by 72 inch cloth map of Reme. $125
 Made on high-quality fabric these huge maps have become a favorite add-on for our backers. These ship separately from the main reward at no extra charge for backers pledging $40 or more.
The city awaits.
Special Note to the Temple of the Frog Pledge
This premium pledge requires some explanation. First of all: All shipping costs are included with this pledge level. The Temple of the Frog Pledge gets you an invite to join the Froggies at North Texas RPG Con 2020 in June or at Gamehole Con in November 2020 (your choice of 1). At this event, we will pay for your:
Convention badge 
Hotel room 
Meals and beverages
All you pay is your transportation to and from the convention! Shipping is also FREE, anywhere in the world! This is where you get to hang out with us behind the scenes, eat dinners with us, play in our games during the day, and generally stay up late without your parents telling you that it's bedtime. Ask any of our fans that have bought this pledge before, it’s truly a wonderful experience! This reward also includes automatic entry into a game game run by Frog God at North Texas RPG Con or at Gamehole Con! 

All Frog God Games hardcovers are stitched into 16-page packets, the packets are sewn together, and then all the packets are sewn to a cloth backing, creating a book block that is glued to its cover. This is what we mean when we say "library binding."  That being said, after a myriad of book-binding issues both recently and dating back to 2nd Edition, there is nothing we hate to see more than someone investing in an expensive game book and having it fall apart on them after only a short period of regular use.  After all, you guys spend a lot of money on your books! Second, if a Frog God hardcover book ever falls apart (we have tested this with baseball bats and very rough use, by the way), we will replace it at no cost assuming we still have one in stock. Yes, that means if you call me in ten years, and your book binding has failed you (failed us really) through regular use (please no bulldozer roll overs), just email me and if the book is still in stock, we will mail you a new copy for free. Nothing I can do for you if they are all sold out though (but email me anyway and I'll hook you up in some way). PLEASE NOTE! The POD option for this books is a softcover book and is NOT library bound. That being said, it is significantly less expensive to ship if you live outside the US.

BackerKit
Backerkit enables us to get you the rewards you want both faster and more reliably than we could otherwise. No reward is eligible for shipment without Backerkit checkout. You will be asked to create a Backerkit account to select your reward. This process verifies both reward selection and your correct shipping address. PLEASE complete the Backerkit process in a timely fashion so we can deliver your pledge reward! 
Digital Reward Shipping
We will email groups of eligible backers with instructions on how to access PDF pledge rewards. This is a three-step process that is completed using our web store. You will have to create a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything. The Kickstarter PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by backers (as they are paid for after the Kickstarter) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code will be sent via email to backers or will be provided through BackerKit. This process gets you your correct reward, ensures your future access to your reward files, and allows us to track project fulfillment. If you are missing something from your account, and see all over Facebook that everyone else has it, please email Mike at mike@froggodgames.com, and he will set things right for you. Be patient for a few days after it is first released though, as we do release these in batches to prevent crashing our server.
Physical Reward Shipping
When the BackerKit site for this project is ready, you will receive an email. This is a separate communication than the Kickstarter survey. In that email you will receive the link to the site where you will be asked to verify your shipping information, your pledge rewards, and checkout through their system. Your Kickstarter pledge amount does not include shipping. It is during BackerKit checkout that your shipping cost is calculated and charged.
Shipping Damage or other Related Issues
No matter what we do, the post office seems to have a desire to drop, kick, throw, or even drive over some packages with trucks (yes, it has happened). In the unlikely event that you are one of the lucky folks that have this happen to you, we will of course send you a new book. All you need to do is send photos of the damage in an email to Mike at mike@froggodgames.com. He will set you up with a new book. Please do not send multiple emails to multiple sources as it confuses the process and may cause delay. That being said, we have a 100% delivery promise on our books. You are the reason we are able to make cool products, and your satisfaction matters to us.
Refunds
If for some reason you need a refund post-Kickstarter, we are happy to oblige, less a 13% charge that we pay to Kickstarter, Backerkit, and Paypal.  
Overseas Shipping
This hardcover book likely will cost around $60 to $80 to ship to non-US customers. We continue to see cost increases and damage increases on overseas shipping. We cannot do anything about this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We actually have considered not even selling books overseas due to the complaints about postage. That being said, we have a number of long term customers that we want to be able to get our stuff. But this postage stuff is not for the faint of heart. Due to the handling of our products when we mail them tens of thousands of miles, we have noted a significant increase in damage as well. One package sent overseas can cost $50, $70, or even $100 to reship. We discussed this internally, after spending several thousand dollars in excess postage over the past year. While we take great care in packing, we still have about 2% of our shipments get damaged en-route. What we decided was that we would start double boxing overseas shipments, and also that we needed to charge insurance costs on the postal service. We will continue to honor our policy of 100% resend on damaged books — and after much deliberation, we will be adding a $15 USD insurance and handling charge on all overseas shipments. We hate to do this — but conditions have simply become untenable for us to continue to lose large amounts of money shipping books overseas. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time.

Risks and challenges
Frog God Games has been in business since 2010, and has fulfilled numerous (25!) Kickstarter projects. As with any crowdfunding program, the time-lapse between payment and delivery of a final product is subject to various risks, including the failure of a supplier, damage in shipment, disruptions within a company, and changes in the prices of materials and shipping. Experience gained over a number of projects makes us confident that we have contingency plans for the ordinary, foreseeable issues that might arise.

updates.update_content: A few minutes ago I got the prerelease copies (leather and regular edition) of the books. They have been loaded and are shipping as I write this! I already have some of the system books, and the modules are being printed! More Lost Lands goodness on the way as soon as I get them...and a bit more coming next week to a Kickstarter near you.

Books are printed and shipping to us(bear with US Customs still). 
In the meantime...
Magic items and potions, using my house rules for the Lost lands (Gods soon to come!). Get while the gettings good! Also--anyone who does not have their reward yet, please contact warehouse@froggodgames.com. We have vefrything mailed 3 weeks ago.

updates.update_userinfo: The books are on the boat, and the pre-release copies have arrived!
updates.update_content:
Books are being printed! The softcovers have shipped to me as of this morning, and the proof copies of the hardcover (this takes a month or so before they hit the barge) were Fed-X'd to me this morning from Hong Kong. I anticipate delivery of the books to the warehouse in July, then off to all of you!
COVID has us shut in pretty tightly here in WA state, but our warehouse is open and we are getting things done (despite only having me, the wife and our kids to pack). We did get a PP loan and thanks to all of you, we are keeping our artists and writers employed using funds from the loan. Most have you have seen our Indidgogo campaigns including our current one, Island of Sorrow. Without your support, we could never keep paying these folks, so its greatly appreciated. The link to the current book is here:

updates.update_userinfo: Ever wonder how I created those new magic items and spells?
updates.update_content:
No real update except that they have started printing. It's still in Hong Kong, so ETA (mostly US customs time) is uncertain. That being said, it's likely mailing to you in July or early August!

Will keep you posted!

campaign.story:
Rundown #12: Thank you all for backing Davis Chenault's Den of Iniquity on Kickstarter! It has been a fantastic run and far exceeded our expectations! Trollzah and thank you again!
Castles & Crusades: Raglesborg Den of Iniquity is the next installment in the Inzae adventure series by the co-creator of Castles & Crusades: Davis Chenault. Raglesborg Den of Iniquity is an  80+ page adventure module that plunges you into that city of thieves. With over 60 encounter areas, a hundred+ NPCs, and hundreds of adventure ideas, Raglesborg is a true treasure trove for your gaming table. 
Why Kickstarter
Three Years and Running thanks to your support! With this Kickstarter, we intend to bring to all fans of Castles and Crusades and especially those who have ravaged through the Death in the Treklant, Bergholt: By Shadow of Night, and Bergholt: Beneath the Black Moon series another installment in the line to more fully flesh out the Inzae setting. We proudly bring to you, the most dangerous city in the world, Raglesborg: Den of Iniquity.
Furthermore, all that content, needs its own box. With this Kickstarter we intend to raise funds to manufacture a box designed to contain all the Inzae material. Called Crucible of the Dragon, this box set will be large enough to hold Death in the Treklant, By Shadow of Night, Beneath the Black Moon and Raglesborg, as well as the world map and primer!
The City of Raglesborg
Located on the coast near Bergholt and south of Halpveg, Raglesborg is hidden in those deep and treacherous fjords of that untamed and brutal land, the Urstin Peninsula. Raglesborg, like the wild and treacherous lands about it, is a city like no other in the known world. 
Peopled with pirates, cutthroats, brigands, thieves, murderers and worse, this is a horrid city. Most of the wretched seafarers who pirate the turgid waters of the Interzae, the cruel bandits who roam darkened roads, and the malicious outlaws who prey on the weak eventually make their way to this city of thieves. They come to trade in ill-gotten goods, revel in sins with the plunder of their criminal labors or hide away from those who seek to impose upon them the laws and rules that bind other men together. Raglesborg is not for the faint of heart. Danger abounds! 
Mountains of gaming material, NPCs and adventure hooks.
Raglesborg is a completed manuscript. Its ready for editing and a little art. All we need to do is raise the funds to make it all happen.
About the Crucible of the Dragon Box
The Crucible of the Dragon box set is the adventure arc that begins with Death in the Treklant and ends with Den of Iniquity. The box will be a sturdy game box and large enough to contain the adventure books Death in the Treklant, Bergholt: By Shadow of Night, and Bergholt: Beneath the Black Moon, Raglesborg: Den of Iniquity, the World Map and Inzae Primer.
Though the box has not been made yet. It will follow the form and design of our previous Aufstrag and Canopy of Green boxes. Check out the video to see the quality. 
Do I need Inzae to play Raglesborg?
Not at all. Though all of Davis’ material is created and written for Inzae, it is easy enough to port to any homebrew or other setting. 
Do I need the other three books to play Raglesborg?
Not at all. Raglesborg is only loosely tied to Death in the Treklant, By Shadow of Night and Beneath the Black Moon. Use it or ignore it as you see fit.
Do I need the Castles & Crusades Rules Set to play Raglesborg?
That would probably be a good idea, however, C&C is an attribute-based RPG created in 2004. It is very similar to other RPGs on the market today, including the 5th Edition of the world’s most popular RPG.
What do I need if I want to start playing Castles & Crusades?
The cornerstone book for the GM (our CK) and the player is the Players Handbook. Scoop up the Monster book (any one of the three) and you have all you need. Check out all 100+ Castles & Crusades titles in our store here! 
What comes in the $10 Pledge level? Do I get the encounters?
The $10 pledge level comes with the Raglesborg book and any and all pledge levels that are included in that book. For instance, each of the Encounter Areas added via stretch goals are included in that level.
What about an All Digital Level?
Its already there! Pledge at the $10 level and add on the digital content from the list below to build it. For instance, if you want to add the Digital version of Death in the Treklant, choose the $10 pledge level and add $10 to that for a total of $20.
I have some of these books but not all. Where do I get them?

Risks and challenges
One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than the usual printing, so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.

DOI

Okay folks. We ran into yet another snag. Monday and Tuesday we began assembling the parts of the Dens of Iniquity Kickstarter, books and maps. However, when we began packing books into the Dragon’s Crucible box on Wednesday we ran into an immediate problem.

NOTE: This update was scheduled to go out five days ago. We wrote it and failed to send it. Now, of course its an outdated update, but turns out it was wrong anyway, as Monday was a federal holiday and we couldn't begin shipping. However, shipping has begun as of yesterday....that being Tuesday.
Greetings from the Dens!
First off thank you all for being so patient with the train wreck I turned our first shipping attempt into! But the good news is, all is on course and we will begin shipping on Monday next (I had hoped that this week would do it, but that didn't pan out).
