campaign.story:
HighFell: The Call to Adventure!!!
INTRODUCTION
HighFell, an ancient keep long abandoned and in decay, now drifts slowly across the landscape.
A millenia ago, black wizards founded the keep as a school of eldritch wizardry atop a remote mountain called the Dwimmerhorn. Only the most gifted students received instruction within its walls.
In time, HighFell was deserted and fell into ruin. Its towers, battlements, citadels, and catacombs became home to all manner of wandering monsters. Adventurers and dungeon explorers began making the dangerous trek up the mountain in search of arcane lore and magical treasures.
In recent months a strange green light was seen emanating from the ruins at midnight. The light slowly intensified until a great explosion rocked the Dwimmerhorn. HighFell pulled away from the mountain and now slowly drifts - and occasionally phases in and out of place - over the Great Steppe of The Northern Reaches.
Are you brave (or foolish) enough to explore the ruins of HighFell - The Drifting Dungeon?
WHAT IS HIGHFELL?
This Kickstarter campaign is designed to support the creation of a new megadungeon adventure called HighFell: The Drifting Dungeon.
HighFell is designed for Labyrinth Lord but can be played with any Old School Role-Playing Game (or their clones) from the 70s and 80s such as B/X, First or Second edition, OSRIC, or Swords and Wizardry. This scenario can also be played with the DCC RPG with conversions.
This new megadungeon adventure is designed to support a medieval fantasy campaign lasting months and years. HighFell will support low-level to high-level play.
I estimate the final draft to be between 180-250 pages and approximately 500-600 encounter areas. If you are familiar with Barrowmaze Complete, that project was 259 pages in a two-column format (cover to cover). Forbidden Caverns, my follow-up project, was 293 pages, PDF poster maps will be done in both black and Old School blue.
HighFell opens with a gazetteer that outlines the region in which the adventure takes place. This includes a cultural history as well as the detailing of several small villages that can provide a base of operations for an extended campaign. Like the mounds in Barrowmaze, or the caves in Forbidden Caverns, HighFell also provides some low hanging fruit above-ground to get (wise) players started. The dungeon proper will be leveled in a traditional style, albeit in a floating dungeon context with twists and surprizes. This approach merges my own particular vision with inspiration drawn from modules like The Village of Hommlet, Dragons of Desolation, and The Ghost Tower of Inverness.
Remember prices are in Canadian Dollars so there's AWESOME SAVINGS for all my peeps in the United States and abroad. If you are unfamiliar, the 2017 average conversion for the year was $1.00 USD = 71 cents CAD. (citation: bankofcanada.ca).
Here are some past layout samples from Barrowmaze Complete with the cover by ex-TSR artist Erol Otus. The cover and page samples represent the style you can expect with HighFell: The Drifting Dungeon
Cover and Layout Samples
WHO AM I?
My name is Dr. Greg Gillespie. I am an Associate Professor of Popular Culture at a university in Ontario, Canada. I regularly teach a senior undergraduate course entitled The History and Culture of Role-Playing Games (for realz). I am also the author/designer of two very popular Old School megadungeons called Barrowmaze Complete and The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia. You can read widely about Barrowmaze on the internet or on rpgnow.com. Through my professional expertise, I know how to create, manage, and deliver outstanding game projects on time.
ART AND THE OLD SCHOOL
In my opinion, crafting an OSR dungeon is about much more than creating an adventure. It is about celebrating the origins of the hobby, the classic fantasy gaming experience, and understanding that dungeon crawling isn't supposed to be about long exhausting combats but rather an equal mix of exploration, combat, and role-play. These values are very important to me and find expression in my design and aesthetics. Just like Barrowmaze and Forbidden Caverns, HighFell will place a premium on amazing art. I will get the band back together including the talents of Cory Hamel, Stefan Poag, Peter Pagano, Trevor Hammond, Stephen Thompson, and others.
Similar to past projects for Labyringth Lord Rules, every monster in the monster section will have its own illustration. In the past I have worked with former TSR artists Erol Otus, Jim Holloway, and Tim Truman. I hope to work with these and other TSR illustrators again on this project for a colour cover and also interior art. Erol has already agreed to illustrate the cover for HighFell. We will ensure the colors and aesthetic chosen compliment Barrrowmaze and The Forbidden Caverns of Archaia (so they will all look super swank on your shelf).
In terms of mapping, those of you will a close eye will notice my published dungeons are slowly filling in a certain old school wilderness board game map that serves as the basis of my Northern Reaches homegame (we affectionately call it...Greghawk lol). HighFell will continue this tradition as a tip of the cap to Gygax's original homegame.
Cory Hamel and Peter Pagano have created some fantastic preliminary illustrations to give you an idea of the aesthetic we have in mind for a few of the monsters. There's more to come!
THROW-INs and ADD-ONS
Like my other projects HighFell will be detailed, provide depth of engagement, have old school charm, and be super fun for your gaming group. There is no list of stuff to add persay, rather the more funding the campaign receives the more I can invest into and develop the final product. I have an excellent reputation across the interwebs for value-added projects. If you are familiar with Barrowmaze Complete or Forbidden Caverns of Archaia, you already know what to expect.

campaign.story:
The Sommerlund City Maps is a dream project developed by the Italian cartographer Francesco Mattioli in close collaboration with Lone Wolf’s creator Joe Dever, Vincent Lazzari and the Scriptarium and Åskfågeln. Even though we had Joe Dever’s detailed descriptions from his books, his elaborate sketches and detailed input, it took a lot of time to get them finalized. Much thanks to the attention to detail by Francesco Mattioli and his beautiful penmanship. The style, the architecture, the flavor of each city is unique and carried through in his beautiful hand drawn maps, inspired by an old medieval map of Bologna.
We decided early on to make the maps justice by printing them in poster size. Holmgard is the most detailed map, and thus the largest of the ten. Some, like The Kai Monastery is considerably smaller. However, they all came with the same challenge. How do you keep them as gorgeous as they deserve when packed? Our solution was the specially made map tube. That allows us to roll up the maps instead of folding them, which makes them all so much more beautiful and easy to hang on a wall.
The Sommerlund City Maps contains the following 10 maps in full color – and with the most gorgeous illustrations on their back:
Holmgard
Toran
Tyso
Anskaven
Moytura
Ruanon
Silvershore
Sommerlund with Detailed Information
The Kai Monastery
The Sommer Isles
Holmgard (90 x 66 cm)
Holmgard was one of the first major settlements established in Sommerlund and became its capital during the reign of King Braern I (MS 3445-3472). In ancient Sommlending, the word Holmgard means ‘Strong of Heart and Mind’. Holmgard was built with the blood, sweat, and tears of its people as countless battles were fought to secure the lands against marauding bandits from the Wildlands and incursions by raiders from the Darklands. King Braern I chose a perfect location for the Sommlending capital. It had a natural protective harbour, fertile arable farmland, a temperate climate and a reliable source of fresh water. In MS 5000, Holmgard is the seat of power for the King of Sommerlund, King Myranar III. There are two river gates and five grand gates in the encircling city wall. The gates permit easy road access into the capital from all four compass points, but they can be locked down and made totally secure during times of war. The two rivers that enter the city are wide enough to be navigated with ease.
Anskaven (70 x 50 cm)
The City of Anskaven prides itself on being the oldest settlement in Sommerlund. In MS 3434, it was here that the Sommlending made landfall after their Great Voyage across the Northern Void from their ancient homeland islands of Tay Solobo. In MS 5000, Anskaven has the most expansive docks and quayside facilities of any Sommlending city, boasting three dry docks and several shipbuilding and refitting yards. It is home to the Northern Fleet, has a large fishing fleet and processes the cargoes of merchant ships.
Toran (70 x 50 cm)
The City of Toran is undeniably beautiful, a marvel of Sommlending architecture and design, a perfect combination of elegance and strength. The foundations of its curtain wall were laid in MS 3448 and completed in MS 3455. It is located on the northern coast of Sommerlund, on the east side of the Toran Sound, at the point where the River Tor flows out into the Kaltesee. It is dominated by a vertigo-inducing tower that serves as the seat of power for the Guildmaster of the Brotherhood of the Crystal Star.
Tyso (70 x 50 cm)
Tyso is a flourishing city port situated on the eastern seaboard of Sommerlund, north-east of Holmgard and south-west of Anskaven. Two major overland routes connect it to these cities, and road traffic of all kinds passes regularly along them. Tyso has a thriving fishing industry and benefits greatly from the production of grain and arable food crops in the fertile plains due west, north and south of its coastal location. Tyso has long been a vital base of operations to protect the Holmgulf from attack by sea.
Moytura (50 x 35 cm)
The principal town of the Southland Marches, of significant strategic and economic value to the Crown. The strong stone wall was constructed following the Drakkarim occupation and the Battle of the Pass of Moytura in MS 3799. Moytura is situated on the East Border Turnpike and benefits from the natural protection afforded it by the Wildlands Range to the east, and the Southlund Hills to the north and west. It is within sight of the permanent encampment of the Army of the South.
Ruanon (50 x 35 cm)
The principal town and trading centre of the Baronial Province of Ruanon. Originally, it was sited close to the Baron’s Castle. In MS 4552, following the discovery of gold in the Maaken Mines, a mass exodus occurred. Nearly all of the inhabitants of the old town moved east and settled near to the mines. An underground river was discovered and a new town sprang up and rapidly expanded, fuelled by the migration of prospectors and entrepreneurs looking to make their fortune in the mines.
Silvershore (35 x 50 cm)
The first Sommlending settlement on the Kirlunidin Isles. The early settlers subsisted on fishing, sheep-farming and agriculture. The discovery of mineral resources prompted fierce rivalry and led to outbreaks of violence, until a lasting peace was achieved in MS 3470. Silvershore grew steadily over the following centuries. A small fleet was created, made up entirely of caravels. The protective wall has proved its worth, assisting the townsfolk to defend their home from pirate raiders and attempts at conquest by the Vassagonian Empire.
Sommerlund (50 x 70 cm)
This is more than just a map over Sommerlund. It also contains a multitude of detailed information about the nation. In the frame, you will find mini maps containing historical maps of Sommerlund down the ages, information on the Kai Protectorate, flags and emblems showing the political hierarchy of the Kirlundin Isles, Southlund Marches, Barony of Ruanon, The Baronial Confederation of Toran, Barony of Anskaven, County of Tyso and finally a Political Map of Magnamund.
Kai Monastery (50 x 70 cm)
A detailed map over the Kai Monastery, where all young Kai selected get a chance to enhance their gifts and train under the supervision of their teachers. This is the very first location you get to know during Flight from the Dark, and it is the home of the Kai when you play the multi player game of Lone Wolf.
Sommer Isles (50 x 35 cm)
A map of Tay Solobo, the ancient homeland of the Sommlending that undertook the Great Voyage across the Northern Void. Here you will get a chance to see all of the isles the sommlending stem from, and even get some translations of their language.
Åskfågeln is the Swedish publisher of Lone Wolf (Ensamma Vargen in Swedish), so we will not only make this gorgeous map collection available in English. It will be printed in Swedish as well, for all who so wishes. The translations can take a few extra weeks, but we have the best team possible on the project. Choose the Reward Level of the language you want.
Alla ni som älskar Ensamma Vargen och hellre vill ha era kartor på svenska istället kan självfallet få det. Vi kommer att göra vårt bästa för att få ut de översatta kartorna så fort som möjligt, men det finns en risk att det tar några veckor extra för Francesco att lägga in alla översättningar i sina kartor. Olle Sahlin, redaktören för Ensamma Vargens soloäventyr då de först kom ut på svenska på 80-talet och den som idag översätter allt rollspelsmaterial vi tar fram till Ensamma Vargen till svenska, står för dessa översättningar.
When you select a Reward, choose it in the language you want your maps in! We only got four different Reward Levels to choose from. Here you can see what is included in each of them.
When your Reward includes one or maps in print, you will get the same maps in PDF as well. If you only select the map of Holmgard, you will get Holmgard in PDF. If you select The Sommerlund Cities, you will get those seven maps in PDF. Finally, if you select the Complete Collection, you will get every map included in PDF as well.
Thank you so much for backing this Kickstarter Campaign. Francesco Mattioli’s maps are gorgeous artwork, made by a skilled cartographer paying attention to details. The extra value stems from Joe Dever’s dedication to Lone Wolf and the world of Magnamund, where all fans of Joe Dever’s epic Lone Wolf saga will recognize the iconic places we present here. We were fortunate to work with Joe on this map project, and the result is in our mind stunning.
You get out gratitude for being part of making this beautiful map project take the last step from a wild dream to full color poster size maps in print.
We will send you the largest map of this entire campaign. Holmgard is the capital of Sommerlund, and the biggest and most detailed map of them all. It is also well known to all who played the very first book in the epic saga of Lone Wolf.
This collection consists of the 7 city maps included in this project, delivered in a special map tube printed for this product. All of the cities have their own style and flare, and the architecture will vary some between them, due to everything from local resources to tactical position, fires, etc. The maps are all printed on separate posters, but the sizes vary. Holmgard is 90 x 66 cm, Toran, Tyso and Askaven are all 70 x 50 cm, while Moytura, Ruanon and Silvershore are 50 x 35 cm.
This Kickstarter special Reward Level includes all of the ten maps, delivered in a special map tube printed for this product. Holmgard is 90 x 66 cm, while 5 of the other maps are 70 x 50 and the last 4 are 50 x 35 cm. All of these maps are delivered in a map tube specially made for this project, printed with a unique cover made for The Sommerlund City Maps Collection.
The better this campaign goes, the more good stuff we want to send your way. Since this is primarily a campaign to show some of the beautiful art developed for Lone Wolf and Magnamund, the Stretch Goals will come in 3 major types:
1. Additional maps from Francesco Mattioli – these are typically smaller maps – A4, previously made for the Swedish Lone Wolf Roleplaying game. Will be sent to you with the maps
2. Artwork by Lukas Thelin – typically printed in A4, still in the same movie poster quality as the maps of Sommerlund Cities. Will be sent to you with the maps.
3. Commitment to develop new maps for the future. These will not be included in your reward, but you will have something to look forward to.
After receiving some questions on how to go ahead and order more copies of the maps, we have decided to go ahead and make the following add ons available. If you have any other particular thing you would like to see, feel free to contact us and we will see what we can do.
Add the total amount for extra maps to your Pledge. After the campaign you will be able to tell us exactly what you want (which maps and language) in survey we send out to you.
Holmgard Map – 150 SEK
Sommerlund Map – 125 SEK
Kai Monastery – 125 SEK
Sommerlund Cities (7 maps + the special map tube) – 500 SEK
Complete Collection (10 maps + the special map tube) – 750 SEK
If you decide to up your pledge from the Holmgard map to more, please increase your pledge amount with 50 SEK for the additional shipping cost. If you have only chosen SUPPORTER previously, please add 150 SEK for shipping.
All Rewards include free shipping anywhere in the world.
Åskfågeln
Åskfågeln is Swedish for “Thunderbird.” Åskfågeln is a family run company, owned and run by Tove and Anders Gillbring. We have been active in Swedish roleplaying games since the dawn of time, and involved in a multitude of successful games and magazines over the years, mostly in Swedish. 2018 is the year Åskfågeln has marked for Creative Fireworks – the year to launch all of those great gaming titles that have been brewing for a long while. The Sommerlund City Maps are one part of the Creative Fireworks.
Francesco Mattioli
Francesco Mattioli is a cartographer and illustration artist best known for his work on Lone Wolf and various board games over the years. He is also the lead cartographer for Åskfågeln’s product line Freeway Warrior – the four choose your own adventure books by Joe Dever, as well as an upcoming roleplaying game in that post apocalypse setting.
Joe Dever
The acclaimed author and game designer Joe Dever had a lot of gaming titles under his belt, but he is best known for the epic saga of Lone Wolf in choose your own adventure kind of play. The Sommerlund City Maps are all from that wondrous setting Joe Dever created, based on his texts, ideas, sketches and not least detailed discussions as Francesco made the map drawings. Joe Dever will not be around to see these maps in print, but we know for certain that he loved the result and was looking forward to them. Now both Joe Dever and his creations belong to the ages.
Vincent Lazzari
When we at Åskfågeln started our collaboration with Joe Dever back in 2013, he described Vincent as a real life Indiana Jones. That is a both cool and apt description for a man that has the responsibility to uphold the integrity of all things Lone Wolf. Every detail is fact checked, in order to be consistent with all descriptions from official Lone Wolf material from all platforms. We are fortunate to have Vincent aboard as part of our Lone Wolf team.
Olle Sahlin
Olle is one of the true icons of the Swedish Gaming Scene. He worked as an editor at Äventyrsspel, the company that made roleplaying games as hit in Sweden as Dungeons & Dragons made them in the rest of the world. Before Olle took on the full time gig of editing all of their prestigious titles, Lone Wolf included, he was tagged for the translation of the choose your own adventure books for Lone Wolf that Joe Dever conquered the world with back then. Now Olle has gone full circle, translating Lone Wolf for Åskfågeln. But rest assured, almost any high profile Swedish gaming project is bound to have Olle somewhere in the credits. He is one of Sweden’s best and most beloved translators, LARP photographers and so much more.
Lukas Thelin
Even though The Sommerlund City Maps at its core is all about the maps Francesco Mattioli creates for Lone Wolf, we would be amiss not to mention Lukas Thelin. Lukas is an integral part of Åskfågeln and has been our in house lead illustration artist for many years now. He has made so many stunning illustrations for Lone Wolf over the years that we might just include a few of them as stretch goals or add ons during this campaign.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As with any project the risks are primarily time related. The good news is that the maps are already drawn and the English editions are ready for print, and we have a good idea of how long it will take, from the printer to your home. The Swedish editions will take a few weeks longer, since they require attention to detail when Francesco makes the changes in the text layers. 

We are aware that add ons and stretch goals are possible time sinks, so we will make sure not to add anything that will require a lot of additional extra work at this stage. Since we do not want to slow the delivery down in any way, you will instead be facing possible add ons in the form of additional maps or artwork, already made and thus just as ready for print. Or, if this campaign goes really well, our commitment to stay focused on producing more gorgeous city maps for other parts of Magnamund in the future. If we do, those stretch goals will not affect what you receive for backing us this time around, but it will give you something to look forward to!

This project is basically printer ready. We are so close to print that we are even prepared to jump the gun if we are off to a flying start. It would be spectacular to give all who come to the GothCon gaming convention in Gothenburg, Sweden, the chance to get their maps signed by Francesco Mattioli. He is our Guest of Honor at the convention.

updates.update_userinfo: EU-backers are finally getting their maps
updates.update_content:
Now they have finally sent out the maps to European backers from the German hub. We are so sorry for all of the delays, but finally they are coming your way. Please let us know when you are receiving your maps and let us know what you think of them!
For Sommerlund and the Kai!
Anders & Tove

Ledsen att ni som väntar på svenska kartor inte har fått era ännu. Vi tappade bort oss lite bland allt annat strul som varit. En anledning är att vi upptäckte några problem i översättningen, där kartramarna var helt korrekta men där gatunamn och annat som skrivits ut på kartan fortfarande var på engelska. Samtidigt var översättaren Olle Sahlin dålig innan han gick bort i början av året. Nu behöver vi gå igenom kartorna ordentligt och även få Francescos hjälp att uppdatera de svenska kartorna. Det är tyvärr inte klart ännu, men vi kommer att fixa det.
Ursäkta att vi är försenade. Vi vet att vi ligger efter och beklagar det. Vi har inte glömt bort er, detta är en av de saker vi ska ta tag i med förnyad kraft nu.

updates.update_userinfo: Finally some good news for Lone Wolf fans in the European Union
updates.update_content:
We have just heard from GamesQuest and the maps for EU residents have finally left the German Customs and arrived in their German hub after two month with Covid amd Brexit. We have tried to stress how long we all have been waiting, and the good news is that it seems like it finally will be shipped out next week.
We are sorry you have had to wait this long. But it will be worth it! The maps are gorgeous and we are finally going to be able to close the book on this.

updates.update_userinfo: EU will have to wait a while longer yet
updates.update_content: We are very sorry that there are still delays in the EU-shipments of maps. The main problem is Brexit, which caused a delay in all shipments from Britain to Germany. The maps and tubes have been sent long ago, and will be individually shipped from Germany. We are sorry this affected you, but we are unable to speed things up. This is caught in a worldwide chaos stemming from the combination of Brexit and covid both causing delays. As soon as we hear any news we will share them with you. And if any of you within the EU should get your tube, let us know. Then, at least we know that the rest of you will follow.

updates.update_userinfo: Sommerlund City Maps – finally finding their way to our backers!
updates.update_content:
We are so happy to hear that the maps are finally starting to find their ways out to you all. After all the setbacks, we did not dare to say anything more until we got information on the maps actually were shipped. And now, finally, they are heading your way!
Some of you have been longing for information a lot sooner, but honestly, it was just not feasible. We have had the information at least a dozen times that now they are finally set for shipment. All should be solved. And the next day we got another question, new administrative things needing to be resolved before the shipment would take place. Thus, at the end we just thought it better to wait and see that it really was working. Even though we even paid everything in advance to get it done.

updates.update_userinfo: Sommerlund City Maps ready to ship

updates.update_content:
Now all backers who have ordered maps in English should have received a personal message over Kickstarter where we have listed your shipping address. Please, look at this as soon as you can, in order not to miss out on the first shipping batch. Finally they will be coming your way!
As stated previously, the Swedish maps are not yet quite ready, but we will get back to them soon as well. As for now, all English maps are just waiting to ship and we long to hear your comments when you get them!

updates.update_userinfo: A bureaucratic nightmare nearing the end
updates.update_content: When you did not think anything more could go wrong, we got caught in a hassle with Kickstarter blocking your shipping information from us for several weeks. In order to unlock the information we had to thoroughly prove who we are and company details. Sending passport, ID, Papers from Swedish Goverment authorities about our company etc. Whenever we thought we had managed to give them all they asked for, a new request had to be met … At the same time we had everything ready and waiting at our English distributor; maps, tubes and bonus kits. Alas, we hope they will be able to get it all out quickly even though we took up some valuable time for them while waiting for clearance. We have now solved that issue, but would appreciate if you let us know if you have moved recently … It would be very unfortunate to send your parcel to the wrong place.

Finally the distributor in England has all the maps and the map tubes. They have also started to set up operations to pack and fulfill the orders. We are finally getting there and if we are lucky, things will move on a bit quicker from here. We are not first in line, but we are getting there!
For Sommerlund & the Kai!
Tove & Anders

Note:  The Live feed replay below is for the test video we did.  For some reason it is not the hour long one.  You can view that HERE.
Rundown #14: THANK YOU ALL for your support! Each of you has made this a far better project than we ever hoped and shown once again that Castles & Crusades is the go to RPG! This turned into a fantastic success! Now to get to work! Lots of hard, wonderful work. Thank you again!
BONUS: This past Saturday we did some warehouse/mailroom cleaning and we have a few hundred Classic Monsters left. Everyone who pledges $75 or more, receives one in your package!
Castles & Crusades has enjoyed 14 years of continuous publication. In that time, you’ve seen a mountain of books, adventures and supplements roll across your table. Of them all, two stand out as essential (four if you are a die- hard fan): The Players Handbook and Monsters & Treasure. We recently reprinted the Players Handbook (seventh printing) and now, Monsters & Treasure is up for its fifth printing.
This time we would like to do something a little different, but to do that, we are going to need your help.
In our 14 years together, Castles & Crusades has created a mountain of monsters, and a smaller mountain of treasure: the majority of which lie in published works outside Monsters & Treasure. This makes playing the game a little more challenging, and sometimes, just a little aggravating. CKs (GMs) have to struggle with a veritable mountain of books to track down and find the monster they seek. Some have entered the digital age, using these books on a tablet, or phone or on the TLG Portal and are able to access them a little quicker, but for many the hunt has become time consuming and distracting. Too many RPG books makes for difficult play.
Time to Tighten Up the Game!
Our goal is to tighten things up just a little and make one massive reference book for you to use at your table. To do that, we need to round up all the monsters from the extensive C&C library and bring them into one book. This is what we have in mind: Monsters & Treasure, Classic Monsters, Mystical Companions, published adventures like Shadows of a Halfling Hall (looking at you, Bag-o-Bones!), Amazing Adventures Manual of Monsters, Codex Celtarum, Codex Germania, Codex Nordica, Codex Classicum, Codex Slavorum, Haunted Highlands and all the other manifold publications where monsters creep and crawl, fly and charge from the pages and put them into one monstrous Full Color book.
 But Wait? Aren’t you Missing Some books?
What about the Monsters & Treasure of Aihrde? This book will remain its own publication. Though the monsters in it are designed for everyday use, it is tied to the massive Aihrde world setting (Codex of Aihrde and the Players Guide to Aihrde). These need to remain in a book with ease of access for those who brave to adventure in the Lands of Ursal.
What about Tome of the Unclean? This book will also remain its own stand-alone product. We prefer to keep the filth of hell and unhinged chaos of the Abyss in their own realm, to be pulled out when your table slides into the madness of those insane worlds.
So why do we need your help? Aren’t you going to reprint the Monsters & Treasure anyway?
Yes. There will be a fifth printing, no matter what. However, we don’t want to simply reprint the book. We want to make it better.
This is where you come in. This is going to be a massive task. Right now, Monsters & Treasure is a color book, and needs to remain one. However, all those monsters that we want to include in it are black and white, we need them to be given the full color treatment. This means lots of work for several artists. Monsters that are duplicates or near duplicates will have to be reconciled. This is a lot of work for content editors. Everything will need to be laid out again. This is lots of work for graphics guys! And we want to include more art, some of these pictures need replaced, others need art!
All this added content will increase the Monsters & Treasure, 5th printing to a whopping 350 pages, at least.
Its going to be a herculean task. And to bring it to pass, we are going to need your help!
To that end we are calling for a muster of Knights, Gamers, Enthusiasts, Grognards, Trolls and all the great hosts from all across the community to join us, pledge and help us make your game even better!
What Rewards Your Pledge Reaps!
Pledge $19 and Receive
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing, 350 pages (est.), Full Color. Digital
Pledge $45 and Receive
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing, 350 pages (est.), Full Color. Print and Digital
Pledge $75 and Receive
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing, 350 pages (est.), Full Color. Print and Digital
Official Castles & Crusades Binder with all the monsters included!
Pledge $125 and Receive
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing, 350 pages (est.), Full Color. Print and Digital
Players Handbook, 7th Printing, 196 pages, Full Color. Print and Digital
Castle Keepers Guide, 2nd Printing, 356 pages, Full Color. Print and Digital
A Lion in the Ropes, Low Level Adventure
Pledge $200 and Receive
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing, 350 pages (est.), Full Color. Print and Digital Dual Color
Leather Special Collector’s Edition with your name blazed on the front. Signed and numbered.
Official Castles & Crusades Binder with Monsters included. Two monsters per sheet.
Original M&T Poster! Signed by the Troll Lords!
 A Note on the Binder
Remember AD&D 2nd Edition? Remember your binder full of monsters? Those were the good old days. Well, not entirely, as you’re still in the good old days! Brought to you by Castles & Crusades, the first RPG that worked to capture the essence of play that Mr. Gygax and crew managed to do back in the 1980s! Well, we are following in his footsteps again with the C&C Monsters & Treasure Compendium/Binder. This 3” binder will reflect the same quality that all TLG products do, and be manufactured of stout board, with 2” slant d mounts that will hold up to 480 sheets of paper! Its going to be a keeper!
 A Note on the Special Collector's Books
These are highly crafted books, with dual embossed foil stamps, raised hubs on the spine, page marker, "onion" type page insert, with your names stamped on the front cover. Some of you may have picked up the Players Handbook in the PH7 Kickstarter, for a little less than we are asking here, but as you know from that Kickstarter we ended up upgrading from a different style of book.
You can see more about what this book will look like here in this video. You can purchase them here (there are only a few left).
  We know diving in and supporting the 5th printing of any book…even one that is going to be double its normal size…is a tough decision and a heavy commitment. So, we want to make this worth your while. If you pledge now, and help us spread the word, as soon as we exceed out target goal, we’ll include the following items!
$10,000: Monsters & Treasure: Achieved! We are going to roll out the new, expanded Monsters & Treasure.
$14,000: Appendix A Encounter by Terrain: Achieved! We will include an appendix of Encounter Charts by terrain. This will make encounters far easier. Available to all levels.
$18,000: Appendix A Encounter Chart Expanded: Achieved! We will detail the encounter chart, staggering it by level/HD. Available to all levels.
$20,000: Secret Chamber: Achieved! Steve Chenault will continue the adventures of Eurich Gunshoff in a second series of short stories. Join Eurich and Ave as they wander north into the Shelves of the Mist. This is a direct follow up to A Houseless God & Other Tales, just published and available here as an add on or, through our Store. A digital copy for $45.00 backer level, print and digital for $75+ backer levels.
 $500: Encounter Challenge: 17 Encounters Achieved! For every $500 we raise from this point going forward (starting at $20,000), we will take one monster from the Monsters & Treasure and design and write an encounter for it. We'll compile these into a PDF and release a digital version to everyone at the $19 level and above. If there are enough of them, we'll print it and ship it with your book for those who pledge $45 and above! Each encounter will be 1-2 pages long, include lead-up to, events surrounding, the monster and its peculiar habits, treasure and experience point value.
Bonus Book: Achieved! This past weekend we cleaned out the warehouse and mail room (way overdue) and have found that we have a few hundred Classic Monsters book left. As this book is being absorbed by Monsters & Treasure, we will discontinue it. So everyone who pledges $75 and above receives a free copy of Classic Monsters. It is hardback, black and white and will be on a first come, first serve basis, while supplies last. IF you have already pledges at 75 and above, you are already getting one!
$22,000: Monster List Supplement: Achieved! Remember the DMG Monster List and the Monster list that appears in Classic Monsters? We'll bundle all this up into one nice little softcover book for you and send it your way! Digial copies for pledge level $45. Print and digital copies for pledge levels $75 and above.
$25,000: The Siege Engine Book of Character Classes: Achieved! We are going to compile all the classes from the many books into one 40 page soft cover tome. Digital copies for pledge level $45. Print and digital copies for pledge levels $75 and above.
$28,000: Encounter Book in Print: Achieved! We will bundle all these together in a book! Digital copies of the encounters from above will go to backers $19 and $45.00, however, those who pledge $75 and above receive a printed copy of book!
$30,000: Eurich Gunshoff: Steve Chenault, creator of the world of Aihrde and content writer for much of C&C, will expand on the 20k reward, adding 4 MORE short stories to the anthology. Follow the adventures of Eurich Gunshoff into the Gottland and Beyond. (see 20k reward level for more detail). A digital copy for $45.00 backer level, print and digital for $75+ backer levels.
Early Backers: Through backer 192, who pledge $45 and above receive the flash drive, bottle opener and coin!
You can add extra copies of the books or content by simply increasing the amount of your pledge by the amount listed below!
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing Print...$45
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing Digital...$19
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing Binder...$45
M&T 5th Printing Binder Inserts Digital...$30.00
Monsters & Treasure, 5th Printing Leather...$140
Flash Drive with the CKG, PH, and MT...$50
New to Castles & Crusades?
Many of you are coming from other systems or are entirely new to the game. If you are, the quick down and dirty is this: Castles & Crusades is an easy to learn, fast paced, table top role playing game that allows you to play one of 13 classes and any one of these races; dwarf, human, elf, halfling, half elf or half orc. It's stream-lined attribute check system (the SIEGE Engine) is the driving mechanic that allows your character to try almost anything they want to try with a simple role of a d20! It's fun for all ages, requires almost no set up and playable by anyone, almost anywhere (we wouldn’t recommend playing on a surf board for instance).
If you want to know more follow this link: Castles & Crusades!
You can also join the Society and the Knights of the Crusade by following this link: SOCIETY.
You can also download the quick start rules that we released at ReaperCon last year. Just click the picture!
 *What are the die-hard books? Players Handbook, Monsters & Treasure, Castle Keepers Guide and the Codex of Aihrde!
  Track our progress through the Monsters!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Large books such as this one are hard to print and bind and we have to choose our printers with care.

One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than the usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Greetings from the Dens,

Greetings from the Dens,
We have a tentative ship date from the printer for Monsters & Treasure. It's a little further out that I had hoped, but yearbook season overwhelmed us and we got sucked in its wake! But they should be loading these books on the trucks and sending them to us here on June 7th. 
Don't forget to check us our on Twitch for weekly video updates and follow me on twitter!

Greetings from the Dens,
A quick update.
As Monsters & Treasure rumbles its way through printing, we've begun bringing together everything on the the rest of the Kickstarter.
Tim began the process of manufacturing the binders. We hope to see these arrive about the same the actual book does.

campaign.story:
Welcome to our Kickstarter!
Please watch our video (if you haven't done it yet) and read over our campaign page below, you'll find every information about these modular tabletop RPG Map-Tile sets. If you still have any question please feel free to write a comment or check out the FAQ section, perhaps someone has already had the same questions. Thank you!
Pledges via PayPal: $1925
Fortress in the Mountains - free extra tiles
For new backers, we already unlocked the next core extras, these will expand the three main sets and everyone will get them for free in both digital and printed formats:
+ 3 Market tiles (City set) 
+ 2 Castle tile: Smaller Chapel, Torture chamber
+ 3 Fortress tiles: Ruined straight wall, destroyed tower and siege machines
+ 8 Fortress in the Mountains tiles (Fortress set)
+ 3D printable working doors
+ 8 City tiles: 2 burning buildings, a ruined building, gallows, cellar, guild hall, and 2 magic shop tiles
Isometric visual aid to the Fortress, Castle and City sets
+9 Arena tiles: Give the people what they want! 9 tiles of pure joy, fight, blood and death. These tiles are also modular; you can make a smaller arena from 4 tiles which can be even a podium for your theatre or a bigger place as well as huge 9-tile arenas with stands. It is free both in digital and printed formats, and will expand the City core set.
Unlocked add-on sets:
+30 Moat tiles - free for digital backers! +$18 to get it as physical card-tiles. Read more about these add-ons at the end of the campaign.
+60 Docks and Canals tiles - free for digital backers! +$25 to get it as physical card-tiles.
+60 Village tiles - free for digital backers! +$25 to get it as physical card-tiles.
+60 Graveyard and Temple tiles - free for digital backers! +$25 to get it as physical card-tiles.

Please add $93 to your selected printed or digital+printed pledge if you need all the four unlocked add-on sets (Moat, Docks&Canals, Village, Temple&Graveyard) as printed card-tiles.

Read more about add-ons at the end of this description.
City Tiles
Cities, castles and fortresses are some of the main areas an adventurer is sure to encounter during an adventure. Now with your help, we can bring these modular tiles into life, and you will be able to build any areas by using them in no time!
These sets include many double-sided, amazingly detailed 6x6 inch sized tiles in both physical and digital formats, and will provide you a more thrilling gaming experience while you are sitting around a table or having fun online with your friend. 
Three levels of the same area (basement, first floor, roofs) - "fog of war" on your tabletop!
Blacksmith tile - closer view - City tiles
Inside the tower - the Fortress Set
Throne Room - Castle Set
  ~ City Tiles ~
Where will a tried adventurer rest and find new quests? 
Of course, a fantasy or medieval city is not only about its tavern, it is a living community with diverse buildings and people. Living houses, shops, the blacksmith, bakery, taverns, inns, the main square and the poor neighborhood with dark and dirty alleys are all parts of a bustling and noisy city, and these richly illustrated tiles will help your gamers to feel like they are involved in an incredible adventure. You can use these tiles to quickly shape your entire city or only a part of it, you don’t have to care how these tiles, the buildings, and streets will fit together because as a result of our unique design you can place the streets and houses at the same time. This set contains 60 double-sided tiles.
~ Fortress Tiles ~ 
50 double-sided tiles not only with ramparts but with inner courtyards, towers and gates, too!
~ Castle Tiles~
A beautiful castle with throne rooms, kitchen, library, armory, cantinas, treasure room, office, winter garden, guest rooms and more! This set will contain 40 unique tiles with rooms, chambers, and corridors that you can mix with the Fortress tiles! 
You'll find our previous map-tile sets HERE, and the awesome Pirate and Ghost Ship will be HERE.
  Social Stretch Goal! - UNLOCKED
(100 FB shares on a post)
+ 2 flaming building tiles to the City core set!
We can unlock the next goals as our adventuring party grows.

The Core set extras will expand the three main sets and everyone will get them for free, even in printed formats!

But some of the stretch goals will be additional stand-alone sets to add new areas to your existing core sets. Their digital version will be free for everyone who selects DIGITAL or mixed (DIGITAL+PRINTED) rewards, and you have to add the special KS price of these sets to your pledge if you want them in print too (as an add-on). 
You've unlocked every goal! Thank you! 
Art render sample:
(Art renders will be illustrations and isometric renders of the areas that you can use as visual aids.)
 Test render of the moat:
  Play a more atmospheric game 
The areas are on 6 inch by 6 inch sized, double-sided tiles with seamless borders that make it possible to mix them with each other. Furthermore, the cut-out doors, wall and corner pieces (where these are available) will provide you more modularity and freedom. If you are the type who likes the wonderful and breathtaking visual worlds of movies and games, then you can relive them on your gaming nights sitting around a table in your home (or online) with your friends.
Features of the digital tiles:
- Easy to print PDF files, print out as many tiles as you need for your game! You’ll get them in 300 dpi, high-quality format! 
- Small printer-friendly draft tiles to help you plan your areas
- jpg files that you can use in online Virtual Tabletop programs 
Features of the printed tiles:
- double sided and UV coated durable tiles with the night version on their other sides where it is suitable. If that has no sense (because it is an underground or inside area), the other side of the tile will contain the empty un-furnished version 
Printed card-tiles

- You can draw on them with wet-erase markers!
- connect them easily with transparent tape or use tablecloth to prevent tiles from sliding 
 - The smaller cut-out elements like doors and gates will not be pre-cut to keep our prices low but you can easily cut these few items around with a sharp scissor.
cut-out objects of our previous Sewer map-tiles
Order both versions and you will get the cheapest shipping fee in our history, and as an extra, you will never run out of tiles because you can print out as many as you need!
Detailed, lovingly crafted graphics which will make your gaming nights more thrilling!
The design of the tiles is the result of our eight years’ experience we spent in the mobile game and tabletop game business. We hope that the 3D rendered graphic we use will represent a higher standard in tabletop gaming and provide a more thrilling gaming experience for our customers at a more affordable price. 
City Tiles - detail
City Tiles - detail
Variate, re-usable and modular tiles to help you create diverse castles and cities quickly and easily and to save you time and money. Spend more time with the adventure and NPCs instead of seeking new maps to the different adventures. These tiles will always be handy. 
"Fog of war" on your tabletop!
Without any accessories, blanket, paper sheets or anything you've used before to hide undiscovered areas of your map.
You only have to place those areas that are visible for your players! All the city tiles have a roof tile to hide the inner areas, so you can reveal the secrets of your map as the story goes, just like a “fog of war” system.
You can place only the roof then reveal the other tiles when your gamers go inside the houses.
 You’ll find the night or alternative version on the other side of the tiles!  
What happens when the night falls? What kind of creatures and adventures are waiting for you and your team in the darkness of a seemingly sleeping city? You can find out because most of the tiles have an alternative and unique night version! 
Alternative version on the other side

Unlocked Add-on Sets
Please add $93 to your selected PRINTED or DIGITAL+PRINTED pledge if you need all the four unlocked add-on sets (Moat, Docks&Canals, Village, Temple&Graveyard) as printed card-tiles.

Digital: FREE
Physical: add +$18 to your PRINTED or mixed (DIGITAL+PRINTED) pledge.
+60 Docks and Canals tiles:
It contains dock areas, huge and wide bridges with buildings, loading areas, ships, canals, canals with bridges, cut out boats and items like barrels, etc., and a lighthouse. Do you have any other idea? Write us a comment!
Digital: FREE
Physical: add +$25 to your PRINTED or mixed (DIGITAL+PRINTED) pledge.
+60 Village tiles:
It contains dirty roads, squares, and smaller cottages, gardens, fields, and thatched roof homes. They produce what you'll eat in the city.
Digital: FREE
Physical: add +$25 to your PRINTED or mixed (DIGITAL+PRINTED) pledge.
+60 Modular Graveyard and Temple tiles:  
Will your adventure lead your team to cold tombs and crypts or a smaller chapel, a bigger temple or a whole cathedral? This is the set you need then!
Digital: FREE
Physical: add +$25 to your PRINTED or mixed (DIGITAL+PRINTED) pledge.

Additional shipping fee will be calculated after the campaign in pledge manager, it will be around +$3 (US) +$5(Canada) and +$7(Other) per selected add-on. Please DO NOT add this additional shipping fee to your pledge now, we will count the correct fee after the campaign based on your location. 

More info about add-ons in the FAQ section!
MapForge Files
You can add $10 to your pledge to get the MapForge-compatible files (and registration codes) for ALL the core sets and unlocked add-on sets. This way you’ll get everything included in your digital pledge, the JPG files, digital Printable PDFs plus these MapForge-compatible files. 
Just adjust your pledge by the proper amount.
For example, if you have the $80 pledge and want the MapForge version of the three core sets and all the unlocked add-on sets, then add +$10. Your final pledge will be $90. If you do not need all the sets in MapForge-compatible versions, just add $3 to your pledge per set that you want to get in this format.
Read more about MapForge by clicking here.
We will ask you in a survey about your selected add-ons after the campaign.
Our previous sets
You can add-on all of our prior map-tile sets here at once (you'll find their detailed description HERE), plus the awesome Pirate and Ghost Ship we created with Lord Zsezse Works. It is fully compatible with our Tropical Island set. 
Please add the amount of the desired format or formats to your pledge level, but if you need all the three Core sets of this project and all the add-ons then please select one of the King reward levels and you'll get a bigger bargain and lower shipping fee!

The special KS price of these 6+1 titles:
Digital: $60 (Retail $66)
Printed: $175 (360 printed card-tiles) (Retail $181)
Digital + Printed: $235 (360 printed card-tiles + their digital version) (Retail $247)

Including the next titles: Sewer, Crypt, Modular inn, Trenches, Desert Canyon, Tropical Islands Tile-sets and the Pirate and Ghost Ship map-tiles.
Manual:  
- Select a reward level you sympathize with   
- As more adventurer will join and our campaign starts growing, there will be more free stretch rewards available. They will increase the size of the three core sets with no additional fee. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or on your blog site, etc. to help us spread the word and unlock more extras!   
- If you want to receive printed add-ons then please select a reward level that contains printed tiles, too. Please do not mix a digital pledge level with printed product add-ons, otherwise, you may get higher sipping fee compared to other reward levels after this campaign.  
- There will not be an option for late pledges; you have to join this adventure now if you want to get the lowest prices and the free extras. (Pledge manager will be available for backers.)
We at Black Scrolls Games are working on our products because they make our work easier as a Game Master, and game sessions are more enjoyable with them. We’ve forged all of our experience and knowledge we collected as Game Masters and 3D artists in the past years into these tiles and we hope you will enjoy them at least as much as we enjoyed working on them. If you still have questions, please read the FAQs or write to us in the comment section, we will try to reply you as soon as we can.
Why Kickstarter? 
Although we funded Black Scrolls Games, our own company, a year ago, we have eight years of experience in the tabletop game business. We know that making a set takes time and releasing a new product is very risky for a small business like us. With the help of Kickstarter, it will be easier for us to manage our work and our other processes because we will see how many customers are interested in our gaming tiles and how many pieces we have to produce exactly. Also, with the help of the comment sections, we will know what you need.

Shipping 
If you select a reward level that contains printed physical tiles, too, then there will be a shipping fee on the tiles. Although the best option would be a free shipping, unfortunately, these tiles are not lightweight things. We use the printing and shipping service of OneBookShelf (we worked with them many times before), that is why we can keep our price low and provide you the best quality in the meantime. 
Because the tiles will be printed in the U.S., the fee will be the lowest for U.S. and Canadian customers, and a little bit higher for everyone else. If you select a higher reward level and/or more add-ons then we will ship the sets together and shipping fee will be lower per set (compared to separate shipping). 
We have wider space to manage our revenue with the digital releases, so we can offer free shipping to the U.S. and even Canadian customers (and lowered shipping to everyone else) at higher reward levels!
  We hope that with your help we can make those products you deserve as a Game Master.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We already released 25 larger and smaller products as Black Scrolls Games since we started our company one and a half year ago and more than 100 products working with other publishers in the past eight years. We managed long projects, too, (some of them were 2 years long) and learned how to deliver on time and how to develop a product from scratch. Our experience of publishing and releasing products will help us to bring these products to you after this Kickstarter campaign. 
From the other side, we are working with proven printing and shipping service together which guarantee that there will not be any problem with the fulfillment process. 
Many of the elements of this project are already tested and designed and because of this, we don't see any reason for delay. If anything comes up we will let you know and tell you how we will handle and solve it. 
We would like to tell you while this is our first self-run Kickstarter project here, it is not the first we helped to design and manage, so this process is not unfamiliar to us.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backers,
I just wanted to let you know that our new project is LIVE here, on Kickstarter.
It's a bit different this time, we prepared 3D printable fantasy houses.

Dear Backers,
Slowly everyone is receiving their printed tiles and with this, the project is also coming to an end. Only a very few backers are left with changed addresses or those who didn't finish their survey. 
If you have any trouble with the printed copies, your customs, or with anything else please write us a private message and we will try to help you solve it. Please note that this project was not EU/International friendly as we ship from the US and because of this, customs are possible, it is in our FAQ section.

This is a short update because many of you are waiting for the remaining PDFs and the printed copies.
DriveThruRPG.com underwent a server migration on Monday, January 28th. I thought it will take only one day as they promised, but as a result, most of the publisher tools do not work since that and this includes sending PDF rewards and Print on Demand uploads and orders.  They said cards will not have entered premedia, orders will not have gone into production, and shipment notices of orders shipped since last Monday will not have updated in their system.

Hi Guys,
It has been a while since we posted an update, but hopefully, we answered most of your questions through PMs and the comment section.
Many of you have already got the base sets and perhaps some of the extra sets, too. Thank you for the pictures you shared! (Tag Black Scrolls Games on Facebook or Instagram if you also have some nice photo.)

updates.update_content:
Hi guys, this update will be a bit longer as I have many things to show you.

First of all, I sent in the list of addresses and backers to start the process of making the printed tiles and shipment this week. It is only a matter of time to get your three base sets with the transition tiles and the previous products, for US backers it will be around two weeks, for everyone else it will be between 2-3 weeks until the package arrives, you'll get a notification with a tracking code once the shipment is out.

I will talk about the content of the City set here, it is mostly for "digital" backers but backers with physical rewards will also get the 9 Arena tiles, cut-outs, "road" tiles and a package of transition tiles.

The printed City Set is containing 83 useful (+4 description) tiles with the extras, cut-outs and the Arena tiles, plus 12 transition tiles, these are containing 2x6 and 2x2 inch sized cutouts so you will be able to cover a quite large transition area between the City and Fortress sets.

Hi there, this is just a quick update about the printed copies.

I've finally received the proof prints and they look perfect! This means we are closing the survey tomorrow (Friday) midnight, so if you still need to change your address you can do that. There will be 203 physical orders of the 346 total that are not containing extra add-on sets, we will start the shipping with them as the Moat, Docks, Village, and Temple sets are not finished yet. These remaining orders will be shipped when we finish these sets.

If you have lost your survey email, you can submit your email address using this retrieve tool: .

DriveThruRPG has a print-on-demand service, which means we don't have to keep the packages in a warehouse for months, we send them the addresses with the product codes and they will produce and ship the tiles. It means your box will arrive within around two weeks from the time we make the order which will be in the middle of next week. We will send you your tracking code via e-mail once we get them.

The preparation of the City tiles is also going well for the digital backers so it will come within a few days.

Thank you for your patience and the support we got from you through messages!

Sincerely,
Antal Kéninger
BSG

campaign.story:
Rundown #15:  Thank you all for participating in the Tome of the Unclean Kickstarter! You have made the book far more than we ever had hoped! Trollzah!
WHAT IS TOME OF THE UNCLEAN?
Tome of the Unclean is a monster source book for Castle & Crusades that includes a host of evil creatures. Divided up along the traditional lines of demons and devils, the Tome includes all your favorites and more. From the Demogorgon to Asmodeus and all the cohorts of hell and the abyss. Also included are a host of devils and demons from the world of Aihrde.
All with the amazing art of Jason Walton and Peter Bradley.
Specs: Right now the book stands at 112 pages, with about another 10 pages of monsters forthcoming and will eventually retail, in hardcover format, for $29.99.
PURPOSE OF THE KICKSTARTER
Right now, we intend to print this book in house as a softcover book. However, we would love to see this book join the rest of our books in the C&C line as a full hardcover book and expand aspects of the book we never intended, turning it from a simple monster book into something much more (see below).
WHERE WE ARE TODAY
The book is largely written and much of the art is finished. We have only a dozen or so monsters to add. Creatures like the Lemure, the Solicitor and others. These will all be added to Tome regardless. One a day for each day of the Kickstarter (weekends might get muddled).
WHAT WE WANT TO ADD
Steve took up work on the Tome about mid-stride, while he was re-writing the Codex of Aihrde. What unfolded in the Codex opened up new vistas for him while thinking about the Tome. It occurred to him that the Twin Planes need to be more approachable, to allow players to dig into them and CKs to run them like never before. With that in mind, he's penned notes on just how to do that:
The Twin Planes both need to be expanded, with appropriate descriptions and the role of demons and devils that dwell there. We would like to expand on the roles, armies, designs and fortifications of the major devils and demons of both planes.
Just surviving in the Twin Planes is never easy. How does one find food, water, or shelter? What are the mundane physical aspects of the Twin Planes.
The Flora of the Twin Planes, with a discussion on druids.
Climate and Environs.
Traveling.
How encounters might unfold and what it's like to adventure there. How to bring the chaos, madness, and suffering of hell to the game table.To include effects on the abyssal chaos.
It was suggested to him by multiple people, including Mark Sandy and Torsten Olafi, that the book needs a random demon generator, allowing for the chaos of the Abyss.
With another great suggestion, Torsten Olafi suggested expanding on the role of demons/devils in the campaign, what are their motivations, how to integrate these highly intelligent creatures into the game.
Playable Map of hell.
ABOUT THE TOME OF THE UNCLEAN
Tome of the Unclean has been available in a digital format for some time, or at least sections of it. The book originally penned by Kim Hartsfield and was released in serial digital format. Stephen Chenault (C&C PhB, CKG, all things Aihrde) took over the writing last year, adding a host of demons and devils, some traditional, others of his own creation (echoes of his dreaded campaigns in Aufstrag). He is presently going over the Tome revising monsters (making them a little more powerful), adding content and reorganizing some of the entries.
MINIATURES
This is the prototype of a series of downloadable miniatures designed for your 3D printer, that we are working on. They are based on monsters from Tome of the Unclean. It has a ways to go, but we will get there. This Kickstarter is the perfect place to showcase it and the other nefarious beasts of the Twin Planes! It is available in the $59 and $125 pledge levels.
LEATHER VERSION
We've altered our process from the previous leather versions. We are now included embossing, stamped, marker and more. Our first and recently shipped turned out beautiful. Tome of the Unclean will receive a similar treatment. The $125 level only.
SUBSCRIBERS AND OBS BACKERS
Check your email. Check your email. Check your email! Updates with info and files are in your email. Any questions, please email tim@trolllord.com
ADD ONS

Tome of the Unclean, Digital: $10.00
The Portal Unfolding (Adventure), Print: 5
The Portal Unfolding (Adventure), Digital: 3

For to Save My Soul (Adventure, Digital: 3

Encounter Sheets Print: $5.00
Encounter Sheets Digital: $2.00
Made in the Abyss T-Shirt: $20.00
Individual Minis: $3.00
Additional Leather: $100.00
STRECH REWARDS
$5,000 Planar Expansion: Achieved! We will include a planar expansion appendix. Here we will explore the 9 Planes and the Abyss with information on travel to and from, movement, encounters, time & sustenance, and magic which will include the use of spells and abilities in the Twin Planes. With art and the Twin Planes place in the cosmos. Written by Stephen Chenault. This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$6,000, Additional Miniature: Achieved! We'll include a second miniature, delivered in a downloadable .stl file for your 3D printer. For the $59 and $125 pledge levels.
$7,000, Aihrde Expansion: Achieved! We will include an Aihrdian expansion appendix. Here we'll tackle the Wretched Planes and Aufstrag (hell) and fully discuss the Twin Planes interaction and importance. A juxtaposed discussion, allowing you to easily incorporate the 9 Planes with the 3 Domains in Aufstrag. This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$8,000, Additional Miniature: Achieved! We'll include a third miniature, delivered in a downloadable .stl file for your 3D printer. For the $59 and $125 pledge levels.
Secret Door, Gehenna: It remains unplundered!
$9,000, The Damned: Achieved! We'll plunge into the role of the damned in the Twin Planes. How they arrived, how they are used, how they suffer for their life's evil deeds...playing evil at the table will have consequence for you character in the afterlife. This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$10,000, Additional Miniature: Achieved! We'll include a fourth miniature, delivered in a downloadable .stl file for your 3D printer. For the $59 and $125 pledge levels.
$11,000, The Undead: Achieved! The undead will be added in their own section. We’ll cull the other books for ghosts and wights and other creatures you would find in the Twin Planes PLUS we’ll add a few expansions on the souls of evil creatures and characters and form they take. This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$12,000, Dealing with the Unclean: Achieved! We'll expand each of the major beings, and some of the minor, with the necessary components of dealing  with the evil creatures. Of course evil reaps its own and deals with these vile creatures oft go awry. This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$14,000, Gehenna: Achieved! We'll plunge into the plane of Gehenna and unleash the unclean beasts who occupy that blasted waste! This content is included in the PDF and Print edition of the Tome of the Unclean.
$20,000 Full Color: The hardcover version will be printed in Full Color. This MAY DELAY the book's release as we'll have to take a little time to color the many black and white images.
Track our progress through the abyss!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than the usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Tome of the Unclean Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens!
We began shipping the Tome of the Unclean last week, on the 4th. Some of you are probably already receiving them. We'll continue to hammer on these until they are all out. Unless something explodes, catches on fire or falls through the roof, we should have all these out this week!

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Tome of the Unclean Update
updates.update_content:
Tome of the Unlcean Update,
I checked in with the printer yesterday, we are still on for a ship date of March 27th. That means it will be headed out our way tomorrow. We should have it by Friday, Monday at the latest, it just depends on which trucking firm they use.
After that it will take us half a day to get this book processed in and we'll begin shipping immediately after that.

updates.update_userinfo: Kickstarter Tome of the Unlcean Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,
We have a ship date. The printers let me know that they have a scheduled ship date of March 27th. It usually takes 2-3 days after that and we will have the books in hand. We will begin shipping immediately after that. 
PLEASE make sure if you have any address changes to let us know about, to do so!

updates.update_userinfo: Castles & Crusades Tome of the Unclean Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,
The printer is calling for an adjusted cover of Tome of the Unclean, which is always a good sign, that means we are well on our way (well it's a bad sign in that I did some math wrong somewhere). Adjusted cover has been uploaded and is ready for them to green light it. Shouldn't take but a day or so. With a little luck we'll be able to get a ship date from these folks next week! This time of year they are usually pretty quick on the turn around, 3-4 weeks.

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Tome of the Unclean Kickstarter Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,
Thanks to backers, we have fixed some issues in the TOC and Scott (the editor) noticed a few odds and ends in the Undead chapter. All those are in and the latest file is uploaded to OBS (DrivethruRPG) for you to download and look over.
Keep 'em coming!

Greetings from the Dens!
We are finished with the Tome of the Unclean. All of Scott Geeding's edits are in and the document is, I trust, a much more solid work. I was very pleased with the edits. Scott found a host of small mistakes. Good to see them rooted out.  A new file was updated in your DrivethruRPG library a few minutes ago.  You should receive a notice.
Tomorrow I will contact the printer and schedule the price quote and get it into the print queue. It usually takes several days before we receive a quote back and begin the upload process (I'm setting Friday down as the upload to the printer) so we are going to take that time to comb over the manuscript a last few times.

I bought the Prusa Mk2 kit last year and got it at the end of January. Assembly was involved, but not particularly difficult. I will say that the first few attempts at printing with it can be frustrating as it is essentially a hand built high precision machine. Read the manual, read the manual, read the manual. Also, I wouldn't waste any time on a cheap "starter" printer. The beds are usually small and un-heated. Heated beds make life much easier. Larger beds make life easier once you get going. I often print over night or while I'm at work. That practice has bit me a few times, but usually was caused by crappy filament or something I did or forgot to do. I can't afford to replace my MK2 with the MK3 right now, but I did order the MK2.5 upgrade. Probably get it in January :)

campaign.story:
Legendary Dungeons & Dragons® game author Frank Mentzer presents his own fantasy world, 40 years in the making!
Philadelphia PA, 1978: Singles and spouses gather to tell stories together in a game that has run for 2 years, half as old as the rules themselves. These are the new Role Players, choosing cooperative games over competition. They love the epic tales from Frank’s D&D® game...fun and exciting, the dawn of an era!
Lake Geneva, 1983: Working at TSR, publisher of the game, Frank writes the D&D “Red Box” set and a full line thereafter, selling tens of millions of copies in 14 languages.
Near Lake Geneva, 2017: After a lifetime of gaming experience, the creator of that original campaign offers it for everyone’s use.
Loxley inc proudly presents—Frank Mentzer’s Worlds of Empyrea.
Worlds of Empyrea .com
  Producer & Wordsmith Frank Mentzer
Executive Producer, Map, and Graphics Darlene
Design & Development Ted Fauster, Tim Beach
Editing Steven Winter, Anne K. Brown
Art Team Peter Bradley, Don Higgins, Mark Quire, Ogmios
Cartography Alyssa Faden, Anna Meyer
Business Chris Wiese, Kevin “Doc” Wilson
Crowdfunding Engineer Mike Myler  

Legendary Guest Authors
David "Zeb" Cook (D&D Expert, AD&D 2e), Ed Greenwood (Forgotten Realms), Allen Hammack (Ghost Tower of Inverness), Tracy Hickman (Dragonlance, Ravenloft), Harold Johnson (Lost Shrine of Tamoachan), Tim Kask (Dragon Magazine), Len "Leomund" Lakofka (Lendore Isles), Steve Marsh (D&D Expert), Douglas Niles (City of Greyhawk), James M. Ward (Deities & Demigods, Gamma World), “Skip” Williams (Sage Advice, D&D 3e), with a Foreword by Margaret Weis (Dragonlance)
Legendary Guest Artists
Clyde Caldwell, Liz Danforth, Jeff Dee
Jeff Easley, Larry Elmore, Jennell Jaquays
“Diesel” LaForce, Erol Otus, Stephen D. Sullivan
Approved by Judges Guild
Whether your game* is Dungeons & Dragons, RuneQuest, Savage Worlds, Pathfinder, Castles & Crusades, Dungeon Crawl Classics, Hackmaster, or Swords & Wizardry, this box set has the 'crunch' you want. Fans of every fantasy game system will now have a common world to share.
In the future we hope to support more game systems. Loxley welcomes contact with all fellow creators and publishers.
When you have the same scenery, it's easy to try the Intro version of another game system. It's a big world of tabletop gaming out there—take a look around!
You’ve seen the core team of 16 and the amazing list of legendary guests, 11 authors and 9 artists. You’ve heard about the plan to provide game specifics (‘crunch’) for 10 game systems. But what IS the Setting really? What’s there now, and what’s happening soon? Good question. It’s complicated. For the long version click HERE; summary below.
History: This continent is the original home of all demi-humans, who know how to get along with each other and with nature. Humans arrived, tried to conquer the place, but were forced to compromise because they didn’t have an edge. Their realm, Empyrea, has evolved for 3 centuries. Their kings followed a three-prong strategy of cooperation: Minimize technology, promote magic (obeying the gods), Work with nature and the planet for long-term stability and health, and Support knowledge, the arts, and quality of life; avoid misuse of wealth and power.
Place: Empyrea is a rectangle. The left side is a coast with sea monsters. Mountains north, with giants. East is blocked, impassible terrain. Deepwood south, with creatures, then tribes, then evil armies -- and they’re planning to visit soon.
Below is the primitive digital map that has been available to online players since 1992. Darlene is now rendering it in her unique style, Anna is transforming that into 3D imagery, and Alyssa is detailing cities and towns. Guest authors are detailing locations... Inns, ships, shops, and more.
Online campaign map 1992-present
People: The dwur claim the land below, but most dislike sunlight, so noniz handle their surface business. The olve claim the woodlands, and many hobniz are in the gourmet trade near towns. Other ‘niz (brownies and sprites and many more) are about, as are the Others, various odd monstrous races and variations.
Action: Upcoming issues of the realm will emerge as time passes. The call to arms will sound, and the fate of the realm will be decided – perhaps by your characters! Will you run and hide, or are you a real Hero?
How To Play

Start: Either your characters grew up here, or they popped in from another place. We’ll provide guidelines for both, and three kits for suggested local character backgrounds (urban, farm, borderlands). In a starting adventure the characters meet and head out seeking fame and fortune.
Your Stuff: You bring your characters, your game system, your style. Magic, monsters, gods? Use whatever you like. Empyrea will be the backdrop to your stories, just some new names at first. More is there when you’re ready for it.  
You seem to be a serious hobby gamer. Consider this a useful tool, a 'second home'. This is a complicated fantasy campaign world, and we can only describe a small part of it in advance. So if you have questions, please post them on any of several sites available. We’re still building that part of things, so bear with us, and help us grow!  
Queen Nuana and King John IV
  With the Quick Start Guides (presenting character backgrounds from city, farm, and wilderness life) and starter Adventures, you’ll be playing immediately and learning fast. Supporting materials include the Empyrea Core Book, Player’s Handbook, full color Darlene maps, 3 "Little Brown Books", and a System Book with your preferred FRP rules.

updates.update_userinfo: My Quandary, and Turning Off the Lights
updates.update_content:
To find a new game we have to find an ad or hear folks talk. The talk is usually about the big sellers, the usual fare. We have to prowl to find new ideas, and carefully follow posts. The great game magazines of the past have vanished. 
I support local game stores and the network that makes them possible. I concede that lower prices (barely, with shipping) are available online. But I can’t try the game online, and sometimes I can at the local store. (Not at the Big Store, of course, forget them.) If the price is just a little higher, please support your neighbor. 
I love variety. You’ll find me playing and trying all sorts of games at most of the conventions I attend. I try to support and talk about the great variety that’s been around for 17 years (broad perspective, sorry) due to the OGL Open Game License of 2000, which produced Osric and Pathfinder and then ideas from a thousand other talents with a mutual love for tabletop gaming.

Greetings! This is Frank.
We're seriously discussing ALL your great input, and thanks again.  
I've decided to delay a relaunch (groan) until we’ve had more time to work. It's a tough call but we can't afford to rush. We've closed the Preview of the build area, mostly because that's now under reconstruction. Meanwhile, the current Kickstarter will remain open for general reference, and of course you also have WorldsofEmpyrea dotcom.
