campaign.story:
Rundown #12: We are sliding toward the finish and heading toward unleashing the next adventure! Caverns of Ambuscadia! What is Ambuscadia....
The Vindig River is low. The summer is hot. The pastures of the small farmsteads scattered along the river’s banks are looking a little brown and dry. A cow’s trail cuts through the brush and drops down the bank to the river. As you begin to step onto the trail, you hear a guttural and deep laughing sound followed by a scream.
And thus with such simple beginnings, the characters find themselves embroiled with deific wars which have raged since the fall of the Dragon.
An adventure designed for 3-5 player characters between levels 4 and 6.
What is Beneath the Black Moon? Beneath the Black Moon is an adventure that takes place in and around the city of Bergholt. It loosely continues the adventures began in By Shadow of Night and the Death in the Treklant series (though you don't need either of these books to play the adventure.
About the Adventure: The Celebration of the Black begins with the unfurling of the Banner of the Black Moon. Delivered to the streets of Bergholt by the gods, the Banner is raised high and paraded through streets and alleys for all to see. Everyone dons mask and cape, lights fires and burns incense, imbibes and enjoys a bacchanalia. Only to be followed by deeds of heinous nature, murder most foul in dark alleys, killings and slaughter abound such that the night ends in dread and terror. What brings the Black Moon?
It also includes 30 Encounter Areas for the CK. These can be included in the adventure, or used to start whole new adventures!
Read BELOW FOR MORE!
WE'VE ADDED
Two New Adventures
12 Additional Encounter Areas
Gods of Inzae
More Setting content!
What is Bergholt? Bergholt herself is a city that lies upon the southern shores of the Interzae. Her crumbling walls sit astride the far flung realms of the east and west. A backwater controlled by powerful merchants and thieves, where most struggle to cut their way to the top, through violence or guile.
Can I play Beneath the Black Moon as a stand alone? Yes!
STRETCH REWARDS
Backer Pool: Achieved! We hit 100 backers everyone at the $49.00 and above and the retailer level receives a FREE adventure module: The Bloody Pick of Varshlung! (SEE BELOW FOR MORE INFO)
$3,000 New Encounter Areas: Achieved!  We'll include an additional 12 encounter areas. These will be included in the Beneath the Black Moon book.
$4,000 Halptier Expansion: Achieved! In the world of Inzae, Bergholt lies in the Halptier along with several other towns of note. We'll include a complete description of this region and its inhabitants. This includes details on the cities of Isenburg, Halpveg and Kreutmark!
$5,000 The Burning Firmament: Achieved! If we hit this goal, we'll include another adventure that lies in the environs of Bergholt. All backers at the $49.00 level and above and the retailer level will receive this adventure in print and digital. Note: the $50.00 level will only receive it in digital.
$6,000 Gods of Inzae: Achieved!  We'll include an appendix with more of the Gods of Inzae. In a bleak world, men turn to bleaker gods...
$8,000 Caverns of Ambuscadia: We'll include a third adventure module! This adventure will be for the $49 level and up (including retailers)!
WHAT IS THIS KICKSTARTER? 
Late last year you came together as a community and helped bring Bergholt: By Shadow of Night to print. That was a wonderful success and we are looking to bring out the second part of this amazing city! Join us in bringing Bergholt 2: Beneath the Black Moon to print.
Funding Goals: Raise enough to produce Beneath the Black Moon as a 60 page perfect bound (soft cover) book with map. If the Kickstarter meets its minimum goals, we'll look to expanding the page count!
STATUS: Beneath the Black Moon is written and ready for editing/layout. We've acquired the cover and some of the interior art.
FULFILLMENT: This book is largely done. Cover and content finished and prepped for editing. It should ship in December.
SHIPPING: Fees for shipping will be applied when you make your Kickstarter pledge.  If you do not see your country listed, please email us at productsupport@trolllord.com and we will add it.
ABOUT: BENEATH THE BLACK MOON
The Celebration of the Black begins with the unfurling of the Banner of the Black Moon. Delivered to the streets of Bergholt by the gods, the Banner is raised high and paraded through streets and alleys for all to see. Everyone dons mask and cape, light fires and burn incense, imbibe and enjoy a bacchanalia. Only to be followed by deeds of heinous nature, murder most foul in dark alleys, killings and slaughter abound such that the night ends in dread and terror. What brings the Black Moon?
Bergholt: Beneath the Black Moon continues the adventures began in Bergholt: By Shadow of Night and the Death in the Treklant series. The book includes a more in depth examination of Bergholt’s culture and history, thirty new encounter areas, dozens of new NPCs, and a wealth of potential adventures for the PCs to undertake.
About the Adventure: The Celebration of the Black begins with the unfurling of the Banner of the Black Moon. Delivered to the streets of Bergholt by the gods, the Banner is raised high and paraded through streets and alleys for all to see. Everyone dons mask and cape, lights fires and burns incense, imbibes and enjoys a bacchanalia. Only to be followed by deeds of heinous nature, murder most foul in dark alleys, killings and slaughter abound such that the night ends in dread and terror. What brings the Black Moon?
Delve deeper into the byzantine machinations of smugglers, nobles, thieves, merchants and cruel creatures whose only desire is to wreak havoc in the streets of Bergholt.
Nothing is off the table in the desperate ascent to power of all those seeking control over the vast wealth pouring through the coffers of this city on the sea.
What if your characters were caught in the middle of one such power struggle, being pushed and pulled like so many pawns on a chess board? At which point do the pawns control the board or fall, as sacrifice, to protect bishops, knights, kings and queens. Navigating the miasma of Bergholt’s avaricious and power hungry denizens is a precarious balancing over pits of fire and brimstone. Tread carefully for every friend is an enemy and every enemy a friend.
Your Game, Your World, Inzae, Aihrde
Davis has created the world of Inzae. This is where all of his adventures take place. Much of that material was released in the first Kickstarter and the primer is below, you can download it for free. Beneath the Black Moon takes place in the city of Bergholt. BUT if you want to play Beneath the Black Moon in your home brew world or even in the world of Aihrde, all you'll need is a city to move the adventure to...but it should be a pretty violent city.
The series so far:
Death in the Treklant
By Shadow of Night
Beneath the Black Moon
About the Inzae Castle Keepers Screens: These screens are made with our signature board, and consist of 2 two-panels screens. Content and covers will be pertinent toward play in the world of Inzae.
About the The Bloody Pick of Varshlung
“ The Ifilbasser twists upon itself like a hook to end in a drab, small, courtyard crowded with several tall sooty buildings. Forefront is the home of the Agleburstin Konzern. A wooden sign has been hammered upon the lintel above the door. Upon this are painted a shovel and pick, crossed and poised over a talus mound. A row of windows stretches up above the door, all shuttered, as if several one-eye beasts sat atop one another and shut their eyes to the world.
Minfrit de Balgusser had been expecting someone to answer his request. He is a rotund man whose gluttonous apatite has crippled him. He sits upon a stool and is attended to by four servants. His hands wring and sweat and his jowls wag like flasks of wine as he speaks,
“To the south, along the Banturstrasser and through Mahtlinborg. Keep going, as if to Vinter, along the way you will find a bridge over the Zinternam. You’ll know it, there is a pile of skulls on north side – a warning. Follow it, the Zinternam. Not more than four, maybe five days up the creek is the mine. I have sent two couriers to contact Varshlung. Neither have returned. I need… I need some keen edged influence this time. Bring Varshlung back. Bring the ore to me. You will be amply rewarded. “
An adventure for 4-6 characters of 5th level on average. Its a simple task. Go to the mine. Find the overseer. Bring him back - alive. Simple. Real simple.
About the The Burning Firmament
More adventure in the Halptier! A swarm of those fiendish zjerd have descended upon Volfzberg in a fury. Taken completely by surprise, the town’s soldiery scrambled to action, manning the walls, calling the citizens to arms and setting their defenses in order. The desperate actions of these brave soldiers prevented the city from collapsing immediately and the walls and gates were held. But before the sun set, the flaming kettles of oil descended upon the city like a fiery rain. Panic ensued!
The characters are caught in a hellish inferno! Should they even attempt to save the city, themselves, others or something of even greater import?
An adventure for 3-6 characters of levels 4 to 6.
Read About Part 1: Bergholt By Shadow of Night
Download a FREE Primer for the World of Inzae.
AD ONS
All Add ons are handled through our store. You can get any number of products, from the Players Handbook, Codex of Aihrde, and adventures to the Storytellers Dictionary and Storytellers Thesaurus and many, many more through the store. Any add ons ordered will ship immediately (usually within 24-48 hours.) For Today Only we are offering 50% OFF in our store! Use this Coupon Code at Check Out: FLASH50.
WHAT IS CASTLES & CRUSADES?
Castles & Crusades is one of the longest running Table Top RPGs on the market today. Castles & Crusades is a fantasy role playing game where players create characters based on the very simple easy to follow rules of the C&C Players Handbook and conduct adventures run by a game master, the Castle Keeper. It's fun, easy, and offers countless hours of entertainment from role playing to magic wielding and sword swinging...all from the comfort and safety of your dining room table!
Read More Here.
About Davis Chenault: Davis co-founded TLG with his brother Stephen and Mac Golden back in 1999. He was instrumental in the company's early evolution and one of 3 major designers that developed and created Castles & Crusades. His active role in the company ended some years ago, but he remained in an advisory position (being Steve's brother and a prominent member of their Thursday night game), but he's returned to the fold and expanding the world of Inzae as he had always hoped!
 * Davis on his trip to Thailand, where he spent a good deal of time working on Beneath the Black Moon.

Campaign Update #18: A Demon's Tale is unlocked! The THREE things to note:
Gods and Monsters stretch goal is achieved. If you want the LEATHER version. Add 50.00 to your pledge NOW. This is exclusive to the Kickstarter.
IF you want the perfect bound Tome of the Unclean, also exclusive, make sure you pledge at least at a $60 pledge level.
If we hit 20K, Stephen Chenault will pen The Demon's Tale, a new adventure set in the bowels of Aufstrag, Hell, where a Demon has called for your aid...but the price is a hard one.
Check out Peter Bradley's Mythic Beings Coloring Book, on Kickstarter now!
STRETCH GOALS IN BRIEF
$15,000 Achieved!: You just scooped up a Players Handbook for $15.00!
$16,000 Of Gods and Monsters Achieved: Jim Ward's Of Gods and Monsters has been a pillar of the C&C shelf for many years. But like the 6th printing, it too has gone out of print. We've tagged some of our best designers to give it a solid edit and overhaul and bring it back to print. New Cover and a new forward by Stephen Chenault! This book ships to all backers at the $60.00 and above pledge level. If YOU WANT IT, but don't want to pledge deep, pledge $1.00 and add it to your pledge amount for $20.00 (its on the add on list below).
$17,000 Poster Achieved: We'll include a full color 12 x 18 poster of the alternate cover. The poster only ships to backers at the $60.00 and above pledge level (this includes retailers).
$18,000 Tome of the Unclean Achieved: We will include an advance PRINT copy of the Tome of the Unclean (soft cover, exclusive to this Kickstarter).The book only ships to backers at the $60.00 and above pledge level (this includes retailers).
$20,000 The Demon's Tale Achieved: A short adventure, penned by Stephen Chenault, that takes place somewhere in Aufstrag. Exclusive to this Kickstarter and only for backers at the $60.00 and above pledge level (this includes rettailers).
What Game Do You Play?
There are a plethora of FRPGs on the market today. You’ve probably played several of them, if not a veritable host of them. You’ve hacked your way through the simple, and you’ve trudged your way through the complex. They all offer a little something, it's why you keep playing.
As you know, all FRPGs are driven by some mechanic. Some are highly intricate, others very simple. You use them to establish the game you want to play. From fast paced to high tactical combat rules to opposed checks on interactions with NPCs. It’s all part of the gaming landscape you’ve helped create.
I’m the same as you. I’ve tried a host of games and a host of rule sets. My game of choice was always AD&D…I played it even after we released Castles & Crusades. I only stopped my AD&D game when the designers (both regular players at my table) revolted and said no more AD&D until I at least tried C&C once. I reluctantly agreed.
I’ve never gone back.
*The above photo was taken at All Things Fun in West Berlin, New Jersey, a fantastic store! Check it out if you are in the area.
It’s Your Game! Take it!
You’ll find with C&C that the game is easy to play, but more importantly is its versatility. You can take your house rules and drop them right on top of the C&C mechanic (the Siege Engine) and keep on playing. You are in control. Take the advantage/disadvantage system from 5E and use it with C&C. There’s nothing stopping you.
What’s even better, because the whole game is driven by attribute checks that have only loose guidelines, the game master chooses what attribute check the player rolls. If they want the wizard to swim better, make the character roll an intelligence check to swim the river. It’s your game. Take it.
How does the Siege Engine Work?
You are already familiar with Castles & Crusades.
You’ll find the same classes, races, attributes and many of the same monsters as in most other games.
To succeed at any action, you need to make an attribute check (unless the CK deems it doesn’t need one)
There are two types of attributes: Primary & Secondary
Primary attributes have a base chance to succeed of 12 on a d20. Secondary have a base chance to succeed of 18. The CK adds a challenge level based on hit dice and other circumstance. The character adds their attribute bonus and level to their roll.
You are playing C&C.
It's fast, versatile and open. Allowing you to make it as complex or as simple as you desire.
Why Kickstarter?
It’s easy to use for the whole community. This cuts out you having to set up accounts on the TLG website. Reserve your copy today with one easy step.
ENJOY PETER BRADLEY'S ART? Check out his coloring book! On Kickstarter NOW!
Collector's Cloth Edition
We are going to print a collector's edition, signed and numbered on onion skin inside the book. Produced with a Skivertex Vellin Cloth Cover, with Embossed titling. Also has an embossed silk screen depicting art from many editions on the cover, a ribbon marker and your name stamped on the front cover!
About the Alternate Cover
We are going to give Jason Walton a shout and to do a new, alternate cover for us. He's the guy who brought you this cover:
 What is Castles & Crusades? 
Castles & Crusades is one of the longest running Table Top RPGs on the market today. Castles & Crusades is a fantasy role playing game where players create characters based on the very simple easy to follow rules of the C&C Players Handbook and conduct adventures run by a game master, the Castle Keeper. It's fun, easy, and offers countless hours of entertainment from role playing to magic wielding and sword swinging...all from the comfort and safety of your dining room table! Learn more HERE!
A Little Background
Thirteen years ago, in 2004-2005, we launched what was then a ground-breaking fantasy RPG. Going against a decade of game design, that saw fantasy RPGs develop ever more intricate rules systems, we decided to turn the horse around. Desiring a simple, fast-paced game we developed an attribute check system (first called the EGG system, but later renamed to the SIEGE Engine) that was just that. Everything non-combat related was solved by attribute checks, frequently chosen by the Castle Keeper (GM). What followed was an insanely easy game, that one could learn to play in a matter of minutes. It allowed for rapid play, particularly in combat situations, but more importantly by releasing the constraints of rules it opened up the table to the imagination of all concerned. Now, anything was possible.
Six printings later…not including the starter sets, White Box, Flip Books and countless digital copies sold…Castles & Crusades is going stronger than ever.
We’ve sold out of the 6th printing and moving on to the 7th printing.
This book will go to print in the next few weeks, but we are here offering it to the Kickstarter community for as low a price as we can manage. This allows our old guard to pick it up if they desire, and new people to buy in if they’ve always wanted to or are just hearing about us. It’s our way of thanking the gaming community all for these years of support!
WHAT’S CHANGED?  
That is the inevitable question that many long-time fans are going to ask. Almost nothing. We’ve corrected a few typos, put some class lists in alphabetical order and moved a little text. But beyond that this book will be the same book as the 6th printing. The cover itself is part of a larger 4-panel piece that includes the Castle Keepers Guide, Monsters & Treasure and Adventurers Backpack, so changing it is not in the cards.
However, to mark this momentous occasion we are offering an all Cloth Edition of the book. This will come with onion skin signing page signed by Stephen Chenault, Davis Chenault and Mac Golden. It will also include some very nice design work. These will only be available through this Kickstarter. It will not be sold separately.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Large books such as this one are hard to print and bind and we have to choose our printers with care.

One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than the usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens!
Many of you have probably forgotten the promised Of Gods and Monsters soft cover that you reaped with backing this Kickstarter. To refresh your memory it was a stretch reward that we posted but that had no real release date as it was not anywhere on the schedule. 
But, we put it on the schedule over a year ago and hired a great writer to do it. Things got in the way and he had to back out of the project. We followed that up with a second writer and he too had to back out. At that point Steve Chenault (Codex of Aihrde, Adventurers Backpack, etc.) decided to write it. But previous commitments kept knocking him (me, I"m writing this) out of the Gods and Monsters loop. With the looming planescapes books he/me is writing and Aufstrag, Gods and Monsters keeps getting knocked around.

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Of Gods and Monsters Update
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens,
Okay, its been a long time, but as we noted when we did the 7th printing C&C Kickstaretr the book Of Gods and Monsters was no where on the docket. Well it NOW IS! Work has begun. The new cover is underway (Peter Bradley artist) and the interior is being updated. Essentially the updates will see a stat block for each god that mimics the deity stat block in The Players Guide to Aihrde. Text will also be updated, giving more on the mythology of each god. As this takes shape in the coming weeks we'll keep you posted.

updates.update_userinfo: C&C Players Handbook 7 Update (Of Gods and Monsters)
updates.update_content:
Greetings from the Dens!
As many of you know, we offered a 2nd edition of Jim Ward's classic Castles & Crusades book Of Gods & Monsters, as a stretch reward for the Players Handbook 7th Printing Kickstarter. As noted during the Kickstarter, this book was not at all on the docket, beyond some pre-planning and conceptual changes that I wanted to make on it, and it was going to be some time before I got to it. There were many other projects already on my desk that needed my attention, most notably The Adventurers Backpack and Tome of the Unclean. With that knowledge, you all have waited very patiently. Thank you for that!

campaign.story:
Perilous Vistas 
The latest additions to the Perilous Vistas: Mountains of Madness and Marshes of Malice are environment sourcebooks that delve into the foreboding mountains and explore the mysterious wetlands respectively.
The Perilous Vistas line brings the great outdoors to life. Like their predecessors, the highly acclaimed Dunes of Desolation and Fields of Blood, Mountains of Madness and Marshes of Malice are black and white, 225+ page supplements that build upon real world details and their gaming applications to provide all of the essentials and extras to run campaigns set in one of these remarkable biomes.
These huge Tomes are all well-researched and use real-world information tailored to meet fantasy roleplaying rules that create a feel of "really being there" in each terrain type. For example, we engaged a professional mountain guide, Nate Paul, to work with us on Mountains--so the travel and skill rules were in part developed by a real-life mountaineer!
The two new books include:
Mountains of Madness
Mountains of Madness naturally focuses its attention on mountains, the mighty, stone behemoths that soar into the heavens. In particular, it details the Stoneheart Mountains, renowned as the spine of the Lost Lands Campaign Setting and the backdrop for other legendary adventures including The Slumbering Tsar Saga and Sword of Air, all from Frog God Games. 
Marshes of Malice
Marshes of Malice examines the semi-aquatic world that straddles the open seas and the wholly terrestrial with special emphasis on previously unexplored or underdeveloped regions in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. Both supplements introduce new natural and manmade hazards, innovative feats, equipment, alchemical substances, magic items, spells and archetypes that can aid or hinder brave mountaineers aspiring to conquer the majestic peaks and intrepid adventurers endeavoring to tame the feral wetlands. Wondrous illustrations accompany the frightful, new denizens that call these lands home. 
What you get inside
Mountains of Madness features an expansive prologue that describes the rustic town of Miners’ Refuge along with four interconnected adventures that take characters from 3rd to 9th levels and flesh out the Stoneheart Mountains region with extensive details about the fabled Dwarven strongholds of Erod Flan and Tyr Whin. Although designed as an adventure path, the quartet can be run independently as well. 
Marshes of Malice, on the other hand, include three completely autonomous adventures that take the characters on terrifying journeys into the depths of the bleakest swamps and the bottomless chasm of the darkest souls. These horrific tales occur in the dreaded Dyrgalas Fens, which appeared in the Quests of Doom adventure "Death in Dyrgalas", the Dragonmarsh Lowlands, which is touched upon in Rappan Athuk and the introduction of the previously unexplored Wytch’s Bog. Despite the fact that the adventures take place in locales that appear in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting, the extensive scientific and game mechanics regarding these two environments can be applied to all mountainous and wetlands campaigns regardless of their setting. Likewise, with a few minor adjustments, the adventures can be effectively run anywhere.  
With the release of these two sourcebooks for Pathfinder, GMs and players alike can incorporate a wealth of knowledge and groundbreaking ideas to breathe fresh imagination and insight into any excursion to the summits of the highest peaks and the bowels of the dreariest swamps. All it takes is one courageous first step. 
So pledge to today help Frog God Games provide your players some unsafe spaces!        
ADDED BONUS
At funding all backers get a the PDF that started it all, Glades of Death!

A Druid's Revenge Can your PCs make it through the forest on the way to their final destination? Will they be ensnarled in the mystery of dreaded ghoul wolves, or become entangled in a battle between druids and insects that is slowly destroying a small logging village in their way? Are your PCs strong enough to enter the Canyons of Arcuri? Perhaps, they are even bold enough to enter the private, forested demiplane of the mad druid Niavark.  
Read the Leaves Make PCs fear the forest! Glades of Death™ contains new spells, new feats, and a new look at skills and how to use them in the wilderness. Guidelines for the rapid creation of new fantasy forests are also provided along with new monsters and four generic forest-based adventures designed to help bring a campaign out of the dungeon and into the wilderness.  
Getting Your Rewards
PDF Reward Distribution  
We will email the instructions to groups of eligible backers with instructions on how to access PDF pledge rewards. This is a three step process that is completed using our web store. You will have to create a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your pdf; it's how we keep track of everything. The Kickstarter PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by backers (as they are paid for after the Kickstarter) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via email to backers. Our process is what gets you your correct reward, ensures your future access to your reward files, and allows us to track project fulfillment.  
Shipping for Physical Products 
The shipping is collected in Backerkit. When our backerkit site for the project is ready you will receive an email. This is a separate communication than the Kickstarter survey. In that email you will receive the link to the site where you will be asked to verify your shipping information, your pledge rewards and checkout through their system. It is during this checkout that shipping cost is calculated and charged. 
Add Ons
Other books from the Perilous Vistas seemed appropriate, so we decided to discount the existing ones!
Fields of Blood-$25 hardcover and PDF, $10 PDF only add-on.
The endless fields of waving grains and scrub brush—many see them as featureless wastes, places to be crossed in a journey with little to catch the eye or divert the attention, but these vast seas of grass play home to many terrible beasts, deadly challenges, and amazing tales all hiding just beneath the thin veneer of featureless expanses. Fields of Blood takes a close look at these lands often taken for granted as realms of excitement and mystery and injects them with new life.
With cultural elements and traditions taken from the American Great Plains, the African Savannah, and the Mongolian Steppes, Fields of Blood provides new rules for plains environments, hazards, travel, skills and feats, equipment, monsters, deities, spells, and archetypes. In addition, Fields of Blood includes three ready-to-play adventures for introducing your players into the endless expanse of the grassy sea with “Feast of Fury”, “Red Wedding”, and “Madness Grows”.
Fields of Blood provides rules and options for any plains campaign. While its adventures can easily be set in any plains campaign, they are, however, official Lost Lands setting adventures intended for characters of levels 1–7+. They include plains terrain, dungeon, and village encounters and are written for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.
Dunes of Desolation-$25 hardcover and PDF, $10 PDF only-add-on.
In a land where the sun relentlessly bakes its sandy surface, water is king. In the desert, the life-sustaining fluid is more valuable than the most precious metals, desirable gems and mightiest weapons. Most adventurers believe that the scarcity of water makes the desert an
inhospitable place devoid of life, riches and challenges.
The incessant glare of a distant, roiling inferno, the intolerable heat of day, the monotonous expanses of sand and the fierce winds are enough to break the will of any man or beast, but natives and experienced adventurers know that the dunes conceal many secrets and treasures. Scratch a few feet beneath the surface and the wondrous ruins of lost cities miraculously come to life. Some of these settlements succumbed to the natural forces of the desert, while vengeful deities, demons or spirits condemned others to an eternity beneath the dunes.
Marvelous oases abounding with life and mystery also dot the forbidding landscape. Those fortunate enough to discover these refuges are delighted to find fresh water, but danger often lurks amid the lush vegetation or beneath the surface of the water. Those intrepid souls hardy enough to brave the elements and explore the wonders of this harsh terrain are well-rewarded for their efforts.
Dead Man's Chest 
($40K stretch goal for hardcovers to be unlocked)-$28 Softcover/$10 PDF unless we hit the hardcover stretch goal!  
No place offers more adventure than the ocean. No dungeon is as deep, no jungle as full of exotic and dangerous life. Most folk spend their entire lives on dry ground, unaware that entire civilizations thrive beneath the waves, sometimes far more ancient and steeped in mystery than any on the world's upper surface. Though player characters (PCs) have long grown familiar with the air-breathing world above, seldom do they venture into the depths, and when they do, they discover wonders they never dreamed existed. The ocean offers a venue for adventure that is at once alien and appealing. Strange things exist down there, as perilous as they are compelling. Dead Man's Chest lays bare the ocean and the creatures that inhabit it. Within these pages are detailed rules for ship movement, as well as guidelines for underwater exploration, and three complete maritime adventures. At last there is a comprehensive source for sailing and the sea-packed with over 100 new magic items, monsters, feats, prestige classes, and spells.
Razor Coast Party Pack Plus Dead Man's Chest!
The Razor Coast Party Pack (includes the softcover Pathfinder Dead Man's Chest) - $120
Includes the following-
Razor Coast Hardcover Book  
4 copies of the Freebooters Guide to the Razor Coast  
Heart of the Razor Hardback Book
PLUS Softcover Dead Man's Chest (this is Kickstarter exclusive and does not come with the party pack at the web store for the same price)
Fire as She Bears  
$9 Hardcover, $5 PDF Add-on
Building on the winning entries of a contest to create new rules, authors Lou Agresta and John Ling, with contributions from James MacKenzie, wrote a book to empower players and GMs to fight cinematic “Master and Commander” style ship battles in Pathfinder or Swords & Wizardry that stay true to the spirit of history and Age of Sail realities. This complete 96 page subsystem of ship-to-ship combat, includes over 35 new magic items for characters and ships, new feats, new uses for familiar skills, new weapons and equipment, new spells, and best of all? Roll up and equip an Age of Sail warship just like you’d design a new character – in as little as 30 minutes.
Stoneheart Valley $13 Hardcover/$10 PDF
From Bill Webb and Clark Peterson's home campaign comes the old-school setting of The Lost Lands: Stoneheart Valley. For over a decade, fans of Necromancer Games and Frog God Games have been asking to see the world behind the adventures. And at long last, here is where it all began, in the Stoneheart Valley near the town of Fairhill. This mini-campaign was originally presented to the fans of Necromancer Games in three separate modules: "The Wizard's Amulet", "The Crucible of Freya", and "The Tomb of Abysthor". Frog God Games has taken the full series from the 3E version plus supplemental material previously available only online, and converted it all to the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game system.

Frog God Games has been in business since 2010, and has fulfilled numerous Kickstarter programs in the past, including projects involving printed cards. As with any crowdfunding program, the time-lapse between payment and delivery of a final product is subject to various risks, including the failure of a supplier, damage in shipment, disruptions within a company, and changes in the prices of materials and shipping. Experience gained over a number of projects makes us confident that we have contingency plans for the ordinary, foreseeable issues that might arise.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
All the material is off to the printer—sadly, the Mountains book was already here in the warehouse, but has a global binding flaw—so I had to send it back to have it re-sewn (no way you guys get a book with pages that will fall out on my watch).
Marshes heads to the printer on Monday as well.
That being said, we are still on track for on-time delivery, backerkit is being finalized and will be sent in for review tonight (usually takes 3-4 days), and all pdf rewards will be sent out as soon as backerkit closes.

Greetings all!
I have three short things to bring up with everyone starting with a huge thanks to all of you for the support. I want to thank Tom Knauss for writing some really cool books and even though he was finished he went ahead and helped me anyway during the Kickstarter.

campaign.story:
How did this start?
Over the last five years, in addition to creating interactive 360 photography for 3DJoes, I have been photographing and scanning every piece of G.I.Joe: A Real American Hero art that I can get my hands on. I started with the 1982-1994 carded figures (which can be viewed on the Yearbook page) and then moved into documenting the vehicle boxes, catalogs and offers, books, newsletters, puzzles, posters and more. All are accessible via the print and licensed tabs at 3DJoes.
Once the art is photographed and scanned, we digitally restore these files by removing creases, tears, price tags, hand writing and the like to create as clean an image as possible.
Digital Art Restoration
Enter 3DJoes posters.
Before long, I had collected and documented enough carded figures to start making posters. Back in 2014 I ran a kickstarter and funded printing of 3 new posters! These posters are still for sale, and proceeds help cover the $1,750 a year it costs to run 3DJoes. You can pick these up for $10 each through this kickstarter!
Enter Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe, Volumes 1 – 3!
I fielded countless requests for a G.I.Joe art book since the first carded figure poster debuted. Most often people tell me they love the posters but they are running out of wall space. So, over the last two years I ran three kickstarters to print Accufoil Softcovers of Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe: Volume 1 (1982-1983), Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe: Volume 2 (1984-1985), and Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe: Volume 3 (1986-1987)!
Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe: Volumes 1–3 (1982-1987) with Accufoil covers
 We delivered all three volumes on time as promised, thanks in large part to some fantastic print vendors and my local Triangle Joes who pitched in and helped me with fulfillment.
Triangle Joes to the rescue!
Now it’s time for Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe, Volume 4!
Flash forward a few months and thanks to Chad Hucal, we are ready to go to press with Volume 4! Volume 1 featured 62 unique pieces of art, Volume 2 featured 95, and Volume 3 featured 126. Volume 4 is bigger than ever, featuring 147 unique pieces of art! You can preview the entire book here. 
The cover will once again be card stock with an AccuFoil print, and the 80# pages will be saddle stitched, so the two page 11x16” spreads can lay flat and art will not be lost to the gutter! You’ll be glad to know the price hasn’t changed, we’re holding the line at $35 for the Accufoil Softcover.
Collecting the Art of G.I.Joe: Volume 4 (1988–1989) is ready to print!
  The 3DJoes poster series continues!
Now that all of the 1988-1989 artwork has been restored, it is time to continue the 3DJoes poster series! We will produce two new 24”x36” posters, one featuring the figures and another featuring the vehicles.
1988-1989 Vehicles and 1988-1989 Figures
How about some pristine Catalog Art posters too?! 
These two posters are very special. They feature the 1986 and 1987 catalog art like you’ve never seen them before! We were able to secure two original Kodak Ecktachromes of the original catalog paintings. These are basically two super high resolution transparencies used back in the analog 80s to deliver high resolution artwork. We’ve scanned these Ecktachromes and restored the scans to remove dust and any other unintended artifacts. The resulting posters will be a centerpiece of your collection.
Catalog Art from 1986 and 1987!
  STRETCH GOAL! Blast-off with a life-sized Defiant!
 Blast-off with a life-sized Defiant offset lithograph print! 
Many of you have asked for a life-sized Defiant box art print, so that's what we are going for next! The life-size Defiant print will measure 28.5”x47” just like the original box art. It will cost $4,558 to print. Add in 25% for shipping and 10% for Kickstarter fees and we'll need to raise another $6,276.25 to get there. Oversized lithographs are terribly expensive, but we are happy to try to make this happen. If you want to see this poster come to life, add $30 to your poster pledge and tell all of your like-minded friends about this project. Thanks and Yo JOE! 
PROJECT EXPENSES:
$7,605 Volume 4 (offset interiors, foil cover, bagged, 650 copies) + 1/4 shipping + 10% Kickstarter fees = $10,456.88
$5,792 Four 24”x36” posters (1000 of each) + 1/4 shipping + 10% Kickstarter fees = $7,964
GOAL: $18,420.88 
$4,558 Life Size 28.5”x47” Defiant (1000 prints) + 1/4 shipping + 10% Kickstarter fees = $6,276.25
STRECH GOAL: $24,688.13
*Surprise* Your reward for scrolling to the end is the stretch goal spoiler! I'm setting the goal for this Kickstarter at $18,420, and have offered rewards featuring the first goal's deliverables. If we approach the third goal, all poster backers will be allowed to add a life sized Defiant poster to their order for just $30!  
Please have a look at the rewards, back this project today, and tell your friends to jump in too.
Thanks and Yo Joe!
Carson
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks and challenges 
I have already successfully produced the Volume 1 book and six 24”x36” offset posters with two very reliable local vendors. I do not foresee any issues with getting all three of these new posters and books produced quickly and to the highest quality.

To see the progress of a previous poster, have a look at this album: 
https://www.facebook.com/pg/3DJoes/photos/?tab=album&album_id=569139369809294

A note about quality: these posters, like the six previously produced, will be professional grade. You will not be disappointed! Check out the specs below and my eBay feedback.

Paper details: All 3DJoes posters are printed on 65 lb. sterling premium gloss paper stock. According to my printer, 65 pound paper is the thickest you can use and still roll them without creasing or damaging. It wont easily crease, pinch, or wrinkle. These posters are definitely frame worthy, but the paper is thick enough that if you just want to tack them up, that will work too.

Printing details: We use a four color printing process (CMYK), not digital. Four color prints are much higher quality than digital laser prints. To see behind the scenes at the printer, check out my "3DJoes of the 80s" album on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pg/3DJoes/photos/?tab=album&album_id=488035281253037

In the world of Joe Dever's Lone Wolf, the Magnamund, a new hero has arisen - Grey Star the Wizard!
New Collector's Edition cover by Gary Chalk for Megara Entertainment
You are Grey Star. From the core of a raging storm you appeared—a human child, ship-wrecked and orphaned, a gift of hope to the exiled Shianti sorcerers. Ever since that fateful night they have raised you as one of their own, teaching you the mysteries of their magic in preparation for an epic quest. The time has now come. You must find the legendary Moonstone and with its power crush the evil Wytch-king of Shadaki.
For only you can save the land of your birth from the cruel grip of his empire. But be warned! Ahead lies a terrifying journey into the unknown where survival or death confronts you with every turn of the page.
Grey Star the Wizard was originally published in 1985 as the first gamebook in a mini-series set in the world of Lone Wolf, created by Joe Dever and written by Ian Page.
The series plays for the most part at the tip of south-eastern Magnamund, in the land then known as the Shadakine Empire.

Lone Wolf cartograph Francesco Mattioli has been commissioned by Megara Entertainment to produce an all-new map of this Empire, available as a laminated full-colour map in the 50 euros pledge level.
New Collector's Edition laminated map by Francesco Mattioli for Megara Entertainment
A tyrant called Shasarak the Wytch-King has subjugated the people and with the help of seven Shadaki Wytches is ruling with an iron fist.
The Shianti, members of a mystical race, wish to help, but because of their exile on the Isle of Lorn they are forced to remain neutral in the conflict. However, one night the situation changes when a storm wrecks a vessel near the island, with a human infant being the only survivor.
In this child the Shianti see a chance to help the people of Magnamund without breaking their vow to Ishir, and they raise the boy in the arts of magic, giving him the name Grey Star: the star as the symbol of hope, and grey for the white-grey streak the boy has in his dark hair.
Once his training is complete, Grey Star is sent out to retrieve the Moonstone, an ancient Shianti artefact, from the Daziarn, for only with its power can Shasarak be defeated.
SOLD - NO LONGER AVAILABLE - New Collector's Edition interior illustration (section 1) by Gary Chalk for Megara Entertainment
The first book of the series details Grey Stars travel to the Shadakine Empire and his desperate attempt to find a guide to lead him to the Shadow Gate.

Now, more than 30 years later, this first gamebook is back with this deluxe, enlarged, hardback Collector's edition by Megara Entertainment we hope to fund on Kickstarter.
As the original pocket-sized interior 1985 illustrations by Paul Bonner could not be retrieved from the original publisher or from Paul himself, we decided at Megara Entertainment (with Joe Dever's blessing) to contact the mythical (and original) Lone Wolf artist Gary Chalk to re-illustrate the whole gamebook at a higher resolution (the Collector's Edition being larger).
To our pleasure, he agreed to re-illustrate entirely the book with all-new  interior drawings and a brand new cover for this Collector's Edition.
The result is truly amazing. You can see more examples below:
SOLD - NO LONGER AVAILABLE - New Collector's Edition interior illustration (section 140) by Gary Chalk for Megara Entertainment

Also, Gary will be selling the original drawings for this new Collector's Edition exclusively during this campaign - check the pledge levels to the right.
And that's not all! We have added a special bonus gamebook adventure at the end of this Collector's Edition, written by Scriptarium and approved/revised by Joe Dever & Ian Page.
So, to sum up, our deluxe gamebook will have the following features:
Large book size (same than for our other gamebooks previously published on our webstore or on Kickstarter) : 17 cm x 24.4 cm
Hardcover 105 gsm interior paper
Brand new black-and-white interior illustrations by Gary Chalk, including fillers
Brand new cover by Gary Chalk
A brand-new bonus adventure.
All the up-to-date revisions of the gamebook text by Joe Dever, Ian Page and his team of experts, included in this ultimate edition.
Thank you for your support!
Yours,
Mikaël Louys
General Manager & Founder, Megara Entertainment

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Megara Entertainment has a solid experience of publishing Collector's hardback gamebooks, with already many released gamebooks and more soon. Therefore the risks are low for this project if we reach our goal.

Furthermore, Megara has already paid and commissioned Gary Chalk to produce the interior illustrations and the cover.

We just need some additional time until April 2017 for Megara to double-check the text and gameplay of the gamebook with Joe Dever, Ian Page and a team of experts, and to complete the layout of this Collector's edition, then manufacture the books and ship them to the backers.

Please note that we have a small staff and we are managing several projects at a time, so we do our best but sometimes a delay can happen. In which case we always try to inform our backers the best we can about our progress anyway!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

What is the Adventurers Backpack?
The Castles & Crusades Adventurers Backpack represents the largest expansion of the Castles & Crusades RPG since its inception with what is essentially a second Players Handbook and a deck of Equipment Cards.
The Castle Keepers Guide delivered a voluminous amount of gaming material to the CK. The Codex of Aihrde and Players Guide to Aihrde brought the world of Aihrde to life in amazing detail for all players.
But now The Adventurers Backpack is presented to the player with content to match -- if not exceed -- that of the original Players Handbook.
New classes include:  archer, avatar, oathsworn, magic user, thief, urban ranger, primal druid, milesian bard and more!
New spells, for all classes whether in the ABP or the PH, based on an old twist. Equipment revisited. Other notes and observations all designed, we hope, to speed up your game. With the main game book come the Equipment Cards, all designed to speed things up and make game play all that easier.
Funding Goals: This project has already funded and will appear as a 150+ page full color hardback book. If we hit $26,000 then we'll expand the Equipment Deck by 2 Joker Cards, these will be signed and personalized with boons and discounts on them (Kickstarter backers only). $59.00+. 
Never  Played C&C? Download Under the Blood Red Moon for a free copy of one of our Open and Play books. This one has all the rules you need to play written into the adventure. It also doubles as an Amazing Adventures Open and Play as well.
The Dice Bag
 Equipment Cards Front and back.
Here is an update video that explains a little about the backpack from the $200 level!
PLAY

New to Castles & Crusades? You can purchase the whole game down below in the Ad On section! And if you request it we can make arrangements with you to ship the game as soon as the Kickstarter closes and your pledge is confirmed!
Early Bird info: Brett Bolan dove in at the last minute and closed out the early bird backers with pledge #172! Trollzah!
More on the Adventurers Backpack
The Adventurers Backpack first appeared in the C&C Black Box on the 40th anniversary of Dungeons and Dragons. In it we presented some new spells, and some new classes. This was only a teaser for future endeavors.
The future has arrived. Stephen Chenault finalized the content for the ABP September, 2016 and enlisted Peter Bradley to begin working on the art. What the book holds, and promises, is both a massive expansion of player-based content (classes, spells and more) as well as a new look at equipment and with this new look comes a new tool: the equipment cards.
What is in the Adventurers Backpack?
Back in the day, we played AD&D like there was no tomorrow, often 2-3 times a week. When the AD&D Unearthed Arcana came out, it gave our game a rush of adrenaline. The new content…classes, spells, equipment, etc…offered just what we needed, just when we needed it. That is the goal of the Adventurers Backpack. Castles & Crusades has been out for 12 years, and as good as it is, it could use a jolt of adrenaline.
The Adventures Backpack will include the following
13 new classes
New Non-derivative spells
A new approach on counter spells and canceling spells
34 different backpacks offerings an easier and faster way to equip
A fresh easier to use approach to Unarmed Combat
Magic Items for classes who have few to choose from
A look at the Archetype
The End Game, why old characters never die
A note on the spells. The spells presented in the ABP will be non-derivative spells (all new, not based on others) and many will follow the level-growth concept that drives the SIEGE Engine. In other words, there will be far more spells that spell-casters can use at lower levels, but that grow in power as the caster grows in power.This gives the spell-caster far spells to use when they begin, making play much more enjoyable.
What are the Equipment Cards?
During the creation process equipping a character can be a time-consuming task. To speed the process up, the ABP will include 34 different backpack options that include basic and expert dungeon backpacks, basic and expert overland backpacks and class related backpacks. Each backpack comes equipped with what your character needs to plunge into a world of adventure.
For ease of access, we’ll supply a deck of cards (34 right now) with all the backpacks and their contents set before you. All you need to do is buy weapons and armor, and a backpack and your character is equipped and ready to go! There will be multiple of some cards, allowing for repetition between players.

What is Castles & Crusades?
Castles & Crusades is one of the longest running Table Top RPGs on the market today. Castles & Crusades is a fantasy role playing game where players create characters based on the very simple easy to follow rules of the C&C Players Handbook and conduct adventures run by a game master, the Castle Keeper. It's fun, easy, and offers countless hours of entertainment from role playing to magic wielding and sword swinging...all from the comfort and safety of your dining room table!
Read more here!
SHIPPING
Shipping costs will be assessed during our survey, which will come from BackerKit soon after the Kickstarter closes. Please Note: We try to keep shipping costs at a minimum. While this is mainly a book oriented Kickstarter, any add-ons or extra books or merchandise (if any is offered) may cause the shipping price to rise, especially if the order is international (out of the US). Please contact productsupport@trolllord.com if you have any questions about shipping before you pledge. Track the Adventurers Backpack.. on Kicktraq!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Large books such as this one are hard to print and bind and we have to choose our printers with care.

One of the greatest challenges we face is creating such a large book and maintaining the quality of the printing and binding. In order to do this, we must find a printer with the knowledge and capabilities to execute a book of this size and have it look polished and professional, something we take great pride in. This will cost more than the usual printing so Kickstarter becomes essential in raising enough capital to give this book the quality it demands and deserves.

We are confident that with a successful Kickstarter we can bring this product to the world not only as a great resource, but also as a great looking book.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Your group has read the Core Rules and created characters, and your heroes have fought their way through several challenging adventures. But what does their future hold? To escort the royal envoy to the Horasian Empire, the heroes must plan the travel route, but are the roads passable at this time of year, or should they risk a voyage by sea? The Cyclopes possess ancient secrets of the forge, which they sometimes share with fellow smiths, but would a curious dwarf be welcome on their island home? The last of Borbarad’s lieutenants has been defeated at tremendous cost, but does this mean the heroes may safely explore the Shadowlands, or does some malignant force still hide there, biding its time and waiting for the world to grow complacent once again?
The Aventuria Almanac answers all these questions and more!
Chapters explore such topics as the land and the various races that dwell therein, the means of travel by road and water, the tumultuous history of Aventuria, the distractions of peace and the horrors of war, the trade routes and economies that support the wealth of empires, and the omnipresent faith of the gods, which so strongly shapes the lives of everyone on the continent. New monsters crawl forth from their lairs to claim the unwary, and the archdemons, the implacable enemies of the Twelvegods, finally show their true faces.
  The fantastic world of The Dark Eye has been evolving for more than 30 years, and much has changed. Explorers have even discovered a few new continents, but Aventuria was where it all started, and Aventuria remains the centerpiece of the game. The Aventuria Almanac is your passport to this exciting world.
The Aventuria Almanac gives your roleplaying group a common starting point for adventure. It allows new players to quickly get their bearings in the game world, while the comprehensive index and clear organization let experienced players catch up on current affairs and rediscover a long-cherished game setting. With one exception, players may read freely, making this the perfect sourcebook for players and GMs alike!
As a GM, let this book serve as the foundation for your campaign and a springboard from which to create new adventures. Game masters will appreciate the Almanac’s special GM-only chapter, which includes game stats and introduces new mysteries and locales for the heroes to explore.
  Fans of The Dark Eye know to expect deep content and evocative art from our books, and the Aventuria Almanac more than lives up to expectations. Highlights include the following:
Chapter 1: The Continent of Aventuria takes a closer look at the geography of Aventuria, the effects of weather, and the rigors of travel by sea, land, and even magical roads.
Chapter 2: Races explores the nature of the dominant intelligent races dwelling on the continent, namely humans, elves, dwarves, orcs, goblins, and lizardfolk. This chapter also offers a tantalizing peek at beings that prefer to remain elusive.
Chapter 3: The Land and People goes into great detail on the many kingdoms and realms of Aventuria and their greatest cities. This chapter also takes a look at other continents, such as Gyldenland, the ancestral homeland of the Thorwalers, and Uthuria, the mysterious jungle continent that is sometimes referred to as Land of 12,000 Gods.
Chapter 4: Culture and Science explores the many languages, writing systems, and secret tongues encountered all across Aventuria, as well as the origins and use of common idioms, superstitions, and forms of greeting. Peruse the calendars and dating systems by which most Aventurians measure time, plan for holiday celebrations and feasts, study the origin myths of the world, learn the stars and constellations in the night sky, and find your place in the feudal system (or try to purchase the rights of a free citizen). Join the army and serve god and monarch, play a round of cards, darts, or other games of chance at the local pub, invent a new telescope and dare to look up at the realm of the gods, compose a new opera and gain the favor of the crown, seek knowledge in the incredible libraries of Hesinde, plumb the depths of alchemy, and learn to recognize and treat deadly and fearsome diseases before its too late.
Chapter 5: Trade and Commerce examines the coinage of the various realms, policies of international exchange, and a new invention called the Promissory Note. Make plans to attend the local trade fair or market, but first, brush up on your knowledge of weights and measures to ensure you get what you pay for. Last but not least, this chapter takes a closer look at taxes and levies, two of the most important aspects of life in the realms.
Chapter 6: Flora and Fauna explores the myriad creatures that live in the waters, forests, mountains, and deserts of Aventuria. Entries include ancient enemies such as orcs and ogres, lurking threats such as cave spiders and crypt louses, the deadly krakennewt, feared by sailors above all else, and also several mundane (but by no means harmless) creatures such a giant black bears and wild boars. Plants get their due as well, as these pages delve into herb lore that some agencies have tried to suppress.
 Chapter 7: Gods and Demons takes a look at the mighty Twelvegods, exploring their histories, creeds, Churches, and relationships with the other religions of Aventuria. Not to be ignored are the archdemons, the eternal enemies of the Twelve, and the entity known as the Nameless One, perhaps the most dangerous foe of all.
Chapter 8: Magic and Witchcraft delves into the nature and history of magic and its many forms, and introduces the workings of the secretive sumu, sometimes referred to as druids. Topics include new Traditions, magical artifacts, magical creatures, and the role of magic in everyday life.
Chapter 9: Fame and Infamy introduces the reader to some of the most famous and infamous personalities in Aventuria, ranging from the exalted Empress Rohaja of Gareth to the dreaded night elf sorceress, Pardona. The voices of power and wisdom speak from within these pages, and it would serve you well to listen…
 Chapter 10: Myth and History covers the history of the world of Dere and the continent of Aventuria. It starts by examining various creation myths and what little is known of prehistoric times. The chapter then discusses the first human kingdoms, the rise and fall of the Empire of Bosparan, and the realms and events shaping the world today. The capstone is a summary of the extraordinary and earth-shattering Starfall, which heralds a period of change that will shake Aventuria to its foundations.
Chapter 11: Mystery and Arcana is for GM-eyes only, so we won’t spoil anything here. Suffice it to say that, if one were to look within these pages, one might learn much about the hidden servants the Nameless One and the secret history of Borbarad. This chapter expands on the material from other chapters and contains stats, secrets, and mysteries enough to keep your games running for years.
A Look Inside
(Keep an eye on the Ulisses North America blog for more detailed page previews!)

campaign.story:
ASTONISHING SWORDSMEN & SORCERERS OF HYPERBOREA 2nd Edition
The premier sword-and-sorcery RPG, Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea™, will be rereleased in Second Edition hardback format!  
This award-nominated tabletop RPG will be presented in a single tome, expanded to include new classes, spells, monsters, magic items, and more.
AS&SH cover art by Charles Lang
AS&SH™ Second Edition will come bundled with a massive, 32 × 40-inch, full-colour map of HYPERBOREA. 
HYPERBOREA map sample by Glynn Seal
The Second Edition also will feature hundreds of new illustrations, as well as new layout and typography.
AS&SH art by Val Semeiks
What is AS&SH?
Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea is the creation of Jeffrey P. Talanian (Castle Zagyg, Charnel Crypt of the Sightless Serpent, Mystery at Port Greely). It is a role-playing game inspired by the fiction of Robert E. Howard, H.P. Lovecraft, and Clark Ashton Smith, with rules descended from the original 1974 fantasy wargame and miniatures campaign rules as conceived by E. Gary Gygax and Dave Arneson. 
The heroes of an AS&SH game delve dungeons filled with horrifying monsters, lethal traps, and bewildering puzzles; they explore savage wilderness frontiers and hostile borderlands; they probe ancient ruins and investigate cursed tombs; they match steel against sorcery and sorcery against steel; and they plunder for gold, gems, and magical treasure.
AS&SH art by Johnathan Bingham
HYPERBOREA is the default campaign setting for Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea. This “flat earth” realm is hemmed in by the mystical boreas (“North Wind”), and under the scarlet light of a bloated, dying sun, its roiling seas spill eternal over the world’s rim. Hyperborea is in a perpetual state of decay, populated by disharmonious men, hostile monsters, and weird, alien beings.
AS&SH art by Jason Sholtis
What Kind of Character Can I Play?
Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea embraces traditional character archetypes with subclasses thereof. The 4 principal classes are as follows:
- Fighter: a swordsman, bowman, or other warrior type
- Magician: a sorcerer who memorizes arcane formulæ and casts spells   
- Cleric: an armed and armoured mystic sorcerer   
- Thief: a nimble swordsman possessed of numerous specialized skills
The game also features 22 subclasses from which to choose:
FIGHTER SUBCLASSES
- Barbarian: an outland warrior possessed of feral instincts 
- Berserker: a rampaging shock trooper renowned for unbridled battle rage   
- Cataphract (Knight): an armoured horseman and warrior elite
- Huntsman: a wilderness warrior who glories in the hunt   
- Paladin: a champion who crusades for justice and Law   
- Ranger: a borderland fighter, frontiersman, and defender   
- Warlock: a spell-weaving fighter who wields steel and sorcery interchangeably 
MAGICIAN SUBCLASSES
- Cryomancer: a sorcerer who commands the elemental power of ice
- Illusionist: a sorcerer who evokes phantasms and manipulates shadows and light
- Necromancer: a sorcerer who practices black magic and communicates with the dead
- Pyromancer: a sorcerer who commands the elemental power of fire
- Witch (Wizard): a sorcerer who brews potions, divines portents, and lays curses
CLERIC SUBCLASSES
- Druid: a mystic sorcerer empowered by ancestral, elemental, and animistic spirits
- Monk: a warrior-priest who strives for physical and mental mastery
- Priest: a chaplain mystic of prodigious spell-casting capacity
- Runegraver: a mystic warrior who carves runic spells on bone, metal, stone, and wood
- Shaman (Witch Doctor): a primal sorcerer who confers with ancestral and totem spirits 
THIEF SUBCLASSES
- Assassin: a thief who specializes in murder and intrigue
- Bard (Skald): a warrior, scholar, and weaver of enchanted lyrics and/or music
- Legerdemainist: an adept thief who also commands the power of sorcery
- Purloiner: a religious thief who also practices the esoteric mysticism of a cleric
- Scout: a lightly armed explorer, intelligence gatherer, and stealth master
Some of the above mentioned subclasses (huntsman, cryomancer, runegraver, purloiner) are new to AS&SH, making their official debut in this Second Edition hardback!
HYPERBOREA is home to various races and cultures of mankind. Some examples include Amazons, Atlanteans, Esquimaux, Hyperboreans, Ixians, Kelts, Kimmerians, Lemurians, Picts, and Vikings. These are inspired by pulp fiction, mythology, and history.
AS&SH art by Del Teigeler
For What Awards Has AS&SH Been Nominated?
After the original boxed set edition of Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea was released in 2012, it was nominated for several awards.
   North Texas RPG Con 2013, Three Castles RPG Design Award
   ENnie Awards 2013, Best Game
   ENnie Awards 2013, Best Production Values
   ENnie Awards 2013, Product of the Year
Tell Me More about This New Edition!
The Second Edition of Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea will be presented in sturdy hardback format, with Smyth-sewn case binding and cardinal red end sheets. The cover will be full colour, interiors black and white. The pages will be thick, durable 70# paper. Current estimates range from 420–500 pages. This will be an all-in-one presentation, a single tome containing the following volumes:
     VOLUME I: Swordsmen & Sorcerers
     VOLUME II: Sorcery
     VOLUME III: Adventure & Combat
     VOLUME IV: Bestiary
     VOLUME V: Treasure
     VOLUME VI: Hyperborea Gazetteer
Mock-up picture of AS&SH 2nd Edition hardback
Each book will include a 32 × 40-inch full colour map of HYPERBOREA, folded to an 8 × 8-inch square and tucked behind the cover. The map was hand-created by Glynn Seal of MonkeyBlood Design. Glynn drew the map to actual size—a massive undertaking. He penciled, inked, and coloured the entire thing. Then, he used graphics software to render final embellishments.
Map of HYPERBOREA by Glynn Seal
This is the whole of HYPERBOREA, an hexagonal “flat earth” realm hemmed in by the mystical boreas, whose seas spill to the infinity of the Black Gulf. It is attended by oddly shaped moons, and its sun is a red giant that sheds little warmth. Saturn is prominent in the sky, and celestial phenomena are often. At the centre of the realm rises Mount Vhuurmithadon, an extinct, treble-peaked volcano said to be home to dæmons, monsters, and gods.
Additional Art!
We have brought in several new artists whose work will join the well-received art of Ian Baggley as published in the original edition of AS&SH. Some of these artists have worked with us before on other projects, and others are new to AS&SH. New artists include Daisey Bingham, Johnathan Bingham, Charles Lang, Peter Mullen, Russ Nicholson, Glynn Seal, Val Semeiks, Jason Sholtis, Logan Talanian, and Del Teigeler. 
AS&SH art by Russ Nicholson
So, What’s Different about This “Second Edition”?
One of our slogans for the Second Edition of Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea is “Same Game, Same Rules, More Content!”—and we really mean that! In the words of editor David Prata:
     “The hardcover Second Edition includes new classes, spells, monsters, and magic items. Errata have been incorporated, and ambiguities clarified, but no substantive rules changes have been made. This Second Edition is not a wholly new game to be learnt; it remains fully compatible with the AS&SH original edition boxed set.”
In other words, one can bring his original edition boxed set to a game of AS&SH, and it will work seamlessly with the new Second Edition hardback.

Add ons!
We have several exciting add-ons to offer. To pledge for an add-on, you simply increase your pledge amount to cover the add-on price. So, if you pledge for a $59 AS&SH book, and you want to add a second book, simply increase your pledge to $118. After the KS campaign is over, we will send a survey to you to find out what extra items you want.

Please note that add-ons, like the base pledges, are for product only; they do not include shipping fees, which are detailed below.

The add-ons to this Kickstarter campaign are as follow:
ADD-ON ADVENTURE MODULES
+$20 ADD AN ADVENTURE MODULE. Add an adventure module from one of our past Kickstarter campaigns. Choices include the following:
- Beneath the Comet™ (Ball) 
- Forgotten Fane of the Coiled Goddess™ (Salvador)
- Ghost Ship of the Desert Dunes™ (Talanian)
- The Mystery at Port Greely™ (Talanian)
Want more than one of these titles? Simply add increments of +$20 per title, and we’ll ask you which ones you chose when we survey you after the Kickstarter campaign ends.
ADD-ON BOOKS
+$59 ADD AN EXTRA AS&SH 2E BOOK (S&N). Add a signed and numbered (by AS&SH creator, Jeffrey Talanian) hardback book to your pledge. The book will include a 32 × 40-inch, full-colour map of HYPERBOREA. 
+$99 ADD AN EXTRA BLUE FOIL AS&SH 2E BOOK (S&N). Add a signed and numbered (by AS&SH creator, Jeffrey Talanian), foil-stamped hardback book to your pledge. Metallic, ice-blue foil will be stamped on the masthead and the spine. The book will include a 32 × 40-inch, full-colour map of HYPERBOREA.
ADD-ON MAPS

+$20 ADD AN EXTRA MAP (UNFOLDED). An extra 32 × 40-inch map of HYPERBOREA, unfolded. This map will be rolled up and placed in a mailing tube or triangular container.

Shipping
Shipping fees will be billed after the campaign (later in 2017 when it is time to fulfill) through PayPal. If PayPal is not a viable option for you, please don’t be deterred from pledging. We have other billing options, such as Square. Here is a breakdown of estimated shipping fees in the USA, Canada, and the rest of the world. (See note below on estimates.) You must pay your shipping fees in order to receive your item(s)! 
AS&SH 2E BOOK (Standard or Blue Foil Edition) ESTIMATED SHIPPING FEES
- USA SHIPPING = $6 (Media Mail) or $12 (Priority Mail)
- CANADA SHIPPING = $45
- REST OF THE WORLD SHIPPING = $56
AS&SH ORIGINAL ART ESTIMATED SHIPPING FEES (must ship in separate container; does not include shipping for book)
- USA SHIPPING = $25
- CANADA SHIPPING = $40
- REST OF THE WORLD SHIPPING = $50
Original art pledges are packaged separately and insured. 
ESTIMATED SHIPPING FEES FOR ADD-ONS
We will attempt to work with you as best as possible. If you are in the USA and you wish to order, for example, an extra book and a T-shirt, you will not need to pay any more than the basic $12 Priority Mail fee, because we can put these items in the same box and send them at Flat Rate shipping. Other items (like an unfolded map) must be sent in a separate container. Note that shirts cannot be sent media mail, but books can. 
Simply put, add-ons add weight to your package and in many cases will affect your shipping rate. If you have concerns, do not hesitate to contact Jeffrey Talanian of North Wind Adventures through this Kickstarter page or through www.HYPERBOREA.tv.
We can, however, accurately estimate the cost to ship an unfolded map or a canvas map, because these require their own separate (triangular prism) container to ship.

UNFOLDED / CANVAS MAP ESTIMATED SHIPPING FEES
- USA SHIPPING = $13
- CANADA SHIPPING = $35
- REST OF THE WORLD SHIPPING = $45
NOTE ON ESTIMATED SHIPPING: The above shipping fees are estimates based on current USPS rates. We reserve the right to alter these fees if USPS implements a new pricing structure before we ship.
FINAL COMMENT ON SHIPPING FOR OUR INTERNATIONAL CUSTOMERS: North Wind Adventures is a small company run from the home office of Jeffrey Talanian, the creator of AS&SH. Our products are not in the distribution chain at this time, and we do not have global print partners. We do short print runs on all our gaming products, here in the USA, and we have a hands-on approach, aiming for the highest quality in production values. We understand and sympathize with the concerns of our international customers: Shipping is dreadfully expensive, in some cases more than the cost of the product itself. The AS&SH Second Edition book will weigh over 4 pounds. This means it cannot be shipped First Class International; it must be sent Priority Mail International.
Our advice to international customers who can’t afford the shipping fees—or who simply can’t justify the expense—is this: Pledge at our PDF level. Print the PDF, have it hole-drilled, and place it in a three-ring binder. We intend to explore the prospects of print on demand (POD) in foreign countries, but it is not something we intend to pursue at this time.
Final Word!
Thank you for considering pledging your support to the Second Edition of Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea. I hope you enjoy the game. Maybe we will have the chance to roll some dice together at a future gaming convention. Excelsior!

Cheers,
Jeffrey Talanian
North Wind Adventures, LLC

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter project has its share of potential obstacles, and this one is no different. However, please consider that this game is already written. Indeed, it is going through various revisions: New classes, spells, monsters, and magic items have been added, and some of those monsters and items are still in progress, but 95% of the writing is complete. In fact, a good third of the editing already is done, too. We waited to launch this campaign until the bulk of the art was in, and the map was complete. These benchmarks have been accomplished. We’re in great shape at launch, and we are setting a conservative fulfilment month. Our past campaigns were met with great success, and we expect that this one will be no different. Pledge with confidence!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Greetings fellow RPG enthusiasts,
When we transitioned from the original edition boxed set for Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea to its second edition hardback format, one of my nagging regrets was that it was no longer a truly complete game. The original boxed set included rules books, character sheets, a setting map, and dice -- everything that you needed to play the game. No outside supplies were needed, except for a pencil and your imagination. I had long wanted for us to have our own official HYPERBOREA dice for the second edition hardback, but there was always a long list of projects in development that were taking up all of my time and energy. Well, it took a few years, but we are finally crowdfunding a beautiful set of , and as I type this message, we are in the of the campaign!

updates.update_userinfo: AS&SH 2E SOLD OUT! Also, HYPERBOREA DICE!
updates.update_content:
Greetings fellow gamers,
It's been about 2.5 years since we began fulfilling the pledges for the hardback second edition of Astonishing Swordsmen & Sorcerers of Hyperborea. Well, that print run is now sold out! We are now working on a new printing of the book, which will include new front and back cover paintings, some layout tweaks, errata incorporated, and a comprehensive index. Officially, this will be a new printing of the second edition, because there will be no substantive content changes. (Last time we called it a new "edition" because we had added character classes, spells, weapons, magic items, monsters, and more.) In the coming weeks and months, I will let everyone know what our plans are, but this much I can say definitively: The for the new printing of will be a to those who already purchased it.
HYPERBOREA DICE

updates.update_userinfo: Want to start an AS&SH campaign?
updates.update_content:
Greetings fellows,
Just a quick note to remind you that our newest Kickstarter campaign, HYPERBOREA: Beasts and Cannibals is coming to a close in 5 days. 
Our two new adventures, The Anthropophagi of Xambaala (Walden) and The Beasts of Kraggoth Manor (Callahan) are going to serve as a great way for folks to start a new Hyperborea campaign. Xambaala is a perfect start for 1st-level characters, and if they survive, provides a great opportunity for further adventuring.
